loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Isatu. She is single and has three children, aged 17, 14 and 11 years, all are school-going children. 

In 2008, Isatu established her household wares and clothing business. She began her business, but has not opened a boutique, as planned.  Her business is improving. She bought a refrigerator for her beverage business that she has introduced. She is able to pay her children's fees and she bought a large television set.  

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 4,930,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Isatu has already received and successfully repaid four loans and now she requires a new loan in order to buy pieces of African-made clothing and food flasks. 

In the future, Isatu plans to use the entire loan on goods as the holidays are fast approaching. The loan has helped to improve her family and social status.  She is hard-working and committed to her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase African-made clothing and food flasks.

loans.name: Costa

texts.en: Costa is a thirty-two-year-old married man with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a motorcycle which he uses to transport people and get his daily income alongside cocoa farming, which boosts his income. He hopes to educate his children to higher levels in institutions and build a good permanent house for them. Costa needs a loan to buy another motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is a farmer living in Ejmiatsin town, which is located in Armavir region. She is a widow and lives together with her two children (ages 20 and 18 years old). 

Armine cultivates a land. Particularly, she has a cultivation of haricot, as well as grows 55 apricot trees. Armine's son takes the gathered harvest to market and sells it there.
 
Because income from agriculture is very important for her family, Armine applied for this loan.
The loan of USD 3,000 will help her purchase more haricot seeds and fertilizer for the land cultivation season.
 
Please help Armine to develop her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for haricot seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
Shoghik lives in Sisian town. She has been running a farm for five years. Her husband works at a local private company, and their three children attend a kinder garden.

The salary that Shoghik's husband gets is hardly enough for covering even the basic needs of the family, so farming business is very important for them.
Shoghik cultivates Emmer Wheat and sells it at the local market. The income that she gathers is vital for her family, so Shoghik would like to enlarge the cultivation of Emmer Wheat.

The requested loan of USD 1,500 will be a big support for Shoghik to purchase Emmer Wheat seeds and fuel for land cultivation. 
Shoghik waits for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for Emmer Wheat seeds and fuel for land cultivation.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Sisian. Two years ago, she took a loan from Kiva and was able to purchase seeds for her farm.

After paying that loan back successfully, Gayane is now asking for another one. The requested loan of USD 3000 will be a big support for Gayane to purchase a cow and a calf for her farm.

Gayane is very appreciative of the cooperation from Kiva and SEF. She is waiting for lenders' support for a second time and hopes that this loan will also make improvements in her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a calf.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva lives with her parents in Armanis village, Lori region.

She works at one of the local companies. Silva's parents are farmers with many years of experience running a small farm. They keep livestock which currently includes seven cows and ten oxen, a pig and ten chickens.

Silva was a young girl when she learned how to run a farm. Together with her work, Silva helps her parents with farming activities. Therefore, she has requested this loan of USD 1500 to be able to purchase three oxen for their farm.

Silva and her family hope for lenders' support. The loan is very important for them to make their farm more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen

loans.name: Rineth

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 45-year-old Rineth from Masvingo. She is married with three children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Rineth runs a clothing business selling jerseys and blankets. The business has been in operation for 24 years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of funding. Rineth has requested a loan of $400 to purchase wool and blankets. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to finish building her house. In the future Rineth plans to open a small factory.

loans.use: to purchase wool and blankets

loans.name: Petrona Jesus

texts.es: Es originaria de Bonanza, llegó a Bilwi desde hace 8 años por motivos de estudios y se estableció en este lugar. Tiene 32 años de edad, casada y tiene su primer hijo de un año de edad. Desde hace 5 años vive en casa de la abuelita de su esposo, pero está luchando para construir su propia vivienda que le brinde las condiciones mínimas para vivir de manera segura y digna. Por eso  solicita su segundo préstamo poner las ventanas y puertas de la casita que está construyendo poco a poco. Con el primer crédito que le concedió PANA PANA  y un pequeño ahorro pudo comenzar a construir su vivienda de mini falda ( parte de concreto y madera). Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de sus hijos y familia en general. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado.
texts.en: Petrona is originally from Bonanza, came to Bilwi 8 years ago to study, and ended up settling there. She is 32 years old, married, and has had her first child who is a year old. She has lived in her husband’s grandmother’s house for 5 years, but is determined to build her own house which will give her the minimum conditions to live in a safe and dignified way. Therefore, she is requesting her second loan to install windows and doors in the house that is being built little by little. With the first loan granted by PANA PANA and a small amount of savings she was able to begin to build her “minifalda” home (with a cement base and wooden walls). Her dream is to have a safe home with basic comforts for her children and family in general. She also wants to install a toilet, build a septic tank, since she currently has a latrine in fair condition.

loans.use: to install windows and doors in the house she is gradually building.

loans.name: Eteri

texts.en:
Eteri lives in Katnaghbyur village with her husband and three sons (23, 22 and 12 years old).

Eteri and her husband have been running their farm for 25 years. They keep livestock (8 cows, 7 oxen, 5 sheep and 15 chickens) as well as cultivate potatoes and grasses.

Eteri milks cows and sells the gathered milk to local dairy product companies.

As the main source of the family's income is agribusiness, it is very important for Eteri to run her farm successfully. The requested loan of USD 3000 will be a huge support for her to purchase three oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. She hopes that lenders will support her farm to be more profitable and waits for their support.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Fatima Monserrate

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Fátima, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 12, 7 y 3 años, los  dos mayores  estudian en colegio y  escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.
Doña Fátima es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar por su cuenta su propio dinero, por eso hace cuatro años atrás con la ayuda de su marido y reuniendo todos sus ahorros surtió una pequeña farmacia en su casa, la misma que con el paso del tiempo ha ido aumentando poco a poco y mucho mas desde que recibe los créditos del banco comunal, allí además de medicamentos ella también vende helados, jugos, gaseosas entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00 hasta la noche.
Este crédito es para comprar medicinas para surtir más su negocio. Lleva un año en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven mucho cuando necesita surtir su negocio. Sus sueños son tener una gran farmacia.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the “Mujeres Por El Progreso” [Women for Progress] communal bank meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi.  The city is known for its great diversity of traditional products such as the "Panama Hats", famous inside as well as outside of the country.

Fátima lives in this area.  She is 34 years old, married, and has three children, ages 12, 7, and 3;  the two oldest attend school. Her husband works in a factory in Manta.  

Fátima is a hardworking woman who likes to earn her own money.  For this reason, four years ago, with the help of her husband, and gathering all of their savings, she established a small pharmacy in her home.  With the passage of time, the business has been gradually growing, and grew even more after she received the loans from the communal bank.  In addition to medicine, she sells ice cream, juice, soda, and other products.  She works every day from 8:00 until nighttime.  

The purpose of this loan is to purchase medicines to further stock her business.  She has been a member of the communal bank for one year and is pleased with it because it helps her very much when she needs to stock her business.  Her dream is to have a large pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase medicine.

loans.name: Kadija

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Kadija. She is single and has two children, aged 9 and 4 years; all are school-going children. In 2010, Kadija established her Hair Products - cream, shampoo, body wash, drinks, and perfume etc. business. 

She began her business because she attended school until secondary level, she later entered a vocational institute to learn catering and gara tie-dying. After graduation, she became self-employed and the money she got was used to start her cosmetic business. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about ALL 1,825,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Kadija requires a loan in order to buy cartons of hair cream, body cream, perfumes, and crates of assorted drinks. 

In the future, Kadija plans to develop her piece of land, provide quality education for her children, and become an international business woman. This loan will help her improve her business. Slow sales of some items is her challenge, but she tries to go for new fashion. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of hair cream, body cream, perfumes, and crates of assorted drinks.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en: Phiona is a married woman with two children, all of whom go to school. She deals in agriculture, working six days a week and five hours a day, which is located in a rural area. Plus, she has a salon business for additional income. Phiona started her business to improve her life and needs a loan to pay workers who work in her maize farm.  Phiona hopes to expand her business; however, poor climatic changes are a challenge to her.

loans.use: To pay workers who work in her maize farm.

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Abdul.  He is married, and has two children ages 7 and 1. 

In 2000, Abdul established his drugs business. He began his business because he was trained as a businessman. Working 7 days a week and 12 hrs  hours a day, he earns about Le1,500,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000. Abdul requires a loan in order to buy more drugs to sell. 

In the future, Abdul plans to expand in business. He is very hardworking, and he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal, who used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle for his transportation business, lives in Kasese. He is married, with two children, and he operates a stationery shop. He earns a monthly salary as a teacher, plus his motorcycle transportation business, to add to his income. He has managed to succeed in his businesses. 

Micheal has a vision of opening up another stationery center in a nearby area to meet the increasing demands. However, defaulters and price fluctuations are challenges being faced. Micheal is a hard-working man who has asked for a loan to buy more stationery to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stationery to sell.

loans.name: Eria

texts.en: Eria is a 49-year-old married male with five children, three of whom go to school.  They live in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the hardware business for fourteen years, working six days a week and five hours a day.  His business is located in town.  He also has rentals as a source of additional income. Eria hopes to expand his business into new market areas, though inadequate capital is a challenge he faces. Eria will use the loan to to buy cement and iron sheets to sell.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron sheets to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna has been involved in beekeeping for four years. Currently, she keeps 36 colonies of bees and gets high quality honey. Due to her hard work, the honey that she gets is well known among locals in the region. 

The requested loan of USD 1,500 will be a great support for Anna to purchase 10 more bee colonies and enlarge the production of honey.  Anna hopes for lenders' support and the loan is very important for her to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: to pay for 10 bee colonies

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 38-year-old Henry from Masvingo. He is married with no children. He also cares for two dependents. Henry runs a construction business, producing bricks. The business has been in operation for seven years. He says the main challenge faced is the high transport costs for ferrying raw materials. 

Henry has requested a loan of 500 USD to purchase cement. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to increase his disposable income, hence improve his family's standard of living. In the future, Henry plans to be one of the biggest creators of employment in the economy.

loans.use: to purchase cement.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives in Ayrum village with her husband and son. The family has been running a farm for seven years.

Specifically they keep a cow, pig and chickens as well as cultivate corn, potatoes and garlic.

They sell the gathered harvest in the local market and gather income for their living.

The requested amount of USD 1250 will be a big support for Svetlana and her family to purchase a cow and potato seeds. Please help this family to develop their farm further and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and potato seeds

loans.name: Geghanush

texts.en:
Geghanush lives in Getap village of Vayots Dzor region, Armenia. She is an accountant by profession. Her mother is a teacher at a local village school and her father is a farmer. 

Geghanush helps her father with farming activities. They have been involved in beekeeping for five years keeping nineteen colonies of bees. The honey that they gather has high quality and is in high demand among locals.

Geghanush has requested this loan of $1500 to enlarge their honey production. The loan will help her to purchase ten colonies of bees and get more honey to sell to customers.

Geghanush waits for lenders' goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for ten colonies of bees

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана живет в городе Никополе. Она занимается торговлей одеждой, а именно, реализует женский трикотаж, нижнее белье, халаты, пижамы и т. д. У Светланы — 2 торговых точки — одна в арендованном магазине, а вторая — на одном из местных рынков. У нее трудоустроены двое работников. Этим бизнесом она занимается уже около 17 лет. Светлана — человек слова, всегда пунктуальна и целеустремлена. 
Сумма в 8 000 гривен нужна Светлане для того, чтобы улучшить ассортимент товарного ряда для весенней сезонной торговли. Более широкий выбор товара поможет Светлане развивать свой бизнес и дальше, при этом помогая финансово детям за счет полученной прибыли.
texts.en:
Svetlana lives in the city of Nikopol. She works selling clothing, specifically, women's knitwear, undergarments, housecoats, pajamas etc. She sells in two places, one in a rented store and the other in one of the local markets, and has two employees. She has had this business for about 17 years.

Svetlana is a woman of her word, always punctual and purposeful. She needs 8,000 grivens in order to diversify her inventory for the spring sales season. A wider assortment of goods will help her to develop her business and, consequently, to help her children with the increase in profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing inventory for spring

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Isatu.  She is married, and has one child, age 20. 

In 2008, Isatu established her restaurant (Food and Drinks) business. She began her business because she was trained as a businesswoman. Working 5 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more food products and drinks of different kinds to sell. 

In the future, Isatu plans to educate her child to the university level, and to build a house. She is very hard working  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food products and drinks of different kinds to sell

loans.name: Watta

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Watta.  She is married, and has one child, age 6. 

In 2001, Watta established her clothing business. She began her business because she was trained as a businesswoman. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le700,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le3,000,000. Watta requires a loan in order to buy more product/clothing of different types to sell.  

In the future, Watta plans to educate her children to the university level, and to build a house. She is very hardworking, and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more product/clothing of different types.

loans.name: Seibatu

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Seibatu.  She is married, and has two children, ages 8 and 5. 

In 2008, Seibatu established her clothing and textiles business. She began her business because she was trained as a businesswoman. Working 5 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le800,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Seibatu requires a loan in order to buy more clothing of different kinds to sell. 

In the future, Seibatu plans to educate her children to the university level, and to build a house. She is very hardworking  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing of different kinds.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es:
La Sra. Leonora tiene 73 años es viuda, es docente Jubilada y además trabaja en una despensa bien surtida hace más de 40 años.
Leonora es una mujer que pese a su edad quiere seguir luchando y trabajando para poder seguir ayudando a su familia. Pide este préstamo ya que quiere surtir su negocio con frutas, verduras, carne, pollo, embutidos y demás, con lo que podrá seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Sra. Leonora is 73 years old, widowed, and a retired teacher. In addition, she has worked at her food pantry that she has kept stocked for more than 40 years.

Despite her age, Leonora is a woman who wants to keep striving and working so that she can continue to help her family. She is requesting this loan because she wants to restock her business with fruits, vegetables, meat, chicken, sausages, and other products. This will enable her to continue her sales in the same manner as she is doing now.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, meat, chicken, sausages, and other products.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a fifty-year-old married female with six children who all attend school.  She used the previous loan to pay the school fees for her children. 

She has been selling clothes in a rural area for twenty-two years and works six days a week for twelve hours a day. She also earns a government salary for additional income. Imelda as a loving mother and hopes to educate her children to university level despite the challenge of lack of enough capital. She is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Nason

texts.en: Nason is a singe male who has been selling clothes for two years, working seven days a week and  twelve hours a day.  His business is located in a rural area.  He also farms for an additional income source.  Nason started his business to develop his family and is asking for a loan to buy more clothes to sell. Nason hopes to be a strong businessman; however, competition is a challenge he faces.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kideth

texts.en: Kideth is a thirty-eight year old widow with three children, all of whom go to school. She used the previous loan to buy maize flour to sell. She owns a retail shop alongside a motorcycle transport business to supplement her income. Kideth hopes to complete her residential house and expand her business. However, limited capital is a challenge being faced. Kideth is a hardworking woman who is requesting a loan to buy beans and millet to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and millet to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a thirty-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom goes to school, who lives in Kasese-Uganda. She sells fish seven days a week in the market. Edith like any loving parent dreams of educating her children and expanding her business. However, competition and inadequate capital are challenges being faced. Edith is a hardworking woman who appreciates the services being offered and needs a loan to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine has a salon in Hoima, Uganda. She is a 36-year-old single parent with three children, all of whom attend school. She works seven days a week and started her business in 2004. She started the business for profitability purposes. She earns additional income from selling shoes. She has a vision of expanding her business. However, competition and high license fees hinder her business growth. Christine will use the loan to buy cosmetics, braids and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, braids and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Karungule Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Eurelia is a fifty-year-old married woman with children who owns a produce store in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has also worked in agriculture for many years to get additional income. She started her business to earn income for improving the livelihood of her family. Her hardships are that the business is seasonal, farmers depend on rainfall for production, and price fluctuations. Her vision is to construct her own store. She is a member of a village bank where members because of lack of security offer guarantee to one another to get a loan. Eurelia needs the loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Iborooga Abagambakamu Group

texts.en: Adolf is a 38-year-old married man with four children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in a retail shop business for eight years which he started with capital from savings in their group. His business now has grown. He obtains additional income from a bar business and has been a member of a group where members save and guarantee one another to get a loan. He experiences a low volume of customers. His vision is to be economically well off. Adolf needs the loan to buy soap, sugar and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and beer to sell.

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en: Tausi is a 28-year-old female who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a hardworking woman who deals in a salon business. She is a married woman with one child.  She started her business way back in 2011. Tausi wishes to have a well stocked and good looking salon of high class and a standby generator to compete well with others in the market.  Tausi faces the challenge of inconsistency in the electricity supply, which affects her business because she needs to use it all the time.  Tausi intends to use the loan to buy braids, relaxers, and conditioner for her salon.

loans.use: to buy braids, relaxers, and conditioner for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  fish to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, a 33-year-old single mother of  three children, two of whom go to school, has a retail business located in the market. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes and flasks. 

Agnes, a hardworking woman, hopes to educate her children and expand her business; however, price fluctuation hinders her profit margin. She appreciates the lending services being offered.

loans.use: to buy clothes and flasks to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella, a mother of seven children, counts 54 years of age now, and operates a business dealing in selling new ladies' clothes which she started way back in 1990 to help sustain her family. She usually moves to different markets to sell and in addition she deals in matooke (cooked plantains) selling to supplement her earnings.

Stella wishes to have a good retirement and says low capital and competition are affecting her business. However she thanks Kiva and Hofokam for the fast loans issued out and for this matter she is asking for a loan to buy ladies' wear to sell.

loans.use: to buy ladies' wear  to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea leaves and toilet paper to sell.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is a twenty-six-year-old married male with four children, of whom three go to school, living in Kasese-Uganda. 

He deals in retail business on a busy street plus earning a monthly salary as a additional income. Adam hopes to expand hia business; however, competition and price fluctuations are challenges being faced. Adam is a hardworking man who is asking for a loan to buy soap, millet, and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy  soap, millet, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Lolie

texts.en:
Lolie is 43 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. One is school age and one is an infant. Lolie has a little store and sells groceries and other consumable products. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She is also receiving support from her husband who is a member of the Philippine National Police. She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail.
 
Lolie has been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years. In the future, Lolie hopes to expand her sari sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products to sell.

loans.name: Martha Esperanza

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, 4 mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 15 años que  estudian en  colegio. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Martha con los pocos recursos que tenia y con la ayuda de su primer crédito construyo un pequeño corral en su casa y compro pollos para la cría, actualmente mete hasta cien  pollos los cuales cría durante el tiempo adecuado para que estén listos para el consumo y luego entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa o vende a vecinos de la zona ya sea en pie o por libras de acuerdo a lo que necesiten sus clientes. Con esto ella y su familia salen adelante cuando su esposo no tiene trabajo y esto gracias a los créditos que la Fundación les ha brindado.
Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para los pollos. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: In Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional products such as its nationally and internationally renowned panama straw hats, the members of Grupo de Credito Mujeres Por El Progreso. This is where Martha lives, a 57 year old married mother of six children, 4 adults and two minors aged 15 and 17 that are attending high school. Her husband is a mason and with the scarce resources she had and the assistance of the first loan she built a small farmyard and purchased chickens for raising. Currently she houses as many as a hundred chickens which she raises for an appropriate period of time until they're ready for market, at which point they're picked up by sellers at her home or she sells to other residents of her area either by the chicken or by the pound depending on what the customer needs. With this she and her family get by when her husband doesn't find work, and this is all thanks to the support of the loans offered by the Foundation. This loan is to purchase chickens, feed and medicine for the chickens. She's been in Grupo de Credito for over 4 years and she enjoys it because the loans allow her to get by. Her dream is to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: To purchase chickens, feed and medicine for chickens

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie is 50 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is separated with 5 children. Four of her children are adults and one is an infant. For their source of living, Lennie has been engaged in a farming activity, particularly rice production, for 15 years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repair and renovation. 

Lennie joined PMPC this year. In the future, Lennie hopes to engage in business to add to their present income.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repair and renovation.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is 64 years old and is married. In order for her to help her husband to sustain the needs of their family, she engages in a snack vending business, selling rice cakes, banana cakes, banana cue, etc. Because of her expertise and skills in making her food snacks delicious, she has made promising sales daily and accepts orders from customers too.
 
In 2011, Luzminda applied for membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, she asked for financial assistance of PHP 14,900 to buy additional ingredients for her snack vending business. Through this, she hopes to increase income and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through PMPC and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Perezi

texts.en: Perezi is a thirty-three-year-old married female with six children, of which five are in school. She sells cooking oil on a busy street, plus coffee to supplement her income from selling cooking oil. Perezi has a vision of expanding  her business into a bakery dealing in a variety of products to increase her income, despite the challenges of inadequate capital and competition. Perezi appreciates the services being offered, and is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil for use in baking.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil for use in baking.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a Ugandan and a loyal and honest man. He is married and is aged 42. He lives in Kagadi. He has 8 children between the ages of 23 and 8 years and all his children attend school. He has been dealing in second-hand shoe selling, a piggery and farming to earn a living. He hopes to buy a big piece of land for his children despite insufficient capital. Bernard is requesting a loan to buy second-hand shoes for resale

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes for resale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 30-year-old, single female with four children and all the children go to school. 

She has been in a retail business, located on a busy street, for four years and works seven days a week. Plus, she does palm oil selling as an additional income business. 

Christine hopes to expand her business. However, limited capital and competition are challenges being faced. Christine is a hard-working woman and appreciates the services being offered. 

She will use the loan to buy rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly is a 52-year-old lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a mother of 6 children. She deals in a second-hand clothes business that she has operated since 2010. The business is specifically for men. Jolly wishes to have a good retirement in the future. She has rentals which supplement her daily earnings. Complaining of high competition, Jolly is asking for a loan to buy coats, suits, and jackets to sell.

loans.use: to buy coats, suits, and jackets to sell.

loans.name: Abanabumwi Womens Group

texts.en:
Madinah is a thirty-eight-year-old married female with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

She has a shop alongside with cocoa harvests. She dreams of expanding her business and educating her children to higher levels of understanding. She is affected by competition around and seasonality for cocoa harvests.

Madinah needs a loan to buy sugar, salt, and soap to sell. She is a member of Abanabumwi Womens Group where members guarantee one another to acquire loans.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 49-year–old married man with six children in living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He has been in goat-keeping for many years to meet educational requirements for his family. He has a dream of educating all his children. He is faced with a problem of inadequate capital to pay school fees for his children to have his dream of educating them fulfilled.

Joseph’s business, being small-sized, cannot support his payment of fees at once; therefore, he requests a loan to  pay school fees for his children

loans.use: to  pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a male Ugandan and a resident of  Fort Portal, Uganda. He is 37 years of age, married, with four children. 

He deals in a produce business where he sells maize, beans, and popcorn. In addition to that, he also deals in motorcycle transportation, commonly known as boda boda, so as to add to his income. Musa’s dream is to have well-grown up children, healthy, and educated. His business is limited by price fluctuations which have affected the development of his business. 

Musa is asking for a loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Bweranyange Mixed Farmers Group

texts.en:
Rose, a resident of Fort Portal, is a woman who deals in a purely agricultural business where she is farming at the village level. She is a member of Bweranyange Mixed Farmer's Group where members guarantee each other in order to get small operating loans.

Rose would like to improve on her income by expanding her agriculture business and becoming a model farmer in her village. She says limited capital and seasonal changes are hindering the growth of her business enterprise and, therefore, she asks for a loan to hire more gardeners to plant maize ahead of the planting season.

loans.use: to hire more gardeners to plant maize ahead of the planting season.

loans.name: Yosia

texts.en:
Yosia is a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda, 40 years old, and a father of four children. 

He is a hard-working man and a cattle trader. He buys cattle and fattens them to mature early for selling. He gets additional income from dairy product sales. He started this business because there was demand in towns of Kyenjojo and beyond. 

He has dreams of educating his children and turning the business into a large cattle trade to supply all butcheries in surrounding towns. He is faced with lack of capital and problems of transport to serve different market niches. 

Yosia needs a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more  reams of papers, pens, and manilla envelopes to sell.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is a forty one-year-old married woman with children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has been in the retail business for eight years and she has a rental business where she obtains additional income. She experiences capital challenges of growing her business and her vision is buying two motorcycles for transportation and educating her children. Sylivia needs the loan to buy a refrigerator to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to boost her business.

loans.name: Yolanda Marilu

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Vida Nueva se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar. 
En este lugar vive la señora Yolanda, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  16, 14 y 9 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Yolanda es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y con su esfuerzo ganar algo para el bienestar de su familia, ella tiene en su casa una pequeña fábrica de chifles, todos los días desde la madrugada ella se levanta a fabricar este producto el cual una vez que está listo lo envasa en fundas para luego vender a sus clientes que a diario llegan hasta su casa a comprar este delicioso producto, ella también con la ayuda de sus hijos entrega en ciertos comedores de la ciudad, lleva 6 años con este negocio con el cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar plátano, aceite y para pagar una maquina que compro para la fabricación de los chifles. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la  ayuda para salir adelante. Su sueño es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Vida Nueva" ("New Life") communal bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo. This area is known for its beautiful beaches. The majority of its inhabitants are very hardworking people who work in tasks related to the sea.

Yolanda, 45, lives in this region. She is married with three children, ages 9, 14, and 16. The older children are studying at a high school and the youngest is studying at an elementary school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Yolanda is a woman who enjoys working and earning money through her own efforts to contribute to her family's well-being. She has a small plantain chip factory in her house. Every day, she wakes up early to make plantain chips. When they are ready, she packages them in cases to sell to her clients, who come to her home daily to buy these delicious products. She also delivers the chips in various canteens in her city with the help of her children. She has had this business for 6 years, which helps her to move forward.

She will use this loan to buy plantains, oil, and to pay for a machine to make plantain chips. She has been with the communal bank since its foundation, and she likes it because of the help to move ahead. Her dream is to grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for a machine to make plantain chips and to buy plantains and oil.

loans.name: Aura Isabel

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Aura, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 13 y 3 años, dos de ellos estudian en  universidad y colegio. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa.
Doña Aura para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace varios años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en la casa de la mamá, allí prepara deliciosos platos en las tardes y noches, hace meriendas y comidas rápidas como hamburguesas, batidos y jugos naturales, lleva 4 años con este negocio el cual le deja lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan.  Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en: In Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional products such as the nationally and internationally renowned panama straw hats, the members of Grupo De Credito Mujeres Por El Progreso meet every two weeks. This is where Aura lives, a 37 year old married woman with three children ages 18, 13 and 3 and two of them are in college and high school. Her husband works for a business. To help her husband with household expenses Aura started a business several years ago, and has a small eatery in her mother's house where she prepares delicious meals afternoons and evenings. She makes snacks and fast food such as hamburgers, smoothies, and fresh juices. For four years she's been working in this business and it provides her enough to get by. She'll use this loan to purchase rice, meat, fish, and other supplies for food preparation. She's been in Grupo De Credito since the start and enjoys it because of the help it provides. Her dream is to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase rice, meat, fish, and other supplies.

loans.name: Las Palomas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal Las Palomas está conformada por ocho integrantes, madres y padres responsables con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vieron obligados a trabajar a temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Jaqueline y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería  es una  pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, jugos, galletas, gaseosas, fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Las Palomas agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un  medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Las Palomas communal bank is made up of eight members, responsible mothers and fathers with ten children to care for.  They are all from Sauce, located in the northern part of the country, and are known for being responsible and hardworking, with a desire for personal success.  Unfortunately they were not able to attend school because they needed to go to work at early ages so they could help with the household expenses.  They now strive to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to their efforts and desire to get ahead, Jaqueline has a grocery store and sells food in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juices, cookies, soft drinks, and matches. She works 12 hours a day, offering her products so that she can increase her income in the near future.  Las Palomas is grateful to the Kiva lenders who help people in poor countries like Nicaragua have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy urea, fertilizer, and foliar plant food for maintaining her coffee crop.

loans.name: Catalina Azucena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Vida Nueva se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar. 
En este lugar vive la señora Catalina, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y el menor de 11 años que estudia en escuela, dos de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Catalina para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, hace mas de 30 años surtió  una pequeña tienda en su casa, la cual con el paso del tiempo ha ido mejorando y aumentando hasta tener también en su mismo local un bazar el cual lo tiene muy bien surtido para satisfacción de sus clientes, allí ellos pueden encontrar granos, carnes, pescado, frutas, legumbres, ropa, zapatos, cosas de regalos, útiles escolares entre otras cosas. Ella trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos cuando ellos están desocupados.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres, artículos de bazar y papelería. Esta desde el inicio en el  Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su local.
texts.en:
The Nueva Vida Credit Group meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo Canton, a place known for its beautiful beaches. Most of the people here are very hard working fishermen. Señora Catalina lives here. She is 51 years old, and she is married with four children; three are adults, and the youngest is 11 years old and studying in school. Two of her children still live in her house. Her husband is a bricklayer. 

Thirty years ago Doña Catalina opened a small store in her house in order to earn something on her own, and with this, help her husband with the household expenses. Over time it has been improving and expanding; and now she even has a stationery shop in her own store, which she keeps very well-stocked in order to satisfy her customers.  There, they can find grains, meat, seafood, fruit, legumes, clothing, shoes, gift items, school supplies, and similar items.  Her children help her with her work when they are not busy.

This loan is for purchasing food, store items, and stationery. She has been in the credit group since the beginning, and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dreams are to continue improving her store.

loans.use: to purchase food, store items, and stationery.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Es un hombre luchador y amable, casado, con 60 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos, mayores de edad. Desde hace aproximadamente 10 años ha vivido de manera inestable con su familia, ya que aun recuerda que cada tres meses tenía que buscar una vivienda con precio accesible a su salario para alquilarla. Sin embargo, con el sueño de tener su propia vivienda y vivir de manera segura, solicita su primer préstamo para construir su casa de madera de 20x14 pies, comprar 20 laminas de zinc, clavos, madera cepillada y rustica y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es contar con una vivienda que le brinde las comodidades a su familia. Que cuente con dormitorios, ya que actualmente en la vivienda habitan 10 personas, con el propósito de ir reduciendo el hacinamiento. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular condición.
texts.en: Salvador is a kind and determined man. He is 60 years old, married, and has 5 adult children. For about 10 years he and his family have lived in an unsettled manner, since every three months he has had to find a home to rent that he can afford on his salary. Nevertheless, to fulfill his dream of having his own home and living in safety, he is requesting his first loan to buy 20 sheets of zinc, nails, and rustic and brushed wood, as well as the manual labor costs, to help build a 20x14-foot wooden house. His dream is to have a home that provides comfort to his family, and has bedrooms in order to gradually reduce overcrowding as they currently live in a home with 10 people. He also wants to put in a toilet and build a septic tank as he currently has a latrine in mediocre condition.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheets of zinc, nails, and rustic and brushed wood, as well as manual labor costs, to help build a 20x14-foot wooden house.

loans.name: Minasmayo De Garavito Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MINASMAYO DE GARAVITO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonia ella es viuda y tiene 54 años; ; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y también la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátano,café y cacao y también la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.(Los dos socios que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía están con las cabezas están agachados en la fotografía original).
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank, “Minasmayo de Garavito.” This bank is located in the Santa Ana district, which is part of the La Convención province and the Cusco department.

This member is Antonia. She is a widow and is 54 years old. She works in her business selling and raising animals, and also has land where she cultivates plantains, coffee, and cacao. She also raises guinea pigs and hens. She makes them grow and fattens them, and then sells them in different markets. Through this small business, she brings her children out ahead. Her dream is to have a fixed location where she can sell the guinea pigs and hens. She is requesting the loan to purchase guinea pigs and hens, and food for the guinea pigs and hens.

The other members make a living through selling agricultural goods, selling fruit, a grocery store, and selling food.

Antonia is thankful to those who are making themselves a part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make the payments on time. The two people in the inserted photo are looking down in the original photo.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs, hens, and food for the guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Union Pasñapacana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “UNION PASÑAPACANA” de la Asociación Arariwa y viven en el distrito de Echerate de la provincia de La Convención, Cusco, Perú. 

Nazaria tiene 31 años y es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. Su actividad económica es la agricultura donde tiene plantaciones de café, cacao, coca y cítricos como por ejemplo naranjas, lima, mandarina y limón. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes. Los demás socios se dedican a la ganadería, a la agricultura, a la venta de comida, crianza de animales menores y otros brindan servicios profesionales. Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the communal bank “Unión Pasñapacana” from the Arariwa association who live in the Echerate district in the province of La Convención, Cusco, Peru.

Nazaria is 31 years old and is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who brings her family out ahead. Her economic activity is agriculture, in that she has coffee, cacao, coca, and citrus fruit fields, such as oranges, limes, mandarin oranges, and lemons.

In this opportunity, she requires the loan to purchase fertilizers. The other members make a living with livestock, agriculture, selling food, and raising young animals, and others provide professional services. The members are thankful to those who form a part of this dream through this means and promise to complete their payments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Yosinta

texts.en:
Yosinta is a 32-year-old lady who has a food business selling Irish potatoes in Fort Portal, which she has operated from 2004 up to today. The business has helped her earn a living and look after her five children. She also has a bar business which supplements her income. 

Price fluctuations affect the functioning of the business. Yosinta is asking for a loan to buy Irish potatoes to sell. She dreams of having her children educated and enough stock for the business.

loans.use: to buy irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Gladis Helena

texts.es:
Gladis es una mujer de experiencia en diferentes campos y afortunadamente con muy buena experiencia en cada uno de ellos.
Hace un tiempo en su pueblo natal (Amaga, Colombia) tenía un negocio en el que preparaba y vendía arepas de maíz, el cual tuvo muy buen éxito.
Ahora tiene un negocio en comercialización de retal textil, ya que tiene un espacio en su casa el cual utiliza como bodega y allí almacena toda su mercancía, la cual vende el por mayor a los diferentes talleres de confección.
Ella dese un préstamo para aumentar su inventario de mercancía y así poder aumentar la utilidad que le generan éstos al comprarlos de contado.
Su mayor sueño es ver crecer su negocio y poder darle una buena calidad de vida a su hijo (ver foto) el cual es su motivación cada día.
texts.en:
Gladis is a woman who is experienced in different fields. Fortunately, she is very good at each one of them.

During the time she lived in her birthplace of Amaga, Colombia, Gladis had a business of preparing and selling corn arepas (flatbread that is served with condiments or used to make sandwiches). She experienced a great deal of success.

Gladis now has a business of selling fabric remnants. She already has a space in her house that is used as a grocery store, but she also uses it to keep all of her merchandise which she then sells in bulk to different sewing workshops. Gladis seeks a loan so that she can increase her inventory of merchandise. This would result in more profits that she could earn, which would enable her to make her purchases with cash.

loans.use: to buy fabric remnants that she can sell in bulk.

loans.name: Victor Javier

texts.es:
Victor es  morador de uno de los sectores productores de cabezas de ganado en la provincia de Esmeraldas. desde muy niño se dedicó al cuidado del gando y hoy en dia junto a sus hanos y su padre continuan en esta labor.
Victor es el menor de los hermano y esta casado, tiene un hijo de 4 años y su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar 
Victor desea en un futuro entregarle lo mejor a su hijo para que lo aproveche en sus estudios, con este prestamo Victor comprará 2 terneras para poderlas reproducir y crecer en su trea de ganadero.
Victor ama mucho a su familia y comparte con amigos en su tipo libre jugando boley ball.
texts.en:
Victor is an inhabitant of one of the cattle-producing areas of the province of Esmeraldas. Since a very young age he has been caring for cattle and today, he continues this work together with his brothers and father. Victor is the youngest of his siblings and is married with a four-year-old son. His wife takes care of the household tasks. Victor hopes to provide the best for his son in the future so he can get the most out of his studies.

With this loan Victor will buy two calves which can reproduce so he can grow his herd of cattle. Victor loves his family very much and enjoys playing volleyball with his friends in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Las Amistosas Group

texts.es: Gladys pertenece al grupo “Las Amistosas” es madre soltera de tres hijos, uno de 9 años que aun va a la escuela, Gladys es cosmetóloga  atiende aproximadamente de 25 a 30 personas, se dedica 13 horas diarias al negocio,  brinda servicios de  cortes, tintes, peinados, ondulaciones y mas, sus principales clientes son la personas de la zona, el préstamo que solicito de EDAPROSPO  le ayudo mucho a implementar su salón de belleza en la compra de vitrinas para poder exhibir sus productos. Gladys tuvo que pasar muchos obstáculos entre ellos la separación con su pareja que la dejo con deudas que tuvo que pagar sola, Gladys se siente feliz porque ha podido salir adelante  ya que su inspiración son sus hijos, Agradece a KIVA por la confianza obtenida y promete no defraudarlos.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Las Amistosas [Friendly Women] group. She is a single mother with 3 children, one of whom is 9 years old and still goes to school. Gladys is a beautician, has approximately 25 to 30 customers and works 13 hours a day in her business. She cuts, dyes, combs, and curls hair and more. Her main customers are the people of the area.

The loan that she requested from EDAPROSPO helped her to improve her beauty salon, purchasing of cabinets to be able to exhibit her products. Gladys had to go through many obstacles, including the separation from her partner, which left her with debts that she had to pay by herself. Gladys is happy because she has managed to get ahead with her children as her inspiration. She thanks Kiva for the confidence deposited in her and promises not to let you down.

loans.use: to purchase cabinets to be able to exhibit her products

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is a 30-year-old gentleman who lives in Fort Portal.  He farms maize, and also sells milk and firewood. He works 10 hours a day and says he started the business to supplement his income. He wishes to have a well built house. 

Hillary complains of unpredictable seasonal changes that affect his businesses. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds of maize for planting and to pay for labour.

loans.use: to buy seeds of maize for planting and to pay for labour.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William a 48-year-old man who is married with children and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He has been in the business of growing sugar cane for 15 years in the rural areas of Kyenjojo. He obtains additional income from keeping cattle. 

William is faced with lack of capital to buy a sugar cane crushing machine to make Waragi, a local alcohol, and to expand his sugar cane farm to a larger plantation. William is requesting a loan to buy a sugar cane crushing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sugar cane crushing machine.

loans.name: María Eugenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
María es una mujer pujante y trabajadora de 58 años de edad, que siempre ha velado por el bienestar de su familia.
Durante 20 años de su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo mercancía variada como ropa, accesorios, ropa interior, entre otros; trabaja sola todos los días de la semana y su principal clientela está conformada por familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de surtido al por mayor (jeans, camisas, accesorios, perfumería) esto le permitirá tener más variedad de artículos disponibles para satisfacer los diversos gustos de su clientela y mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
María manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener la capacidad física y económica para montar un almacén en un local abierto al público, en el que pueda vender todos sus productos y prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, así podrá garantizar una estabilidad económica para disfrutar una vejez digna y con buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, age 58, is a vibrant and hardworking woman who is always looking after the welfare of her family. For the past 20 years of her life, she has worked as an independent merchant. She sells a variety of merchandise such as clothing, accessories, undergarments, and other items. María works alone every day and her main customers include relatives, friends, and neighbors in her area.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of inventory in bulk (jeans, shirts, accessories, and perfumes). This will enable her to have a wider variety of products on hand so that she can satisfy the various tastes of her customers. As a result, the income she generates from her work will improve.

María says that her greatest wish is to have the physical and financial capacity to establish a shop in a public open space where she can sell all of her products and provide better service to her customers. This would guarantee her financial stability so that she can enjoy a decent retirement and a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, accessories, and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 38-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He sells clothes for children and bed sheets on one of the busiest streets in town. His customers are the surrounding population and Congolese people at the boarder. 

His main business challenges are people not paying on time and inadequate capital for his business. He dreams of having a big shopping centre in the area. Isaac intends to use the loan to buy more children's clothes and bed sheets to sell.

loans.use: to buy more children's clothing and bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: María Nubia

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy emprendedora y dedicada a su familia. Ella es el digno ejemplo de una mujer luchadora y perseverante.
Vive junto a su esposo en una pequeña vivienda ubicada en Santa Elena (Colombia) y allí tiene un cultivo de flores y papa, además de otros alimentos que posteriormente venden en una chaza en la plaza de mercado de la región.
Ella trabaja la tierra en compañía de su esposo y así se ganan la vida.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar semillas de distintos tipos de flores y así poder sembrarlas para aprovechar las temporadas como el Día de las Madres y San Valentín.
Esto le permitirá vender una mayor cantidad de flores y obtener un aumento en sus ingresos.
Así que Maria es una de las mujeres que todos los días están llenando este mundo de color y aromas deliciosos, haciendo de cada instante un momento inolvidable con sus flores.
texts.en: Maria is a very enterprising woman who is dedicated to her family. She is a worthy example of a fighter and persevering woman. She lives with her husband in a small house located in Santa Elena (Colombia), and there is a flower farm and potatoes, and other foods that she later sells in the marketplace in the region.  She works the land with her husband to earn a living. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds of different types of flowers and be able to take advantage of flower seasons such as Mother's Day and Valentine's. This allows her to sell more flowers and increase her income. Maria is one of the women who every day is filling this world with color and wonderful smells, making each moment unforgettable with her flowers.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow flowers

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Mariama. She is married and has five children aged 14, 11, 9, 6 and 3 years. Three of her children are going to school. 

In 2011, Mariama established her own business. She earns about Le 2,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mariama has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy gallons of palm oil, cooking oil and bags of rice. She has started her building project and rented another shop which she has let out to other business people on rental.  She is very hardworking and friendly. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his business.

loans.name: Fatmata G

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Fatmata G. She is married, and has five children aged 20, 16, 11, 8 and 4 years. Four of her children are going to school. Fatmata G owns a textiles business selling wax and dry cotton and lace materials. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, Fatmata G earns about Le 2,725,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Fatmata G has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bales of wax cotton and lace materials. 

In the future, Fatmata G plans to rent a shop. She has bought a piece a land but  was unable to rent a shop and buy a car because of capital. She is very hardworking and friendly. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of wax cotton and lace materials

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Mohamed. He is single, and has no children. In 2009, Mohamed established his spare parts business buying and selling engine oil, fuel pump, fuel filter, gasket, batteries, piston and rings, brake pads, etc. 

He began his business because he used to assist someone in the same business after school. Upon completion, he became interested in the business. His father gave him some money to start this business which has now grown. 

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy drums of engine oil, batteries for vehicles and rings. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to travel to Dubai to buy his stock. This loan will help to generate more profit. High transportation cost and some debtors that will not pay their debt as agreed are his main challenges.  He is friendly and determined.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drums of engine oil, batteries for vehicles and rings.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Abibatu. She is married and has four children aged 12, 8, 5, and 1 year old. Three children are school-going.  

Abibatu owns a business. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 3,555,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Abibatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to purchase bags of dry pepper, rubbers of palm oil, bags of beans, and bags of kola nuts.  

In the future, Abibatu plans to expand her business. She believes that the Association for Rural Development (ARD) has enabled her to gain a strong financial backing.  The loan will be a great help to her, and she looks forward to subsequent loans.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more local food stuff.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es: Es un hombre luchador y amable, con 3 hijos (2 varones y 1 niña), de los cuales 2 se encuentran en edad escolar; tiene 51 años, desde hace aproximadamente 32 años vive en una casita de madera y tambo, con un solo espacio, viviendo en hacinamiento con su familia. Con el propósito de tener su vivienda de concreto y que su familia viva de manera segura y digna solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar materiales para techar y poner las ventanas y puertas de su vivienda que está construyendo poco a poco. Con el financiamiento anterior otorgado por PANA PANA, pudo construir las paredes de su casa. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de sus hijos y familia en general. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado y construir los dormitorios para su familia. También sueña tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
He is a 51-year-old man who is friendly and a fighter. He has three children (2 boys and one girl). two of whom are school aged. For approximately 32 years he has lived in a small house made of wood. It is a crowded place for he and his family to live as it is a one-room house.

He is requesting this second loan with the plan of having a concrete house that he and his family can live in with security and dignity. He will buy materials to do roofing and install windows and doors into his house that he is building little by little. With the previous loan offered by PANA PANA he was able to build the walls of his house.

His dream is to have a safe house with the basic conditions for his children's comfort and that of his family in general. He wants improve his house further with a toilet and by constructing a septic tank (right now he has a latrine) and bedrooms for his family. He also dreams of having his own business.

loans.use: to buy materials to do roofing and install windows and doors in his house that he is building little by little.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 21-year-old single young man from Deir el Balah. He lives with his family in a small house. 

Hasan has raised sheep at his small farm for the past four years. It is a good business and earns a good income. Hasan would like to improve his business and expand it.

He took a Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his farm. By taking this loan, Hasan will be able to improve his business and increase his productivity. 

Hasan appears in the photo at his farm.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his farm.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia es peluquera y a la vez estudia, es una persona con ganas de superarse, y poder salir adelante.
Ella es muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira a ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando, es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de Administración de empresas, y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas de la universidad y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Amelia is a hairdresser who is studying at the same time. She is an individual who has the drive to succeed and the ability to move forward.

Amelia is very responsible and devoted to her studies and her family. She aspires to become a successful professional and to continue her studies. For this reason, she is studying for a degree in Business Administration. As a result of her studies, she would like to be able to help her loved ones.

Amelia is requesting a loan in order to cover her university fees so that she can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a a solar water heater

loans.name: Ermitanio

texts.es: Hermitanio se dedica a la construcción de casas, pistas, obras y otras cosas más por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar útiles de escritorio como papeles, lapiceros, cuadernos y otros para el control de sus obras y materiales de trabajo, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. Él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Hermitanio works building houses, roads, and other projects, so this time he is requesting a loan to buy office supplies like paper, pencils, notebooks, and other items to control his work and work materials. He is grateful to everyone who is a part of this dream by making these resources possible. He appreciates this loan and promises to pay his monthly installments responsibly. He belongs to the communal bank San Martincito of Asociación Arariwa, in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy office supplies like paper, pencils, notebooks and other items.

loans.name: Esilda

texts.es: Esilda con su anterior credikiva fortaleció sus dos negocios, porque logró surtir de mercancías variadas uno de ellos y todo lo vendió y por otro lado aumentó su producción de comidas porque también compró insumos alimentarios para ello. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva mediante el cual comprará mercancía para financiar la cartera de su clientela, por eso extenderá sus plazos de crédito. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Gracias por su colaboración que me ha servido de mucho"
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Esilda was able to strengthen her two businesses. She was able to restock one business with various merchandise and ended up selling everything. For her other business, she was able to increase her food production since was able to buy ingredients for making her products.

Esilda is currently applying for another Kiva loan so that she can buy merchandise for her customers since she extends credit to them. She would like to say to the Kiva lenders, “Thank you for your assistance, as it has helped me a lot."

loans.use: to buy merchandise that she can sell to her customers on credit.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Haja.  She is married and has two children aged 11 and 3 years old. One of her children is going to school.

In 2010, Haja established her household utensils business. She began her business as she dropped out of school at Senior Secondary level because life was so difficult for her family that they could not provide their basic needs. Knowing that her parents could not afford to continue paying her school fees, she was engaged in petty trading. She traded from one business to another for several years until she got married.  

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,053,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Haja requires a loan in order to purchase cartons of hot pot dishes and flasks. In the future, Haja plans to expand her business and acquire a large business premises. She has one major competitor. She is very hardworking and friendly. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of hot pot dishes and flasks.

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Abdul Karim. He is married and has two children aged 15 and 10 years, both of whom are school going children.

In 2004, Abdul Karim established his building materials business. He began his business because after his secondary education, he had no financial support to help him through university. With the help of a relative, he engaged in the service of a shop assistant. He gained a lot of experience over the years and later started his own petty trade through the assistance of friends and his business has grown over the years.  

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 4,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Abdul Karim requires a loan in order to purchase tons of electric wires, cartons of lamp holders, tons of iron rods. In the future, Abdul Karim plans to expand his business. The loan is an additional income which will be able to buy goods that of great demand and will enable him to gain and retain customers. He is hardworking and competitive. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase tons of electric wires, cartons of lamp holders, tons of iron rods.

loans.name: Flor Alba

texts.es: Alba  es una señora extranjera residente en la provincia del Carchi, donde Alba comenta que es un lugar tranquilo para vivir, ella tiene 49 años de edad y se dedica a criar pollos  desde hace 5 años pero también trabaja al jornal, Alba tiene un hijo de 11 años el que asiste a la escuela y es muy aplicado, su madre valora mucho el esfuerzo de su hijo y le gustaría que su negocio sea lo suficientemente rentable para que le alcance cubrir los gastos de educación, alimento y vestido de su hijo, el cerdito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para seguir adelante con su negocio
texts.en:
Alba is a foreign woman, a resident of the Carchi province which she says is a quiet place to live.  She is 49 years old and has made a living raising chickens for five years, but she also works as a day-laborer.  

Alba has an 11-year-old son who attends school and is very studious.  His mother greatly appreciates her son's efforts and would like for her business to be profitable enough so that she can cover the expenses of education, nourishment, and clothing for her son.  Alba is going to use the loan to purchase chickens so that she can keep moving forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: La Colmena Group

texts.es:
BOLIVAR, alquila una casa en un barrio vulnerable de San Lorenzo, vive con su esposa y su pequeña y única hija de 4 años.
Bolívar desde hace muchos años se dedica a la albañilería no es trabajo fijo y en ocasiones debe esperar varias semanas para poder encontrar tarea.
Su esposa tiene un 70% de discapacidad, oportunamente trabaja en una oficina realizando el aseo. 
Con este préstamo Bolívar, comprara herramientas que faciliten sus tareas de albañil, (pala, bailejos, moledora, metro, martillo, cortadora  y taladro)  a un corto plazo, Bolívar espera adquirir una mezcladora, con la que formará su propio equipo de albañilería, dando trabajo a otras personas y obteniendo mejores ingresos.
Desea apoyar de mil maneras a su pequeña hija, quien muestra dotes de presentadora de noticias y Bolívar espera que se convierta en una gran periodista.
INFORMACION ADICIONAL
Bolívar es integrante del grupo “LA COLMENA”, formado por 9 personas, quienes realizan diferentes actividades y que recibirán entre $500 y $1500 cada una según la antigüedad en el grupo, cabe indicar que los anteriores prestamos los pagaron normalmente y están seguros de tener el mismo comportamiento de pago en el presente crédito.
texts.en:
Bolívar rents a house in a poor neighborhood of San Lorenzo. He lives with his wife and his only daughter who is 4 years old. For many years Bolivar has worked as a bricklayer. it is not steady work and at times he has had to wait for weeks to find work. His wife is 70 % disabled. Fortunately she works in an office doing the cleaning. 

Bolívar will use this loan to buy tools which will help him in his work as a bricklayer (a shovel, trowels, a drill, a grinder, a hammer, a saw and a tape measure). In the short term he hopes to acquire a mixer so that he can form his own bricklaying team, providing work to others and generating more income. 

He wants to give support to his daughter in a thousand ways. She shows promise as a news-presenter and Bolívar hopes she becomes a great journalist.
