The A.C. "Chamanpi Satasiñani" began its eighth cycle of "Pro Mujer" as part of the focus of German Busch. It is made of 8 members and is run by a board in which Señora Nelfy is the President. The businesses that the members of the community association run are varied, and among them are: a neighborhood store, a sweets shop, a grocery store, a stuffed animal seller, food sales, a beauty salon, and a sewing workshop.

The loan that they will take will benefit the microentrepreneurs who are constituents of Señora Nelfy. She states that it has been a year since she joined Pro Mujer, which she joined at the invitation of her sister who is a partner in the institution. Additionally, she owns a sweets shop; she discloses that she learned this business from her family that markets the same products, and at last she decided to undertake her own business.

The loan that she will take now is for capital increase (to buy sweets wholesale) that she will acquire from the Bolivia - Peru border, and afterwards she will market them on request. This type of work allows her to generate resources to help herself because she is a student and needs financial assistance.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the unity of her companions from the "Banca Comunal" (communal bank).

loans.use: to buy wholesale sweets.

loans.name: Fortin Toledo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Fortín Toledo está en su 3º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo que ellas vienen haciendo, están mejorando las condiciones de vida de ellas y sus familias.
Myrian es parte de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy emprendedora, que a través de su esfuerzo diario y a las ganas que está poniendo por crecer es que está saliendo adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzados varios y comenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre de manera fija compran de ella sus productos. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar una mayor variedad de calzados, lo que le ayudará a seguir con sus ventas y poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo para luchar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The women´s group “Fortin Toledo” is in its third cycle and all its members are committed to working hard and helping each other to get on in life. They are taking the poverty elimination survey.  Thanks to the work they have accomplished, they are improving their quality of life.

Myrian is part of the group.  She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who thanks to her daily effort, is managing to succeed.  She sells footwear and has a very good customer base that always comes to her to buy her products.  

She is asking for this loan to buy a wider range of footwear so her sales continue, which allows her to be able to look after her family and give them all that she never had when she was younger.  She is grateful for the support that she gets to continue working hard to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy footwear for resale.

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Agustín está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Fidelina, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que tiene venta de lencería, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Fidelina solicita de este préstamo para la compra de lencerías para damas, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The women´s group “San Agustin” is in its first cycle and all its members work hard and help each other to get on in life.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and have found that two members live below the poverty line.

One of the members is Fidelina, who in the latest survey found that she was at level two in the poverty classification.  Apart from the business she has selling lingerie; she also highlights the work the advisors do, looking after the training on offer and carrying out audits, as well as encouraging the women to strive to overcome their poverty.

Fidelina is asking for a loan to buy lingerie which will help her develop her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy women´s underwear for resale.

loans.name: San Francsico Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Jóvenes  Emprendedores que lleva el nombre de San Francisco  se encuentra en el 1er. Ciclo del programa cuenta con 7 integrantes actualmente, es un grupo muy responsable,solidario , se ayudan entre sí .
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es del joven Jorge de 16 años, él se dedica a la venta de productos varios por la ciudad de y sus alrededores. Es un joven que quiere poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos, dando un pequeño aporte y así sentirse útil.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas y zapatos para la venta, que le permitirá seguir con su trabajo  y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This group of Young Entrepreneurs is named San Francisco. This cycle's program currently has 7 members. 
The group is very responsible and show their solidarity by helping one another.

One of the note worthy stories is young Jorge, 16, who sells several products around the city and its surroundings. 
He is a young man who wants to help his family and loved ones by giving a small contribution and thus feel useful. 

He is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of clothes and shoes to sell which will allow him to continue his work and helping his family.

loans.use: Buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Rosa Mistica” está en su 1º ciclo  del programa de comité de Mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que esta con muchas esperanzas de poder trabajar y luchar toda juntas. Ellas también forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Pablina es una de las integrantes de este grupo, además es la presidenta del grupo, una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora. Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas ya que quiere poder surtirse para poder tener una mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Pablina comenta que con sacrificio y lucha está mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, y quiere seguir haciéndolo, es por eso que esta luchando.
texts.en:
The women´s group “Rosa Mistica” is in its first cycle.  It is a new group of women who have a lot of desire to work and strive to succeed together.  They also form part of the poverty elimination survey in which they are all analyzing their particular situation in order to improve it.  

Pablina is the president of this group.  She is a hard-working and determined woman.  She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of clothes which she needs to stock her business and provide a wider range of products to her customers.  

She tells us that with hard work and dedication she is managing to improve her standard of living and she is endeavoring to continue that way.

loans.use: to buy various clothes to sell.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Mercedes forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas y cada una de ellas está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Dionisia, quien aparte de ser integrante de este grupo, también es la presidenta, quien es una mujer muy trabajadora, que desde tempranas horas del día empieza a trabajar, hasta entrada muy noche. Ella tiene una despensa que con mucho sacrificio fue montando y surtiendo y es por medio de este negocio que está ayudando a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Dionisia pide este préstamo para la compra de productos varios para surtir su almacén, como ser verduras, carne, frutas, enlatados y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The “Las Mercedes” group is part of the poverty elimination program where all the members are taking the survey to analyze the situation that each of them is in with a view to finding them work.

One of the members is Dionisia, who apart from being a member is also the president.  She is a very hard-working woman who starts work early each morning and doesn’t finish until late evening.  She has a small store which she set up and stocked with a lot of sacrifice and this business provides her with an income to support her family and loved ones.

She is asking for this loan to buy various products to stock her store, such as vegetables, meat, fruit, tinned food and similar things.  This will help her develop her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruit, tinned food and others.

loans.name: Maria Asuncion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Maria Asuncion está en su Segundo ciclo del programa de comité donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer en qué situación está cada una, y conforme a eso poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, gracias a las capacitaciones de cada una.
Ninfa es integrante de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que está luchando por su familia, para poder darle todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Ella se dedica a vender leche, que todos los días reparte desde muy tempranas horas, para que sus clientes tengan su producto para la hora del desayuno. Comenta que está mejorando en su negocio, luchando por sus seres queridos.
Ninfa pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y de esa forma luchar por mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
texts.en: The Maria Asuncion group is in the second cycle of its committee program, in which they are carrying out a poverty elimination survey, which will enable them to understand each member's situation and be able to improve their quality of life accordingly thanks to their training. Ninfa is a member of the group. She's a very hardworking woman who perseveres for the sake of her family to give them everything that she wasn't able to have. She works in milk sales, which she does every day starting very early in the morning so that her customers can have the product in time for breakfast. She states that she's improving her business, persevering for her loved ones. Ninfa is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of milk, so she can continue selling like she has and thus continue to work to improve her family's quality of life

loans.use: To purchase milk to sell

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renacer  está en su ciclo número 15  del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan  y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza,  a través del cual todas podrán mejorar sus condiciones de vida, con las capacitaciones y la ayuda que podrán recibir todas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mercedes, quien es una mujer muy trabajadora, y  luchadora, ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos que sale a vender por las zonas aledañas de la ciudad. Comenta que todo lo que hace es para poder ayudar a su familia por medio del trabajo que ella viene haciendo. Ella quiere poder tener un negocio fijo para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de ese negocio, y es por ello que está luchando.
Hoy ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar y demás productos. Es una mujer muy entusiasta que quiere capacitarse para poder ayudar a su familia, y es por eso que se está esforzando.
texts.en:
The group “Renacer” is in its 15th cycle and its members all work hard and help each other to get on in life.  They form part of the poverty elimination program which helps them to improve their standard of living with help and training that is on offer to all of them.

One of the members is Mercedes, who is a hard-working and determined woman who sells all types of products on the street in the areas near to the city.  She does this to help her family through the income she generates.  She wants a fixed business to be able to look after her family better, and that is what she is working towards.

She is asking for a loan to buy clothing, footwear, stationery and other products.  She is a very enthusiastic woman who wants to learn more so that she can take care of her family, which is why she is making such an effort in her work.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, stationery and other general goods for sale.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a native hat weaving business in the Philippines.

Beatriz requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business. She has been in this business for 37 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Beatriz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Sampaguita

texts.en:
Sampaguita is 55 years old and lives in Lumbia, Pagadian City. She is married with 6 children.

Sampaguita has a clothing business and earns approximately 30,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. Now she is requesting a loan for her clothing business.

She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Samapaguita hopes to expand.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes such as ready-to-wear for her clothing business .

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 62 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing nets, etc. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

Concepcion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing nets, etc. for her business

loans.name: Milton Santiago

texts.es: Milton es un joven muy trabajador, él vive con sus padres, dos hermanos y un sobrino en una hacienda donde trabajan en la ganadería y en la agricultura, comenta Milton que son 4 años que se dedica a sembrar papas y que en este tiempo le ha ido muy bien, también trabaja  al jornal y la aspiración de este joven es que de sus  cultivos pueda sacar una buena ganancia para cubrir sus gastos y ayudar a su familia, para ello el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de comprar semilla de papa y pagar a las persona que le van a ayudar en la siembra.
texts.en: Milton is a hardworking young man who lives with his parents, two brothers and a nephew on a farm where they work in livestock and agriculture. Milton says that he's been planting potatoes for 4 years and that he's done very well in that period of time. He also works as a day laborer and this young man's ambition is to get a good profit out of his crops so he can cover his expenses and help his family. To that end he will invest the loan in the purchase of potato seeds and to pay for labor to help him with the planting.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and hire helpers

loans.name: Nemia

texts.es: Nemia tiene 3 hijos pero su pareja no vive con ella Nemia vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento ella paga un alquiler Nemia obtiene sus ingresos mediante la venta de ropa usada. Ella necesita un credito que le permita comprar mayor cantidad de ropa usada en general para incrementar su oferta y por ende sus ingresos Nemia es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Nemia has three children but her partner does not live with her.  She lives in El Alto in a brick and cement house which she rents.  Nemia earns a living selling used clothing and she needs a loan to buy more clothing in general to increase her stock and income.  Nemia is the own bread winner in her household, so she needs your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana esta casada, tiene un hijo, vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento Ana paga un anticrético. Ana trabaja vendiendo ropa usada  Ana necesita dinero para un credito de salud, su esposo esta muy delicado de salud e incluso estuvo en coma, Ana usará el crédito para gastos médicos para su marido Ana no tiene a nadie que pueda ayudarle por eso necesita su colaboracion
texts.en: Ana is married and has a son, and she lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house which she is leasing.  Ana sells used clothing for a living and she is in need of a loan for health purposes, since her husband is in very delicate health and has even been in a coma.  She will use the loan to cover medical costs for her husband.  Ana needs your support because she has no one to help her.

loans.use: To pay for her husband's medical costs.

loans.name: Manuel Efrain

texts.es: Manuel es un joven colombiano de 25 años de edad, este joven es soltero y se dedica a criar pollos en un galpón que lo construyo  cerca de la hacienda donde él trabaja cuidando ganado y también se dedica a la agricultura, comenta que se trasladó desde su país hacia Ecuador debido a la escases de trabajo en Colombia y añade que de las pocas ocasiones que existen de trabajar le pagan muy poco que no alcanza para cubrir los gastos, Manuel vive con sus padres y sus hermanos que también trabajan en una hacienda, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos de los que aspira obtener buenos ingresos y seguir luchando para mejorar la calidad de vida en Ecuador.
texts.en: Manuel is a young, single Colombian of 25 years of age, and works raising chickens in a shed that he built close to the farm where he works taking care of livestock, and he also works as a farmer. He says that moved from his country to Ecuador because of the lack of jobs in Colombia and adds that the few jobs that are available pay too little to make a living. Manuel lives with his parents and brothers who also work on a farm. He's going to invest the loan in the purchase of chickens from which he hopes to obtain good income and continue working to improve his quality of life in Ecuador.

loans.use: to purchase chickens after moving from Colombia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics, cell phone accessories and other items to sell.

loans.name: Mendez Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MENDEZ” iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de polaina, costura de polleras, costura de enaguas, venta de medicamentos caseros, venta de pescado, venta de bañadores, venta de artículos de celulares.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento por iniciativa propia, al observar que este producto era ampliamente comercializado en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de pollos y verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y  capacitación que ofrece la institución.

En un costado, cerca a la ventana, se encuentra la hija de una de las socias, que acompaña a la banca comunal.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mendez” is starting its 17th cycle in group Pro Mujer as part of the regional offices in German Busch.  It is made up of eight members and has a board of directors, of which Margarita is the president.  The various businesses that its members have include making gaiters, polleras (big one-piece skirts) and women´s slips; and also selling domestic medicines, fish, bathing costumes and accessories for cell phones.

The loan they are asking for will benefit the small-time businesses such as the one Margarita has.  She started in the group after a friend invited her to join five years ago.  Currently, she has a business selling food which she set up on her own initiative after seeing that there was a big market for this product. 
 
She is asking for a loan to buy chickens and vegetables wholesale which she will buy off the traders and then sell at her point of sale.  This work allows her to generate an income to support her family.  She is married with five children.

When asked what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she tells us that it is the health service and the training that the institution offers.

At the side of the photograph, near the window, is the daughter of one of the members of the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy chickens and vegetables.

loans.name: Jardines De Senkata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JARDINES DE SENKATA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silvia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida y api, taller de carpintería, tienda de barrio, venta de fruta, venta de mantas de vicuña, trenzado de mantas, costura de calzado, venta de salteñas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silvia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió porque anteriormente observaba a sus amigas la forma de comercialización de estos productos, con un pequeño capital adquirido en Pro Mujer emprende un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos) que adquirirá de los distribuidores mayoristas de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "JARDINES DE SENKATA" is in its first Pro Mujer Program cycle at the Senkata Social Center.  The group is comprised of eight members whose board of directors is led by Silvia, the president.  The members are involved in different business activities such as food sales, carpentry, grocery store, fruit sales, wool blanket sales, blanket weaving, shoe repair and pastry sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners like Silvia.  She says she has been in the Pro Mujer Progam for two years and joined by invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  Silvia's current business is selling cosmetics.  She learned the activity by watching her friends sell this type of product.  With a small amount of capital from Pro Mujer she began her independent business.
 
The loan she is requesting now is to increase her work capital to buy cosmetics from wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto.  She will later sell them on an order basis.  Her work allows her to generate an income to support her family.  She has a common-law husband and two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the health training offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Georgina Magdalena

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito  Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.
En este lugar vive la señora Georgina, tiene 31 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 13 y 6 años, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. 
Doña Georgina con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon, Belcorp, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos,  cobra semanalmente y le encanta vender,   esto lo viene realizando desde hace dos años y esto le ayuda a sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Lleva más de 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a  sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Picoaza” meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial area, celebrating the traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul, and having a rich historical culture influenced by the surrounding mountains.

Sra. Georgina lives in this place. She is 31 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three children (ages 14, 13, and 6). Her two older children are in high school and the youngest one attends elementary school.

In her order to have her own income, Doña Georgina sells products through catalogs from Avon, Belcorp, and Yanbal. These items include beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories. Georgina works every day, mostly during the morning hours since it is easier to travel during this time. She sells by going door-to-door, taking orders, and collecting payments on a weekly basis. Georgina enjoys selling and has been doing this for two years. Her work has helped her children to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, and crèmes. Georgina has been with the Communal Bank for two years and enjoys the assistance that the loans have given her. Her dreams include providing the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, and crèmes.

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es: María tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 6 años y 3 años de edad. María es una mujer emprendedora quien trabaja como empleada en un comedor y es así como junto a su compañero de vida  mantienen la economía del hogar. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir un corredor a la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento y arena. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar a inicio a la construcción lo antes antes posible.
texts.en: Maria, 25, lives in her own house with her common-law husband and daughters, ages six and three years old.  Maria is an entrepreneur who works as an employee in a diner in order to help her husband with the household expenses.  She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy materials such as metal sheeting, wood, cement and sand to build a hall in her house.  With the loan she hopes to be able to begin construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wood, cement and sand to build a hall in her house.

loans.name: Litoral De Senkata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LITORAL DE SENKATA” iniciará el vigésimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Remedios es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa interior, venta de CD´s, salón de belleza, venta de sábanas, venta de chalecos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Remedios es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  producción de busos deportivos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió porque anteriormente trabajó en una empresa de costura donde aprendio la técnica, es por ello que implemento un taller de costura.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de los distribuidores mayoristas de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido en instituciones educativas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada  y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The credit group “Litoral de Senkata” will start its ninth cycle in the group Pro Mujer as part of the regional office in Senkata.  It is made up of eight members and has a board of directors, of which Remedios is the president.  The businesses that the members have include selling underwear, CDs, bed sheets and vests, in addition to a beauty salon.

This loan will benefit the small businesses such as the one Remedios has.  She started with the group five years ago after a friend invited her to join.  Currently, she has a business making sportswear.  She learnt this trade because she used to work in a sewing business and learnt how to do it.  For that reason, she decided to start her own business.

The loan she is asking for is to buy cloth wholesale which she will buy from the traders in the city and later sell in to order at educational institutions.  This work allows her to generate an income to support her family; she is married and has five children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she tells us that it is the health service that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cloth wholesale.

loans.name: Maura Idalia

texts.es: Maura, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Puerto Cortes. Hace mas de 5 años que ella estableció su propia pulpería para obtener ingresos, vende arroz, frijoles, refrescos, lácteos, embutidos, azúcar, maíz, manteca, agua, cosméticos, etc. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo por 10,000 para surtir de productos alimenticios como arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, lácteos, productos de aseo y otros, y poder aumentar las ventas y su clientela. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Maura is 33 years old. She is married, has three children and lives in a village in the municipality of Puerto Cortes. More than five years ago, she established her own grocery store in order to generate income. She sells rice, beans, soft drinks, meats, sugar, corn, butter, water, cosmetics, etc. 

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Honduran lempiras to stock up on groceries like rice, sugar, butter, beans, dairy products, toiletries, and other products to increase her sales and her client base.

It is her aim to grow her business and, by this, to help her family.

loans.use: to stock up on groceries like rice, sugar, butter, beans, dairy products, toiletries, and others.

loans.name: Nancy Yanubi

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer luchadora y nunca se ha dejado derrumbar por los problemas. Ella vive con sus dos hijos y desde hace algún tiempo ha tenido que desempeñar el papel de padre y madre ya que se separó del hombre con el que vivía.
Ella trabajaba en almacenes de cadena desempeñando diferentes oficios pero cuando se le terminaron los contratos de trabajo decidió comenzar con su propio negocio. Se capacito en el SENA en cosmetología y desde ese momento empezó a trabajar independiente.
Adecuo una habitación de la vivienda donde vive y allí presta servicios de masoterapia y relajación, además de tratamientos para el cuidado de la piel y belleza. Tiene un buen flujo de clientes, así que trabaja 12 horas diarias para poderlos atender a todos.
Ella necesita dinero para comprar una herramienta para electroestimulación, esta le permitirá realizar trabajos más profesionales y así acreditar su negocio.
Su principal desventaja es la ubicación del negocio ya que es en un lugar de difícil acceso y además en el sector donde vive hay mucha competencia.
texts.en:
Nancy is a determined woman who has never allowed problems to demoralize her. She lives with her two children and has had to assume the role of both parents for some time since she is separated from the man who was living with her.

Nancy worked for various chain stores in different roles, but when her employment contracts ended, she decided to start her own business. Through SENA (the national learning service), she studied cosmetology and is just now starting to work independently.

Nancy equipped a room in her home where she provides massage therapy and relaxation services. In addition, she administers skin care and beauty treatments. She has an influx of clients, so she works 12 hours a day so that she can attend to all of them. Nancy needs a loan in order to buy electric stimulation equipment. This will help her to provide more professional service and lend credibility to her business. Her main disadvantage is that her business is located in a place that is difficult to access. In addition, there is a great deal of competition in the area where she lives.

loans.use: to buy electric stimulation equipment.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia es soltera pero tiene un hijo ella vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento junto a sus padres, ella estudio solo hasta el nivel primario, se dedica a la elaboracion y comercialización de  de recuerdos (colitas) para todo acontecimiento social (fiestas cumpleaños, eventos colegiales, graduaciones de servicio militar, etc.) el trabajo que elabora es manual Necesita crédito para comprar materiales (papel, telas, cintas) y asi poder mejorar sus ingresos, Cecilia es el unico sustento de su familia por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Cecilia is a single mother with one son.  She lives in El Alto in a brick house with her parents.  She was only able to study until primary school.  She makes and sells souvenirs for any social event like parties, birthdays, school celebrations, military school graduation, etc.  

She does all her work by hand and needs a loan to buy material (paper, cloth, tape) to help improve her income.  Cecilia is the only provider for her family, so she needs assistance.

loans.use: to buy material such as paper, cloth and tape for her business.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Pora  está en su ciclo número 1º  del programa de comité, es un grupo nuevo que está luchando y tiene muchas expectativas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde con mucho sacrificio están mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien hace y vende bijouterie, ella es una persona que está poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para comprar insumos para seguir haciendo sus bijouteries, como ser canutillos, pinzas, hilos y demás.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Pora is in its first cycle.  This new group is striving for success and has high hopes.  They are doing the poverty elimination program and are improving their situation thanks to their hard work. 

One of the members is Maria who makes and sells costume jewelry.  She is doing all she can to be able to improve the standard of living of family.  She is grateful for the help she receives which allows her to keep growing.  

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies to continue making her jewelry such as curly thread, tweezers, thread and similar things.

loans.use: to buy curly thread, tweezers, thread and similar things.

loans.name: Luz Del Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: El grupo está integrado por tres socio trabajadores y coordinado por la señora María de 59 años de edad, casada y madre de cuatro hijos, se dedica a la venta de artículos de limpieza en el mercado de Jinotepe, el crédito lo requiere para aumentar la mercadería en comprar artículos como detergente, desinfectantes, shampoo, jabón xtra, jabon ambar y todo lo relacionado, la socia ha logrado aumentar las ganancias por medio de los créditos otorgados en esta institución. Las otras socias son las señoras Martha de 32 anos quien comercializa artículos de limpieza en el mercado de Jinotega y Vilma de 60 anos quien elabora y vende nacatamales, rosquilla y demás derivados del maíz.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hard-working members and coordinated by María, who is 59 years old. She is married and has four children, and makes a living selling cleaning products in Jinotepe market. She needs the loan to increase her stock by buying items such as detergent, disinfectants, shampoo, soap, Ambar laundry detergent and related products. She has managed to increase her profits through the loans provided by this institution.

The other members are Martha, aged 32, who sells cleaning materials in Jinotega market, and 60-year-old Vilma, who makes and sells nacatamales, 'rosquillas' [ring-shaped pastries] and other products made from corn.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, laundry detergent, detergent etc.

loans.name: Querubine Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias esforzadas y trabajadoras, coordinado por la señora Laykelis de 23 años de edad, acompañada y madre de un niño de cuatro años, se dedica a la vender tortilla y cuajadas en su domicilio, solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales a utilizar como es el quintal de maíz y la compra de queso, de modo que le permita cubrir la demandad que tiene de estos productos y así aumentar las ganancias para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su hijo. Otra socia es la señora Mercedes de 21 anos que comercializa ropa de segunda en las calles de su comunidad y la señora Verónica de 19 anos que ofrece el servicio de fritanga los fines de semana en su domicilio
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three dedicated and hard-working members, coordinated by Laykelis. She is 23 years old and has a partner and a four year-old boy. She makes a living selling tortillas and curd cheese from her home. She is asking for the loan to buy the ingredients she needs, such as a quintal of corn, and to buy cheese. This will enable her to meet the demand which exists for her products and so increase her profits to give her son a better standard of living. 

Other members are Mercedes, aged 21, who sells second hand clothing around the streets of her local community, and Verónica, aged 19, who sells fried food in her home at the weekends

loans.use: to buy a quintal of corn and cheese wholesale.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 60 years old and lives in Dao-an, San Miguel, ZDS. She is married with three children.
Rosita has a shop that sells assorted groceries, and has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan to pay for additional assorted groceries.
Rosita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her sari sari business into a mini grocery store.

loans.use: to pay for additional assorted groceries.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 43 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TENE/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 15ème  prêt solidaire. KOROTIMI  femme debout au milieu sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 paires de chaussures en plastique, 10 pièces de Wax, 30 paires de boucle d’oreille et 1 rouleau de Bazin. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are on average 43 years old with three children, and all live in traditional extended families in Tene/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women became acquainted through kinship ties and are retail merchants of various items. Having successfully repaid their previous loans, the women in the Benkadi group are on their 15th group loan.

Korotimi, the woman standing in the middle of the photograph, intends to use the loan to buy 20 pairs of plastic shoes, 10 lengths of Wax (colorful West-African fabric), 30 pairs of earrings and 1 roll of Bazin fabric.

She buys locally from wholesalers and conducts her retail sales to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash and often on credit.

She hopes to attain average monthly profits of 50,000 CFA francs, which will be used for health expenses and school fees. The remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: Harlem Jose

texts.es: El Sr Harlem es trabajador de una institucion educativa publica de una comarca del municipio como maestro de educacion primaria impartiendo clases a niños de 10 a 14 años desde hace 4 años, recorriendo aproximadamente 22 km diairos de lunes a viernes de su casa de habitacion a su centro de trabajo, por lo que la compra de este medio de tranporte le facilitaria su movilizacion en tiempo y forma a su centro de trabajo trayendole beneficio a el y a su familia.
texts.en: Harlem has been working in a public education institution for 4 years. He is a Primary Education Teacher, teaching children 10 to 14 years old. He travels 22 km every day, from the house where he lives to his place of work. Buying this vehicle would make his commute faster and easier, which would benefit him and his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Kankele Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KANKELE ont en moyenne 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TION/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments et des articles divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KANKELE sont à leur 7ème  prêt solidaire. AWA 2ème  femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40Kg d’oignon, 25Kg de sel, 15Kg de piment, 10 paniers de tomate, 15 paquets de Cube Maggi et 20Litres d’huile. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Kankele group are on average 37 years old with four children, and all live in traditional extended families in Tion/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women became acquainted through kinship ties and are small retail traders of condiments and various items. Having successfully repaid their previous loans, the women in the Kankele group are on their seventh group loan.

Awa is the second woman from the left to the right in the photo. She intends to use the loan to buy 40 kilos of onions, 25 kilos of salt, 15 kilos of hot peppers, 10 baskets of tomatoes, 15 packages of Maggi cubes and 20 liters of vegetable oil.

She buys locally and in the surrounding villages, and sells retail to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash and often on credit.

She hopes to attain average monthly profits of 45,000 CFA francs she will spend on health, food, clothing, and school fees. The rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 30 tanks of propane gas.

loans.name: Ivis Patricia

texts.es: La señora Ivis, tiene 27 años,  ella tiene dos hijos de las edades de 7 y 5 años, ella se dedica a la confección de  edredones,  ella confecciona según pedidos como también entrega a distintos mercados de la ciudad de La paz y el alto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Ivis va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de tela y fibra por mayor ya que tiene muchos pedidos por estas fechas ya que se acerca la temporada de invierno,  la señora Ivis a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es  poder tener un taller más grande confeccionar en mayor cantidad y entrar al mercado a nivel nacional, se siente agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Ivis is 27 years old and has two children aged 7 and 5. She makes a living sewing quilts. She makes them to order but also sells at various markets in the cities of La Paz and El Alto.

This is her first loan cycle with the institution. Ivis is going to use the loan to buy fabric and synthetic thread wholesale, as she has a lot of orders at this time of year now that the winter is approaching. Ivis will use the profits to continue to improve her business. Her hopes for her business are to have a larger workshop, to produce a larger quantity and to get into the national market.  

Ivis is grateful for this opportunity which you are giving her by providing the loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric and synthetic thread.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ESTELLAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de enaguas, venta de ropa, venta de periódicos, venta de carne, venta de cosméticos, venta de fibra de vidrio, confección y venta de tejidos, venta de batidos

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar la necesidad de  sus vecinos al tener un espacio de compra en su zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de conservas y abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “LAS ESTELLAS” communal bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes centre. It is made up of 8 members and is run by a management committee of which Ana is the President. The businesses run by the members of the communal bank are varied and include: selling vegetables, selling petticoats, selling meat, selling cosmetics, selling fibreglass, making and selling fabric, selling milk shakes.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small businesswomen, of which Ana is an example. She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of an adviser of the institution who went to visit her at home. Currently she runs a corner shop. She says she started the business up after noticing that her neighbours needed a shop in their local area. 

The loan she is taking out is to increase capital to buy tinned food and groceries wholesale. She will buy these in the wholesale stores in El Alto and will then sell them in her shop. This type of work enables her to make an income to support her family, as she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the training and the health area offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy tinned food and groceries wholesale.

loans.name: Mariela Jose

texts.es: La Sra. Mariela Jose Labora en una escuela publica de educacion primaria desde hace 4 años impartiendo clases a niños de 10 a 14 años en una comarca, la Sra Mariela Jose es madred de un hijo de 2 años de edad al cual a tratado de brindarle una buana calidad de vida construyendo poco a poco su casa de habitacion este es el segundo prestamo que solicita el primero fue para contruir las bases su casa de habitacion y este segundo lo necesita para continuar con ese proyecto de tener al fin de año su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Mariela Jose has been working at a Public Primary School for 4 years, teaching children in the district aged 10 to 14 years old.
Mariela Jose has a 2-year-old son. She wants to provide him with a good quality of life by building a house little by little.

This is the second loan that she has requested. The first loan was used to build the foundations of the house, and this second loan will be used to continue the project, in order to have the house by the end of the year.

loans.use: to build her house.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario está integrado por cuatro socios exitosos en sus trabajo, coordinado por la señora Elizabeth de 28 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 7 y 4 anos, es comerciante de ropa y calzado en el mercado más populoso de la capital y solicita el crédito para la compra de camisas de damas, talladores, licras, camisas de caballeros, jeans de damas, jeans de caballeros y más. Los otros socios son la señora Martha de 51 anos quien comercializa ropa nueva y de segunda en el mercado más populoso de la capital, el señor Ervin de 25 años ofrece accesorios de vehículos en el mercado capitalino y la señora Yessenia de 36 años quien vende materiales de construcción en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The Primavera (Spring) group is composed of four members, all of them successful in their jobs. The group is coordinated by Elizabeth, 28, married and with two children aged 7 and 4. She sells clothes and shoes at the biggest market in the city and she is requesting a loan to buy women’s shirts, tops, men’s shirts, women’s jeans, men’s jeans and other products.

The other members of the group are: Martha, 51, who sells new and second-hand clothes in the biggest market in the city; Ervin, 25, who makes a living from the sale of vehicle accessories; and Yessenia, 36, who sells construction materials at her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as shirts, blouses, tops, jeans, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 31 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers et des condiments.  Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 1er  prêt solidaire. DJOMINE 1ère  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paires de chaussure en plastique, 10 paires de boucle d’oreille et 4 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20. 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi group are on average 31 years old with three children, and all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, one of the neighborhoods in San/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women became acquainted through kinship ties and are small retail traders of various items and condiments. The Benkadi group of women are on their first group loan.

Djomine is the first woman standing from left to right in the photo. She intends to use the loan to buy 10 pairs of plastic shoes, 10 pairs of earrings and 4 lengths of wax cloth (colorful West-African fabric).

She buys locally from wholesalers, and sells retail to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash and often on credit.

She hopes to attain average monthly profits of 20,000 CFA francs to be spent on health, food, and school fees. The rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: El Espino Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias, coordinado por la señora Vilma una mujer exitosa de 57 años de edad, casada y madre de ochos hijos mayores de edad, ofrece el servicio de venta de comida en su domicilio todos los días, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos para la compra de los productos a utilizar en la elaboración de la comida, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de productos como es carne de res, carne de pollo, pescado, arroz, frijol, aceite, plátano verde, plátano maduro, etc. Otra de las socias es la señora Silvia de 28 años de edad, quien elabora tortillas en su domicilio, además vende tamarindo en el mercado de la municipalidad, y la señora Isamar de 21 años propietaria de una pequeña fábrica de sartenes en su domicilio
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of 3 members, and is coordinated by Vilma. Vilma is a successful 57 year-old woman, married and with 8 adult children. She makes a living selling food at her home every day. Her husband and children help her by buying the products she needs to prepare the food. She is requesting a loan to buy products like beef meat, chicken meat, fish, rice, beans, oil, green bananas, ripe bananas, etc.

The other members are: Silvia, 28, who makes a living selling tortillas at her house and also sells tamarind at the town market; and Isamar, 21, who owns a small pan manufacturing business in her house.

loans.use: to buy beef meat, fish, rice, beans, oil, green bananas, ripe bananas, etc.

loans.name: Kodiagnogona Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KODIAGNOGONA ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO II l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers, des boissons et des habits. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KODIAGNOGONA sont à leur 5ème  prêt solidaire. AMINATA 1ère  femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 cartons de savon, 2 cartons d’eau de javel, 5 pièces d’uni Wax et 10 boîtes de pommade. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Kodiagnogona group are on average 35 years old with three children, and all live in traditional extended families in Santoro II, one of the neighborhoods of San/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women became acquainted through kinship ties and are small retail traders of various items, beverages and clothing. Having successfully repaid their previous loans, the women of the Kodiagnogona group are on their fifth group loan.

Aminata is the first woman from left to right in the photo. She intends to use the loan to buy 5 boxes of soap, 2 boxes of bleach, 5 lengths of Uni wax (colorful West-African fabric) and 10 boxes of ointment.

She buys locally from wholesalers, and sells retail to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash and often on credit.

She hopes to attain average monthly profits of 60,000 CFA francs to be spent on health and food. The rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
Kelegna est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, savons, Tissus, jus, Boissons, Fruits, Légumes et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles Sont à leur huitième cycle de prêt solidaire. 
Salimata est un membre du groupe Kelegna assise à droite qui est une  vendeuse de Savons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des futs de déchets d’huile au fur et à mesure qu’elle les transforme en Savons pour la vente en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure des déchets  d’huile dans des Usines concernées  de Koutiala. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kelegna comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Salimata compte réaliser  105 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Kelegna is a group of women from Koutiala who know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 37 years old and have at least five children.

This group of women sells various items such as soap, fabrics, juice, beverages, fruit, vegetables and miscellaneous items. To expand their activities, the group members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their eighth group loan cycle.

Salimata, sitting on the right, is a member of the Kelegna group who sells soap. She intends to use her loan to buy barrels of waste oil as the need arises, and turn them into soap for retail sales to a diverse clientele. She obtains the waste oil from suitable Koutiala-based plants.

While other members of the Kelegna group expect to achieve average profits of 90,000 CFA francs each over this loan cycle, Ms Salimata expects to achieve 105,000 CFA francs.

In addition to the repayment of loans, they use part of the income to meet personal expenses and increase their stock in trade.

loans.use: buy soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to help her coffee crops this new season.

loans.name: Meybol Catalina

texts.es: Meybol es madre soltera, tiene una hija a la que le brinda sus estudios y todo lo necesario para su buen desarrollo, por ello Meybol trabaja arduamente con el fin de mantener los gastos principales del hogar y de su hija, ella requiere el crédito para continuar invirtiendo en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa la cual realiza de manera ambulante  y en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Meybol is a single mother, who pays for her daughter's studies, and everything necessary for her development. Meybol works very hard, with the objective of paying her household expenses and the expenses of her daughter.

She needs the loan to continue investing in her small business, in which she sells clothes on the street and in her home.

loans.use: to buy a variety of women's and men's clothing.

loans.name: Claribelle

texts.en:
Claribelle is forty-seven years old and lives in Pagadian-lumbia, Pagadian City. She is single.

Claribelle has a sari sari sari store. She had this business for seven years and has requested an expansion. Claribelle has been a member of Pmpc for one year. In the future, she plans to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy products for her sari sari store

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Jane requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and ingredients like bamboo sticks, hotdogs, meat and seasonings for her business. Jane has been in this business for seven years now.

Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and ingredients like bamboo sticks, hotdogs, meat and seasonings for her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is fifty-four years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Juana works very hard to provide for them.

Juana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like sugar, coffee, canned goods, soft-drinks and noodles to sell.

Juana has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, coffee, canned goods, soft-drinks and noodles. 

Juana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like sugar, coffee, canned goods, soft-drinks and noodles to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is forty-four years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. Francisca works very hard to provide for them.

Francisca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Francisca has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Francisca would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is fifty-nine years old and married with three children. 

Matilde is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Matilde requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Matilde has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Matilde would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Union Nashis Con Ñeque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNION NASHIS CON ÑEQUE” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Monica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cotillones, elaboración de tarimas, venta de comida, tejido de chompas, venta de pollos, librería, venta de golosinas, servicio de conducción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mónica es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás por iniciativa propia, al observar la diversificación de productos que podría colocar en su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y esta estudiando.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “UNION NASHIS CON ÑEQUE” communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Los Andes center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Monica is the president.  The businesses that the members have in the group are varied. Among them are selling party items, making platforms, selling food, knitting sweaters, selling chickens, selling snacks, and a driving service. 

The loan the micro-business women will take out will benefit them, including  Mónica. She says that this is the second year she is in Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a friend from the institution who went to visit her at her home. Right now, she has a clothes selling business. She says that she started this business several years ago on her own initiative when she saw the diversity of products she could put in her business.
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying clothing wholesale. She will acquire it wholesale from stores in the city of El Alto  and later sell it in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she in single and in school.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the area of health the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale

loans.name: Puro Amor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PURO AMOR” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ángela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de tucumanas, venta de comida, venta de papa y chuño, ayudante de minibús, venta de repuestos de cocina, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ángela es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  elaboración de maíz tostado; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar el comercio que se desarrollaba de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de maíz por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada  y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association ‘Puro Amor’ [Pure Love] will start its eleventh cycle with ‘Pro Mujer’, as a part of the ‘Centro Focal de Los Andes’. The group is made up of eight members, with a governing board that is led by Ángela. The group members are involved with a variety of businesses, including: weaving blankets, selling 'tucumanas' (a meat filled pastry), selling potatoes and potato starch, minibus assistant, selling cooking equipment and transportation services.  

The loan they are taking out will benefit these small businesswomen. Ángela is one of the members. She tells us this is her first time as a member of ‘Pro Mujer’. She has joined after being invited by one of the institution’s advisers, who visited Ángela at her home. 

Ángela has a business selling toasted corn. She started the business after noticing the commercial potential of the product.

The loan that she is taking out will be destined to increasing her capital by buying corn in bulk. She will buy it from wholesale stores in the city of El Alto and, after processing it, she will sell it in her commercial space. This work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married, with one child.

When asked about what she liked about ‘Pro Mujer’, she said she likes the healthcare area that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les neuf  membres du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (tomates, choux, aubergines), macaronis, habits et la restauration cosmétiques. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Yah (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des condiments (tomates, choux, aubergines,…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 corbeilles de tomates, 13 sacs d’aubergines, 18 sacs de choux  à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Yah compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Benkadi group, the majority of whom live in monogamous households, average 39 years of age with five children each. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the Mandé commune/Kati circle and they got to know each other as neighbors and through their income-generating activities in the Kanadjiguila market. 

The members of the group have small businesses buying and selling condiments (tomatoes, cabbages, aubergines) macaroni, clothing, ingredients for restauration and cosmetics. In order to be able to get fresh supplies for cash, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle.

Yah, who is sitting second from the right in the photo, is a significant seller of condiments (tomatoes, cabbages, aubergines,..). She is planning to use her loan to buy 20 baskets of tomatoes, 13 sakcs of aubergines and 18 sacks of cabbage in Bamako. She resells her products on a retail basis in Kanadjiguila to a customer base made up primarily of women. Yah expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000FCFA as a result of this loan and will reinvest this in her business and provide for small household needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Vena

texts.en:
Vena works hard to support her family. Vena is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Vena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Vena has been in this business for 7 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Vena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Severa

texts.en:
Severa is 62 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Severa has a general store business in the Philippines. Severa requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Severa has been in this business for two years. Severa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 53 years old, married and has ten children. Three of her children are in school.

Elvira is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable garden.

Elvira has been farming vegetables for twenty years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old and has five children. Teresita is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been farming corn for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 41 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like shampoo, canned goods, bread, biscuits, noodles, milk, cereals, etc. to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, bread, biscuits, noodles, milk, cereals, etc. 

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like shampoo, canned goods, bread, biscuits, noodles, milk and cereals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help with her corn crops.

loans.name: Dakan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Dakan est composé des femmes mariées équitablement dans des ménages polygamiques et monogamiques vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, du bois de chauffage, condiments, graines d’arachides et  la  restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Safiatou (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du bois de chauffe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 chargement de camionnette de bois dans les villages environnants de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à kanadjiguila à une clientèle mixte. Madame Safiatou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Dakan group is made up of equitably married women from polygamous and monogamous households, who live with their husbands and children.  They average 36 years of age with four children each. They all live in the village of Kanadjiguila in the Mandé commune/Kati circle and they got to know each other as neighbors.

The group members have small businesses selling firewood, condiments and groundnut seeds, and also practising restauration activities. With a view to expand their businesses, the members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Safiatou, who is sitting on the far right of the photo, has a great reputation for selling firewood. She is planning to use her loan to buy one truck load of wood in the villages surrounding Bamako. She resells her goods on a retail basis in Kanadjiguila to a mixed customer base. As a result of this loan, Safiatou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA which will be used to reinvest in her business. Her aim is, through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, to buy a plot of land to habitation purposes.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Djiguissigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguissigui est composé uniquement de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (légers, pagnes wax, bazins,…), de pâtes d’arachides, de céréales et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mama (femme debout en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (basins, pagnes wax, légers,...). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 mètres de bazins, 10pièces de pagnes  wax et 15 mètres de légers à  Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Kanadjiguila et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame  Mama espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Djiguissigui group is made up solely of monogamous wives. They average 34 years of age with three children each and all live in the village of Kanadjiguila in the Mandé commune/Kati circle. They got to know each other as neighbors.

The group members have small businesses selling clothing (light fabric, "wax pagnes", which are highly decorative and colorful pieces of fabric, and damask), groundnut paste, cereals, and also practising restauration activities. With a view to expanding their businesses, the members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mama, who is standing second from the left in the photo, has a great reputation for selling clothes (damask, "pagnes wax and light fabrics) She is planning to use her loan to buy ten meters of damask fabric, 10 pieces of "pagnes" wax and 15 meters of light fabric) in Bamako. She resells her goods on a retail basis in Kanadjiguila and door-to-door to a mixed customer base.
