As a result of this loan, Mama hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA which will be used to reinvest in her business. Her aim is, through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, to buy a plot of land for habitation purposes.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Reymoor

texts.en:
Reymoor owns and operates a farm to earn a living, planting and harvesting rice to sell in the local community. From his farm, Reymoor earns well to sustain his livelihood and was able to repay his previous loan successfully. Aside from this, he also has a transportation business that earns more income for the family.

Reymoor joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. To improve the farm, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides.

Reymoor's dream is to buy a four-wheeled vehicle to use in his transportation business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie owns and operates a service-based business, providing motor transportation services in the local community. She has been in this business for more than four years and she earns well to sustain their living. Aside from this, she also has a salary from work as private employee. With her generated income, her previous loan used for buying tires and licenses was successfully repaid.

Recently, she took a new loan to cover the costs of motor maintenance. She plans to buy another motorcycle in order to expand the services, and generate additional income to support the needs of the entire family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motor maintenance.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia owns and operates a general store. She has been engaged in her business for more than eight years she earns well from this. With her income, her previous loan used for buying rice and corn grits for sale was successfully repaid.

In order to improve sales, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Ryan Joseph

texts.en:
Ryan Joseph provides motor-transport services in the local community during his free time from work. It helps him to gather additional income for the daily basic needs of the family. He is a private employee who also generates income from his business. With his generated income, his previous loan which he used for motor accessories and repair was successfully repaid. 

Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to to purchase a new motorcycle to be used in his business. With his wife, he is now a distributor, wholesale and retail, of sim cards and v-moringa. He hopes to gain more income from the business in order to support the needs of his only son.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 56 years old, married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Felipa has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Felipa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of charcoal to resell.

Felipa has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Felipa would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 35 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Janet has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Janet would like to save money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Melodia is 34 years old and both of her children are in school.

Melodia has a wood-crafting business in the Philippines. Melodia requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her wood-crafting business.

Melodia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Melodia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her wood-crafting business.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 44 years old and has seven children. Venus is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Venus is in the agricultural business, raising pig in the Philippines. Venus requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional piglet, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Venus has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Venus would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet, feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es:
Ella se llama Jakeline, el gusto por la enfermería es por aprender a ser más humana, sencilla, humilde y sobre todo la responsabilidad para cumplir a caballada  todas las expectativas que se tiene al estudiar esta carrera, la motivación más grande es poder prestar un servicio por medio del cual puede ayudar a la gente, ya que siente que es la vocación.
Además ayudo a la familia  y comunidad, ya que el lugar donde vivía que es el “campo”, no se encuentra con los suficientes recursos para atender a la población, ya que en muchas ocasiones hay accidentes por herramientas, picaduras de insectos y reptiles por esta razón y una más grande  es que el hospital queda muy retirado de cualquier lugar de un accidente.
Por esta razón la motiva más especializarme en el tema de la salud, ella solo pido una oportunidad para cumplir los sueños y el interés por la comunidad, pero en este momento ella no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para poder pagar el valor de las cuotas mensuales, es por eso que ella se vería muy beneficiada con el convenio que kiva le puede ofrecer a ella.
texts.en:
Her name is Jakeline. She likes nursing because she learns to be more humane, humble and above all, responsible for completely fulfilling all of the expectations of this major. Her biggest motivation is being able to offer a service with which she can help a lot of people, because she feels that this is her vocation.

In addition, this will help family and her community. She lives in the countryside and there aren't enough resources to serve the population. Often there are accidents from tools and insect and reptile bites. The hospital is also very far away in the event of any accident. 

That is why she is motivated to study healthcare. She is only asking for a chance to make her dreams come true and help her community. At this time, she doesn't have the resources she needs to make her monthly payments. That is why the Kiva contract will be very beneficial to her.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie is 27 years old, married and a resident of Oroquieta-Casusan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have three children, of which two are in school. Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in April 2013 and has already taken out her first loan. 

Now she is applying for 10,000 PHP to purchase more stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of basic commodities.

loans.name: Jon Rex

texts.en:
Jon Rex has been an employee of a private company for more than four years, earning well to support his family. He joined GDMPC and he gained access to the micro-finance services of the cooperative. With his income, he was able to pay back his previous loan successfully. 

Recently, he took a new loan to cover the cost of transportation licenses. In the near future, he plans to own a merchandise store in their village to improve their living conditions and to have a comfortable house to live in.

loans.use: to cover the cost of transportation licenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy products to cook such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Flamboyant Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les cinq membres du groupe Flamboyant ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits de la friperie de tous genres, des ustensiles, des céréales et des graines d’arachides. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Salimata (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits de la friperie de meilleures qualités et de tous les genres. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une balle d’habits au marché. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Salimata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The five members of the Flamboyant group, the majority of whom live in polygamous households, average 34 years of age with four children each. They all live in the village of Kanadjiguila in the Mandé commune/Kati circle and they got to know each other as relatives, friends, neighbors and through their income generating activities at the Kanadjiguila market.

The group members have small businesses selling all sorts of second-hand clothing, utensils, cereals and groundnut seeds. With a view to expanding their businesses, the members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Salimata, who is sitting on the far left of the photo, is a significant seller of high quality and all other sorts of second-hand clothing. She is planning to use her loan to buy a bale of clothing in the market. She resells her goods on a retail basis in Kanadjiguila and door-to-door to a customer base made up primarily of women. As a result of this loan, Salimata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA which will be used to reinvest in her business and to provide for her family's small requirements.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Nora Geraldina

texts.es: Nora, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, con quien tiene 3 hijos y reside en el sector de Cofradía, Cortes. Nora tiene su propio negocio de venta de frutas como naranjas, banano, sandia, piña y otras, abarrotes como arroz, frijoles, refrescos, agua, etc. y verduras como tomates, cebolla, chile, repollo. El cual tiene en un local del mercado de la comunidad y lo tiene desde hace dos años. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 6,000 lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de frutas frescas de temporada como ser mangos, zapotes, ciruelas, naranjas, melón y sandias para surtir y vender. Su plan es hacer crecer su fuente de ingresos y poderle dar educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nora is 29 years old and lives in the area of Cofradía, Cortes, in a common-law union with her partner, with whom she has 3 children. Nora has her own business where she sells fruits such as oranges, bananas, watermelon, pineapple and others; groceries such as rice, beans, soft drinks, water, etc. and vegetables such as tomatoes, onion, chilli and cabbage. She does this in a stall in the local market, which she has had for two years.

The loan she has applied for is for 6,000 lempiras, which she will invest in the purchase of fresh seasonal fruits such as mangos, sapotas, plums, oranges, melon and watermelon to stock and sell. Her plan is to grow her source of income and be able to give her children an education.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits such as mangos, sapotas, plums, oranges, melon and watermelon to stock and sell.

loans.name: Bonifacia Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias exitosas, coordinado por la señora Bonifacia de 50 años de edad y casada es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace diez años,  por lo que solicita el crédito para mantener surtida la pulpería y aumentar las ganancias, invertirá en productos como arroz, frijol, aceite, carne de pollo, carne de res, plátano verde, plátano maduro, ropa para damas ropa para niños, etc. Las otras socias son las señoras Anielka de 31 años comerciante de ropa nueva y cosméticos principalmente en una zona franca ubicada cerca de su comunidad y Tomasita de 57 años comerciante de ropa nueva en su comunidad.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three successful members, coordinated by Señora Bonifacia, who is 50 years old, married, and has owned a convenience store in her place of residence for the last 10 years.

She is applying for the loan in order to keep the convenience store stocked and increase her earnings. She will invest it in products such as rice, beans, oil, chicken, beef, unripe and ripe bananas, women's and children's clothing etc. 

The other members are Señoras Anielka, 31 years old and involved principally in selling new clothes and cosmetics in a free trade zone in her area, and Tomasita, 57 years old and involved in selling new clothes in her community.

loans.use: to buy a hundredweight (60 lb.) of rice, beans, sugar, a drum of oil, bathroom soap, soap for washing clothes, bread, etc.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “8 DE DICIEMBRE” iniciará el décimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de medias y poleras, venta de pescado, venta de sombreros, venta de plantillas, venta de papas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que hace diez y seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años, ya que la técnica de tejido lo aprendió anteriormente de sus hermanas.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de hilos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y  capacitación que ofrece la institución.

En al imagen se observa señora con sombrero blanco, ella es hija de una de las compañeras del grupo.
texts.en:
The “8 DE DICIEMBRE” community association will begin its sixteenth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de German Busch centre. It is made up of eight members and is governed by a board chaired by Señora Marcela. The members of the community association have a variety of businesses, selling blankets, tights and sweatshirts, fish, hats, insoles, potatoes and food.

The loan they receive will benefit small microentrepreneurs, including Señora Margarita. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for sixteen years, and was invited to join by a friend who is a member of the organisation. Today, she has a business selling blankets, which she established a number of years ago, after learning how to weave from her sisters.
 
She will use the loan she receives to increase capital (buying wholesale thread) which she will get from wholesale sellers. After making her products, she will sell them in her sales outlet. This way of working allows her to make money to support her family, as she is married and has four children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the healthcare and training offered by the organisation.

In the photo, there is a woman wearing a white hat. She is the daughter of one of the group's members.

loans.use: to buy wholesale thread.

loans.name: Benjamin Lito

texts.es: El señor Benjamín tiene 38 años tiene un hijo  de la edad de 4 años, el tiene su taller de chapería y pintura de vehículos que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Coronado, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el señor Benjamín  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de oxígeno y herramientas de trabajo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo ya que este es un material necesario para su trabajo  el señor Benjamín enfrenta retos en su negocio que son continuar ampliando su actividad teniendo más clientes en el taller y  va a utilizar los beneficios en ampliar su negocio, el señor Benjamín es una persona muy trabajadora se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Mr. Benjamin is 38 years old; he has a 4 year old son. He has an auto body and paint garage which is in the area of Coronado. 

This is his first loan with the institution. Mr. Benjamin will use this loan to buy oxygen and work tools. The reason for asking for the loan is the lack of cash since this is a necessary material for his work. 

Mr. Benjamin faces challenges in his business, which are to continue expanding his services, to have more clients in the garage and he will use this benefit to expand his business.

Mr. Benjamin is a hard working individual, he is very grateful for the opportunity he is being given.

loans.use: to buy oxygen and work tools.

loans.name: Las Crucitas Group

texts.es: El grupo está integrado por tres socios esforzadas y exitosas, coordinado por la señora Sebastiana de 40 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 16 y 10 anos, es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio y solicita el crédito para la compra de productos para su negocio como es arroz, frijol, azúcar, sal, pan, sopas marucham, sopas maggui, plátanos verde, plátanos maduros, alka seltzer, sal andrews, y más, la socia cuenta con la ayuda de su comapnero e hijo para la compra y venta de los productos. Los otros socios son la señora Ysabel de 64 años quien se dedica  a la compra-venta de frutas por temporadas y el señor Leonardo de 47 años dedicado a la compra-venta de frutas por temporadas.
texts.en:
This group consists of three hardworking and successful businesspeople, coordinated by Sebastiana who is 40 years old, has a partner and is the mother of two children of 16 and 10 years old. She is the owner of a grocery store in her home, and is asking for a loan to buy products for her business such as rice, beans, sugar, salt, bread, Maruchan [instant] soup, Maggi soup, green bananas, ripe bananas, alka seltzer [indigestion tablets], andrews salt, etc. She relies on the help of her partner and son with buying and selling her products.

The other business partners are Ysabel, of 64 years of age, who works buying and selling fruit seasonally, and Leonardo of 47 years old, who works buying and selling of fruit seasonally.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, bread etc. for a grocery store.

loans.name: Niusy Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias y coordinado por la señora Sayda de 34 años de edad casada y madres de dos hijo de las edades de 6 y 2 anos, es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace seis años en su domicilio además comercializa ropa nueva en su comunidad, solicita el crédito para invertirlo en arroz, frijol, azúcar, aceite, pan, alka selzer, ranitidinas, panadol, camisas para niños, bóxer, calcetas, braziers, bikinis, entre otros; Con créditos anteriores la socia a logrado obtener mayores ganancias que han sido de beneficios para su superación.  Otros de los socios es el señor Luis de 74 años dedicado a la compra-venta de leche y la señora Yessenia de 32 anos comerciante de ropa de segunda en su domicilio.
texts.en: This community bank has three members.  The group's coordinator, Sayda, 34, is married and has two children, 6- and 2-years old, respectively.  Sayda opened a general store six years ago in a space in her house.  She sells clothes as well as groceries.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, bread, alka seltzer, diapers, baby clothes, children's clothes, underwear and other merchandise.  Sayda used past loans to increase her income and standard-of-living.  The other members of the community bank are Sr. Luis, 74, who has a milk sales business and Sra. Yessenia, 32, who buys and sells used clothing.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion plants and harvests corn and other root crops for sale. She has been doing this to aid her family's daily needs. She also has a big banana farm where she earns more income than usual. 

With her generated farm income, her previous loan used for farming was successfully repaid. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is married with five children. She is 43 years old and lives in Lumad, Pagadian City, Phillippines.

She is a farmer and raises some animals such as goats to earn a living, She been doing this for five years. She has requested, for this type of living, a loan to buy a new goat and fertilizer for gardening. This she thought would help her for added income.

Myrna  has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to plan to buy more livestock for a living.

loans.use: to buy  new a goat and fertilizer for gardening.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is from Oroquieta-Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao; Philippines. She is married and they have four children. Her husband is a farmer who plants rice, corn, and other agricultural commodities. 

Farming is their main source of living and Socorro has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself helping her husband plowing the rice field, planting corn and other varieties of agricultural commodity. 

In need of additional working capital, Socorro decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 25,000. This loan is intended for rice land redemption: the income of the rice land shall be the pay-off to the loan she requested in PMPC. 

Socorro has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Socorro is very thankful to Paglaum Coop because if were not for Paglaum she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a land tractor someday to use for cultivating their land

loans.use: pay for rice land redemption

loans.name: Yesly Aminda

texts.es: Yesly, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes.  Desde hace 6 meses decidió poner su propia pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica como arroz, frijoles, harina, manteca, azúcar, condimentos, refrescos, churros, pan, huevos etc. para vender y generar ingresos para el hogar. Ella  anteriormente le ayudaba a su esposo en el taller de ebanistería. pero decidió por su propio negocio. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 lempiras para surtir y aumentar las ventas, va comprar, harina, azúcar, arroz, manteca, condimentos, productos de aseo y para comprar un frízer o congelador. Tiene como meta ampliar el local del negocio y mantenerlo surtido.
texts.en: Yesly, 32, is married and has one son.  She lives in Choloma, Cortes.  She started a grocery business 6 months ago and sells the kinds of products that everyone needs from day to day: rice, beans, flour, butter, sugar, condiments, soft drinks, churros, bread, eggs, etc.  The business provides an extra income for her family.  Yesly used to help her husband with his business but decided to set up her own, separate business.  She is applying for a 15,000-lempira loan, part of which she will use to stock her store with products--flour, sugar, rice, butter, condiments, toiletries--that she will resell and part to buy a freezer.  For the future, Yesly wants to grow her business and ensure that it is well-stocked.

loans.use: to buy equipment and merchandise for her grocery business.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 9 años y 1 año de edad. Sandra se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva de forma ambulante en las diferentes zonas de su localidad.  Tiene 7 años de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Sandra solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea mejorar las condiciones del techo de la vivienda el cual se encuentra deteriorado. Con el crédito solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, polines y pagará la mano de obra para la reparación.
texts.en: Sandra, 26, lives with her husband and two children, 9-years and 1-year old, respectively.  Sandra has been a street vendor for 7 years.  She sells clothing in the neighborhoods around her house and has many loyal customers.  The roof of her house is in a terrible state and she is applying for a FUSAI loan that she will use to pay for labor and materials--beams and metal sheeting--to replace it.

loans.use: to pay for the labor and materials she needs to replace her roof.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 58 years old, married with three adult-aged children.  She lives in Birayan, Rizal.  She has engaged in cocoland farming  (coconut trees) for 20 years.  

She become a member of Paglaum last 2003 and applied her loan to purchase fertilizer.  She has a quarterly income of PHP 25,000 gross from the said cocoland.  The profit they earned from their cocoland will be saved with Paglaum for their savings, retirement and basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Orquidea Group

texts.es: El grupo está integrado por tres exitosos socios, coordinado por la señora Karla de 33 años de edad casada y madre de 2 hijos de las edades de 7 años y 18 meses, ofrece el servicio de comida todo los día; además es propietaria de una mini pulpería en su domicilio, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para la compra de los productos a utilizar y una trabajadora para la elaboración de la comida, el credito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, platano verde, platano maduro, carne de res, carne de pollo, etc. Los otros socios son el señor Abraham de 24 años que comercializa bisutería y ropa interior, y la señora Anielka de 35 años dedicada a la compra-venta de pan.
texts.en:
The group consists of three successful business partners. Coordinated by Karla, 33 years of age, married and mother of two children of the ages of 7 years and 18 months, offering all-day food services; furthermore she owns a mini grocery store in her home, she relies on the help of her husband for the buying of products to use and an employee for the making of the food, the loan she is asking for is to buy rice, beans, oil, green bananas, ripe bananas, beef, chicken, etc.

The other business partners are Abraham of 24 years old who sells jewelry and underwear, and Anielka of 35 years old who works buying and selling bread.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, green bananas, ripe bananas, beef, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Maria Griselda

texts.es: María tiene 19 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre. María es una joven muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta. Ella se gana la vida trabajando en una pupuseria y comedor cercano a su localidad. De esta forma colabora con la economía del hogar y junto a su madre llevan el sustento diario. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir una pared en la vivienda la cual esta hecha a base de plástico y no es muy seguro. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro.  Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poder proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Maria is 19 years old, and she lives in her own home with her mother. Maria is a hardworking young woman, responsible and honest. She earns a living working in a pupuseria and an eatery near her home. In this way, she helps with the family finances, and together with her mother they earn their living.

Maria is asking for the loan from FUSAI because she wants to build a wall in the house. It is currently made of plastic and isn't very safe. With the loan balance she will buy cement, sand, bricks and iron. She hopes to be able to rely on this support and therefore proceed with the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, bricks and iron to build a wall in her house.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 64 years old, married, and has eight children. She lives in Calaran, Calamba.  

She has engaged in retailing of rice for 20 years. She has monthly income of 4,000 PHP doing this business. 

In 2009, she signed up with Paglaum because she wanted to expand her business. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase additional bags of rice to sell. The profit she earns in her business will be saved in Paglaum for retirement and to help support their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Dolores Margarita

texts.es:
Dolores de 38 años de edad, vive solamente con sus padres.


Ella posee una tienda que tiene en su casa, donde vive la trabaja desde  hace tres años con el apoyo de sus padres que debido a que no ha podido conseguir un trabajo,  opto por abrir su propio negocio que también se ayudan con un hermano menor para atender por lo menos unas 12 horas diarias; por lo que existe una misión muy esperanzadora. 

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar productos no perecederos como zapatos, sandalias y ropa para varones, que es lo que en este momento no posee en su tienda y entonces será cuando se sienta muy satisfecha con la institución 

El sueño más grande de ella, es conseguir un trabajo estable que le permita la sostenibilidad y gozar de beneficios como el seguro, para cuando este de la tercera edad, y como plan 2 es ser una empresaria de tiendas de productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Dolores, 38, is single and lives with her parents.  She operates a general store in her house.  Her parents helped her start the business because she couldn't find paid work.  She works 12 hours a day, with help from a younger brother, because she needs the business to support herself.  

Dolores is applying for a loan that she will use to buy merchandise--shoes, sandals, men's clothing--for resale.  She doesn't have those items in stock now and says that adding them will make her business more attractive to customers.  

Dolores' dream, she says, is to have a steady job with a steady income that will provide her with a measure of security one day.  For now, her goal is to make a success of her store.

loans.use: to stock her store with merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 52 years old, married and has five grown children. She is from Calaran, Calamba. 

She has engaged in sand and gravel retail for 12 years together with her husband. They have monthly income of 5,000 PCP net of the said business. 

She joined in Paglaum last 2003 and has taken several loans already. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase sand and gravel to meet the existing order they have. The profit she earns will be deposited to Paglaum for savings because they plan to purchase a delivery truck for their business.

loans.use: to purchase sand and gravel.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Calaran, Calamba. 

She has engaged in "balut" (boiled, fertilized duck eggs) vending for 14 years and earns monthly income of 3,500 PHP doing that work.  

She joined Paglaum in 2001 because she wanted to help her husband. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase additional trays of eggs for balut vending. The profit she earns will be saved to Paglaum for school expenses of her children and additional capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of eggs for balut vending.

loans.name: Maura Erenia

texts.es: Maura tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 23 años de edad. Maura tiene tres años de contar con una pequeña tienda en la cual vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Muchas personas la prefieren dado que es muy respetuosa, amable y sobre todo mantiene los productos necesarios para sus clientes. Maura desea encementar el piso del corredor de la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, grava y pago de mano de obra para la mejora.
texts.en: 41-year-old Maura lives in her own home with her husband and 23-year-old son. For the last three years, she has been running a little shop where she sells a range of basic goods. Many people prefer to buy from her because she is very polite and friendly and, above all, because she stocks the essential items her customers need. Maura wants to concrete over the floor of her hallway and so she is applying to FUSAI for this loan to buy cement, sand, gravel and to pay workers to carry out the improvements.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and to pay workers to concrete over the floor of her hallway.

loans.name: Las Amistosas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco

La socia es la Sra. Pilar ella es conviviente y tiene 33 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de librería, la socia vende cuadernos, lapiceros, libros entre otros artículos de escritorio, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de librería. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar libros, borradores, cuadernos y lapiceros.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “LAS AMISTOSAS” community bank. This bank is located in the district of Urcos, in the province of Quispicanchis, Cusco department.

The member's name is Pilar. She is 33 years old, and has a partner and two children. She works in her bookshop, selling workbooks, pens and pencils, books, and other office items. She works from 8:00 a.m until 7:00 p.m, and has had this business for eight years. IT is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her bookshop. She is requesting a loan to buy books, rubbers, workbooks, pens and pencils.

The two photos on either side of the group photo were taken after the meeting as these members were unable to attend because of work.

The other members make a living with businesses selling animals, vegetables, and groceries, and a restaurant.

The member is grateful to everyone who form a part of this dream via this medium and is committed to making her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy books, rubbers, workbooks, pens and pencils.

loans.name: El Chaguite Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, coordinado por la señora Rosa de 44 años de edad acompañada y madre de dos hijos, se ha dedicado al destace de cerdo desde hace quince años en su domicilio y solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos en pie. Las otras socias son la señora Agustina de 49 anos propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, Angelica de 30 anos dedicada a la venta de pescado en el municipio de Tipitapa y Damaris quien se dedica a la pesca.
texts.en: The solidarity group is made up of four female workers.  Its coordinator is Rosa, who is 44 and married with two children. She has worked slaughtering pigs at her home for fifteen years and she is seeking this loan to buy live pigs. The other members of the group are Agustina, who is 49 and owns a grocery shop which she runs from her home, Angelica, who is 30 and sells fish in the town of Tipitapa, and Damaris who works as a fisherwoman.

loans.use: to buy live pigs

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: La señora Emiliana es una mujer exitosa en su vida laboral, de 49 años de edad y soltera es propietaria de un tramo en el mercado de Granada donde se dedica a la compra-venta de calzados desde hace 15 anos, además comercializa bisutería, esta socia solicita el crédito para la compra de sandalias, zapatillas, zapatos para damas, chapas, anillos, y más. La socia ha trabajo con esta institución por doce ciclos por lo que ha demostrado ser una persona trabajadora y honrada.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a successful woman in her working life. At 49 years old, single, she is the owner of a stall in the Granada market where she has worked buying and selling footwear for 15 years. She also sells jewelry. She is asking for this loan to buy sandals, slippers, ladies' shoes, metal shoe taps, rings, etc.

She has been with this institution for 12 cycles because she has shown herself to be a hardworking and honorable person.

loans.use: to buy sandals, slippers, ladies' shoes, metal shoe taps, rings, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old and lives in Lumbia, Pagadian City. She is married and has two children.

Elizabeth has a business selling food. She earns about 2,000 PHP each month doing this business.

Elizabeth has requested a loan to buy raw ingredients for her food-vending business.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 47 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married and has one child.
 
Perla has a sari-sari store that sells assorted goods. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to restock her store with basic commodities.

Perla has been a member of PMPC for nine years.  In the future, Perla hopes to save.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is married and has two children. She is 68 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Leonora is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy 20 sacks of fertilizers and pesticides.

Leonora has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Leonora hopes to save.

loans.use: to buy 20 sack of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a 59-year-old member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative from Songculan, Siquijor, industriously tending to her hog-raising activities. She single and she personally takes charge of her business. 

The business is doing well. Vicenta has humbly learned the techniques of how to enjoy business and at the same time make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business are nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes she has business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy businesswoman. 

Now, Vicenta sees a good opportunity to expand her business. She is requesting PHP 14,900 from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional feeds and piglets.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es: Aracely, tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Hace un año que se dedica a vender productos lácteos como ser queso, mantequilla requesón, crema etc. Este producto lo vende de forma ambulante. Ha solicitado 15,000 lempiras para comprar quesos, crema, mantequilla, requesón para surtir y vender. Su propósito es mantener el negocio surtirlo y poderle dar la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aracely is 32 years old and lives in San Pedro Sula.  She and her husband live in a common-law relationship.  She has four children with him.  

A year ago she started to work selling dairy products such as cheese, butter, requesón [similar to ricotta cheese], cream, etc.; she is a mobile vendor of these items.  She has requested 15,000 lempiras to buy cheese, cream, butter, and requesón to stock and sell.  

Her goal is to keep her business stocked and to be able to give her children an education.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, butter, and requesón cheese, to stock and sell

loans.name: Leonor Del Carmen

texts.es:
Leonor de 34 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado de educación básica. Está casada  su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería. Leonor ha procreado 3 hijos con su pareja,  los cuales están estudiando y viven en casa del cliente aun; también vive la madre de ella quien ella cuida desde hace mucho tiempo. 

Leonor atiende los oficios del hogar, pero también es agricultora es la mano derecha del esposo en el cultivo de maíz, frijol, maicillo entre otros productos. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde que se casó. Aunque ella aprendió la actividad desde que era muy joven,  se decide dedicar a esta actividad debido que es la única forma de  ayudar a su esposo y sacar a delante a su familia, el horario de trabajo del cliente es de aproximadamente 6 horas al día. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abonos, semillas fertilizantes, herbicidas, entre otros productos propios de la agricultura.  El préstamo mejorara la producción agrícolas y por tanto los ingresos. La necesidad a satisfacer será la de tener los insumos a tiempo para cultivar el alimento e ingreso principal de la familia.

Los sueños de la señora son seguir trabajando de la mano con su esposo,  sacar adelante a sus hijos, sueña con ver a sus hijos adultos y preparados académicamente para que tengan una vida digna espera que ellos sean personas de bien que sirvan a la sociedad. El préstamo le ayudara a tener los insumos necesarios  para cultivar. Desea ampliar su negocio sembrando otros productos agrícolas como hortalizas, verduras entre otros así ampliara su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonor is 34 years old.  She studied through the sixth grade in elementary school.  She is married; her husband works in agriculture and cattle.  With her husband, Leonor has three children who are students and still live at home.  Her mother also lives there; she has cared for her for a long time.

Leonor takes care of the household chores but also is a farmer.  She has been her husband’s “right-hand man” in growing corn, beans, and sorghum, among other items.  She has done this work since she got married.  Although she learned this work when she was very young, she decided to do the work because it is the only way to help her husband and get her family ahead.  Her work schedule is about six hours daily.

The loan that she is requesting from Credicampo is to buy soil amendments, seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides, among other agricultural products.  The loan will improve their production, and therefore their income.  Having the supplies on time for planting the crops, as well as the family’s main income, is the primary need that will be satisfied.

Leonor’s dreams are to keep working alongside her husband, to get her children ahead.  She dreams of seeing her children all grown up and academically prepared to have a worthy life.  She hopes that they will be people of means who serve society.  The loan will help her to have the necessary supplies for cultivating her crops.  She wants to expand her business, sowing other crops such as greens and vegetables, among other crops, and thus increase her business.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides, among other agricultural products

loans.name: Berta Del Socorro

texts.es:
Berta de 34 años de edad, es una persona que estudio 6° grado de educación básica, hoy en día está acompañada, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando en un centro escolar público, cerca de la casa a dos cuadras de su vivienda, el esposo de  ella se dedica a la albañilería des de hace mucho tiempo, es  así que han ido sacando adelante a su familia.


Berta, se dedica a la elaboración de antojitos y ella misma sale a vender por la mañana y tarde en las colonias vecinas, este negocio lo tiene des de hace tres años empezó solo para vender en la casa y luego lo llevaba a domicilio y hoy en día los clientes ya la esperan en la casa, vale mencionar que no tiene más quien le ayude es ella sola quien hace y vende; por lo que se considera que trabaja todo el día y también hace los oficios de la casa y atiende a sus hijos.


El préstamo que esta  solicitando a credicampo, es para  comprar por mayor los elotes para dos días, yuca, aceite y una carreta para transportarla   hasta el lugar donde vende,  con la carreta llevara más venta y evitara una fractura por la carga en la cabeza, entonces estará mejorando su calidad de vida. 

Berta en el futuro sueña con tener un local tipo restaurante, donde le pueda ofrecer al público variedad de bocadillos tomando en cuenta que el municipio lo visitan muchas personas de diferentes partes del país y hasta de afuera por su agradable clima es un municipio turístico estos son sus mayores deseos.
texts.en:
Berta, 34, left school after the 6th grade.  She is married now and has two children who are studying at a local school.  Berta's husband has been a construction worker for many years.

Berta has a business making and selling antojitos.  She sells what she makes in the surrounding neighborhoods.  She started the business three years ago, only selling from home at first, then branching out so that she now delivers what she makes right to her customers' homes.  It's worth mentioning that Berta operates the business by herself.  Making the antojitos and selling them falls to her and her alone.  She also manages the household and takes care of the children.

Berta is applying for CrediCampo loan, part of which she will use to buy bulk supplies of yucca and cooking oil and the rest to buy a cart.  The cart will allow her to buy bulk supplies of the ingredients she needs and make the most of the available discounts.  

For the future, Berta would like to open a restaurant.  The mild climate of the region is popular with tourists who come here from all over the country and Berta thinks a restaurant would do very well.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for her food sales business.

loans.name: Zilola

texts.ru: Эту приветливую и вежливую продавщицу из города Исфары зовут Зилола. Ей 21 год. Она несмотря на свой молодой возраст уже разведена. К сожалению ее семейная жизнь неудачно сложилась и ей пришлось развестись с мужем. От брака у нее детей не имеются. Зилола сейчас живет у матери. У нее есть свой торговый бизнес. Она занимается продажей тканей и детской одежды в своей торговой точке на рынке. Зилола хорошо справляется своим бизнесом, клиенты довольны ее услугой и товаром. Для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот Зилола обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет приобрести сезонный товар и таким образом увеличить продажу товаров.
texts.en: This polite and friendly saleswoman from Isfara is named Zilola. She is 21 and already divorced despite her young age. Unfortunately her family life was unsuccessful and she had to divorce her husband. She does not have any children and currently lives with her mother. She has a retail business selling fabrics and children's clothing at the market. Zilola is good at her work and her customers are satisfied with her merchandise and services. Zilola requested a loan to buy seasonal clothing in order to her volume of sales.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seasonal children's clothing and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José tiene 45 años de edad y habita ne casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos de 4 años, 8 años y 24 años de edad. José posee un molino de nixtamal y una pequeña tienda lo cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario y dar a su  familia lo necesario. José desea construir una galera atrás de su vivienda para usar como bodega y guardar sus pocas pertenencias. Por lo anterior solicita crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. Espera poder contar con esta financiamiento y así poder proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: 45-year-old José lives in his own home with his wife and children aged 4, 8 and 24. José owns a nixtamal (corn-grinding) mill and a small shop which enables him to earn his living and provide for his family's needs. José would like to build a shed behind his house to use as a storeroom for his few possessions.  Therefore, he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanised sheeting, wood and nails. He hopes that the loan will be granted so he can start the building work as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheeting, wood and nails to build a shed to use as a storeroom.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: El señor Félix es un socio exitoso de 65 años de edad, soltero y propietario de un taller de zapatería en su domicilio por más de treinta años y solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima como es cuero sintético, galleta, pega, hilo hebilla, suelas altas, suelas bajas, entre otros, además tiene tres trabajadores para aumentar la producción y así aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en: 65-year-old Felix is a successful member.  A widower, he is the owner of a shoe-making business which he has run from his home for over thirty years. He is applying for the loan to buy raw materials such as synthetic leather, lasts, glue, thread, buckles, high soles, low soles etc.  He also has three employees to help him to increase production and boost his income.

loans.use: to buy synthetic leather, high soles, buckles, thread, glue etc.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is married with five children. Marianita is 41 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Marianita is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizers and pesticides. 

Marianita has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Marianita hopes to put up another business.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Wilmer Luis

texts.es: Wilmer es un humilde productor de chorizos, actividad que aprendió empíricamente lo que da fe de la gran inteligencia que posee Wilmer, esta actividad ha sido el sustento de su hogar por un periodo de dos años pues las extremas condiciones de pobreza que rodean a su entorno hacen que las personas ingenien la forma de sostener su familia y no son formas incorrectas o fuera de la ley de lo que más se enorgullece Wilmer es de estar rodeado de personas pobres, pero grandes en espíritu, personas que día tras día salen humildemente a buscar la comida para sus familias y este motivo de inspiración para Wilmer ver como sus semejantes nos e dejan caer en la situación si no al contrario como convierte este problema en una ventaja, en un motivo para mejorar cada vez más, un motivo que lo lleva a realizar su primer micro-crédito, con la intención de arreglar su máquina de moler y comprar materia prima para aumentar la producción por semana y hacer llegar su producto a mas restaurantes y lugares de distribución y cumplir sus sueño un sueño colectivo de entre toda la comunidad convertir su pueblo en un referente de trabajo y esfuerzo de como un grupo de humildes empleados transformaron un sector donde abunda la pobreza en un potencial barrio lleno de trabajadores y emprendedores.
texts.en: Wilmer is a humble chorizo producer, which he learned on his own, demonstrating his intelligence.  He has supported his household this way for two years, amid the poverty that surrounds him, which makes people find honest ways to support their families.  Wilmer is proud to be surrounded by such high spirited people who go out humbly each day to find ways to feed their families.  This inspires Wilmer; to see his peers refusing to fall, but quite the opposite; turning this problem into an advantage, a means to improve and a means to receive his first micro loan so he can fix his grinder and buy supplies to increase his weekly production and deliver his product to more restaurants and distribution centers.  He wants to achieve his dream of turning his village into a place of work and effort for a group of poor humble workers who will turn their poor area into one with abundant workers and employers.

loans.use: to fix his grinder.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 42 years old and lives in P-1 Upper Langcangan. 

In order to help the family, she sells plastic wares. She also operates a sari-sari store.

She became an active member of Paglaum MPC with a good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance to purchase additional inventories of plastic wares. She plans to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future, and to repair their house.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories of plastic wares.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 64 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She is very responsible with her household obligations and she has always been known to provide the best for her family. 

Luzminda is a farmer who plants fruits.

She wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is 53 years old, a widow and has seven children who are of adult age. She is a resident of Songculan, Siquijor, Siquijor. She earns a living through direct selling. 

She has been a member of PMPC for almost one year and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of 14,900 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase an additional collection of personal products.

Veneranda deeply wishes to maintain as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase additional personal products for direct selling

loans.name: Bright Group

texts.en: Bertha is in her early thirties and is married. She has two sons who are both in school. For seven years now, Bertha has been managing a shop that sells clothing, bags and shoes. She works from 7:30 am to 8:00 pm every work day and is able to make a good monthly profit. This is her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Bertha used the previous loan, which she paid back successfully, to buy more stock for her shop; she needs to restock her shop with in demand products to maximize her profit. Bertha received extra income due to her previous loan which she used to cover school fees and food expenses. She will use this loan to buy more clothes and bags to sell. She dreams that one day she will be able to expand her shop. Bertha will share this loan with her loan group "Bright" which has a total of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes and bags to sell.

loans.name: Luzvina

texts.en:
Luzvina is 41 years old, married and a resident of San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City, Philippines. Luzvina operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business with a starting capitalization of 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). Luzvina applied for her membership with PMPC in March 2013 and had her first loan to start her business. She was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. 

Now Luzvina is applying for 10,000 PHP to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy more goods fro her "sari-sari" (general store) business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 24-year-old and lives in Dolipos Alto Oroq. In order to help the family, she sells any kind of affordable items and operates a sari-sari (general) store. She became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing.

She wants to obtain financial assistance to restock her store with basic commodities. She plans to save more for a house renovation.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Corpusa

texts.en:
Corpusa joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013, and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). This loan is intended to to buy more sacks of wood charcoal to retail.

Corpusa dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy more wood charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
This is Gertrudes. She is 62 and a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Aquino and they have children. Gertrudes, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Gertrudes operates a house rental business. It is rented on a monthly basis. She also has a tailoring business for additional income. She earns a minimum of 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every monthly. To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to repair and maintain her room for rent. Gertrudes dreams of being successful in her business and hopes to make a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent.

loans.name: Persielyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Persielyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food market business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Persielyn is borrowing 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more stock of spices to sell in her food market.

Persielyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spices to sell in her food market.

loans.name: Esmaelita

texts.en:
Esmaelita is 59 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Esmaelita has an ice candy business in the Philippines. Esmaelita requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice candy making.

Esmaelita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Esmaelita would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice candy making.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 52 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rowena has a general store business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like snack food, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

Rowena has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack food, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Maybelyn

texts.en:
Maybelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries in her rice mill.

Maybelyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Maybelyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for rice grains and laborers' salaries in her rice mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of rice, gallons of vegetable oil, beans, dry pepper and kola nut

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts and shoes.

loans.name: Iktifae

texts.en:
Iktifae is an Iraqi married woman 39 years old. She has three children and she works to support her husband in the family and living expenses.
Iktifae is a seamstress and has her own modest work shop at home. She has practiced tailoring since she was a child by assisting her mother who was a seamstress as well.  In 2005, she started providing tailoring services from her house for living purposes and she has specialized in women clothes. She provides good quality with great prices and importantly she is the only seamstress in the neighborhood. 
Iktifae is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD. She will use this loan to buy a specialized sewing machine and an air-conditioner. She believes that with this loan, she will be able to grow her business and increase her profits. Most importantly, she will be able to provide her children a better life style.

loans.use: to buy a specialized sewing machine and an air-conditioner

loans.name: Najlae

texts.en:
Najlae is an Iraqi married woman 34 years old. She has two children and she works to support her husband in the family and living expenses.
Najlae is a seamstress and has her own modest work shop at home. She has practiced tailoring since she was a child and she was specialized in women clothes.  In 2005, she started providing tailoring services from her house for living purposes. She gained a built a great experience in this field and she provides good qualitity with great prices and importantly she is the only seamstress in the neighborhood. 
Najlae is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD. She will use this loan to buy a specialized sewing machine. She believes that with this loan, she will be able to grow her business and increase her profits. Most importantly, she will be able to provide her children a better life style.

loans.use: to buy a specialized sewing machine

loans.name: Hugo Ernesto

texts.es: Hugo tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y dos hijos de 8 años y 16 años de edad. Hugo trabaja como empleado en una empresa cercana a su localidad y es así como lleva el sustento a su familia y mantiene la economía del hogar junto a su compañera de vida. Hugo desea construir las paredes en el corredor de un lado de la vivienda dado que desea convertirlo en un cuarto dormitorio para sus hijos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro.
texts.en:
Hugo, 35, lives in his own house with his life partner and two children, ages 8 and 16.  Hugo works for a business near his town to support his family and the household finances along with his companion.

Hugo wants to build the walls along the corridor on one side of his house to convert it into a bedroom for his children.  This is why he's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in buying bricks, cement, sand, and rebar.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and rebar

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 43 years old and married with two children, both of them attend school. Mary Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Grace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 57 years old and married with two children. Helen works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Helen has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma.Elena is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Ma.Elena is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Ma.Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty-two loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ishmail

texts.en: This is 42 year-old Ishmail.  He is married and has 2 children aged 11 years and 14 months old; one attends school. He has 2 additional dependents, who live with him, attend school and also help with the domestic work.  Ishmail owns a clothing and footwear business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 4,897,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of SLL 6,000,000. Ishmail has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy dozens of jeans for men, sportswear, sneakers and t-shirts. In the future, Ishmail plans to expand his business. He wanted to open a cosmetic shop due to the economic trend but he could not meet his expectation.  There are also challenges of competitors.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy dozens of jeans for men, sportswear, sneakers and t-shirts.

loans.name: Tarapaca Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TARAPACA II” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felipa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de CD’s, venta de comida, venta de chinelas, tejido de máquinas, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felipa es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió porque anteriormente observar a sus compañeras de un trabajo anterior la forma de comercialización de estos productos, con un pequeño capital adquirido en Pro Mujer emprende un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cortes de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de los distribuidores mayoristas de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada  y tiene tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Tarapaca II" Community Association is beginning its first loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Focal Center. It is made up of 8 members and is administered by a board of directors, of which Felipa is the president. Loans that members of this community association are taking out are varied, and include: blanket sales, CD sales, food sales, slipper sales, sewing machines, and vegetable sales.

The loan that they will receive will benefit small businesses where Felipa is a member. She reports that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago after her sister-in-law, who is a member of the institution, invited her. She currently has a business weaving blankets. She learned this business when she watched her co-workers at a previous job make these products. With a small amount of capital from Pro Mujer, she began her independent business.

The loan that she will receive is to increase working capital by purchasing cuts of blankets in bulk. She will obtain these from bulk distributors in the city of El Alto and later make and sell them to order. This job allows her to earn money to support her family, since she is married with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health area and training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase cuts of blankets.

loans.name: Los Polanco Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias exitosas, coordinado por la señora Jazmina de 35 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres hijos, se dedica a comercializar perecederos en el mercado de Masaya y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de plátanos y tamarindo, con el fin de aumentar las ganancias. Las otras socias son las señoras Brunilda de 37 años comerciante de frutas además vende carne y pescado, y Hortensia comerciante de frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad.
texts.en: This communal group is made of three successful members and the coordinator is Mrs. Jazmina. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She makes a living by selling perishable items in the market Masaya. The loan she is asking for will be used to purchase plantains and tamarinds with the goal of earning more money. The other members of the group are Brunhilda, who is 37 years old and sells fruit as well as meat and fish, and there is Hortensia who sells fruit in the municipal market.

loans.use: purchase tamarinds and plantains.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 27-year-old married father of one child. He and his wife, who is an employed accountant, work hand in hand to cover their family expenses.  Mohamad has worked in the aluminum sector for 16 years and set up his own workshop around a year ago. In the beginning, he had high hopes regarding his business; however the lack of capital hindered its growth. This did not stop Mohamad from fulfilling his ambition and his positive vision towards life led him to a successful borrowing experience with Al Majmoua.  For two consecutive loan cycles, Mohamad was able to develop his business and further increase his income. Currently, he is acquiring a third YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua,  which he will use to purchase new equipment that is necessary for his workshop’s growth and expansion. According to Mohamad, these loans reinforce his hope for achieving his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment that is necessary for his workshop’s growth and expansion

loans.name: Dania

texts.en:
Dania is a 22-year-old single lady whose parents have always insisted that their daughter should receive the best education.  Currently, Dania is enrolled in university and she aspires to attain a university degree which will be her best qualification for a brighter future. 

In order to cover her education fees, Dania has been giving private lessons for eight years to the children in her neighborhood.  With the money she earns, she is also capable of assisting her parents with additional income in gratitude for their devoting their lives to supporting her, and since she is currently their sole breadwinner.  

Today, Dania is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to pay her university fees. This will make her more financially comfortable, as she can repay the amount in installments.

loans.use: To pay her university fees

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of rice to offer for sale.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to offer for sale.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 45 years old and married with four children.

Julie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Julie has been in this business for nine years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Julie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: John

texts.en: This is 40 year-old John.  He is married, and has 2 children aged 10 and 7 years, both attend school. He has 2 additional dependents, who live with him as they are  school going children who also help in domestic work.  In 2005, John established his tailoring business. He began his business because he dropped out of school at Form 4 due to lack of support. He later entered into a vocational training school where he was trained in tailoring for a year and six months, and after graduating he established his own tailoring shop.  Working 6 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase dozens of "gara" material, "Bamakoh", cotton materials, poplin, satins and sewing materials. In the future, John plans to purchase a refrigerator for his wife to start selling drinks, water and ice cubes. The loan will help to maximize their profit.  Sometimes, he has a delay in sewing customers' dresses due to lack of adequate capital to buy more materials.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of "gara" material, "Bamakoh", cotton materials, poplin, satins and sewing materials.

loans.name: Bertha Nelly

texts.es: Bertha es una amigable mujer de 52 años de edad que ha dedicado su vida al trabajo y la crianza de sus tres hijos, nacida en el seno de un humilde hogar Bertha junto a su esposo han sabido de alguna u otra manera sostener su familia, ha realizado diferentes actividades desde oficio varios, venta de productos, que es la actividad que desempeña en la actualidad, gracias a la ayuda y cooperación de una amiga que le mostró la manera en que operaba dicho negocio. Bertha para iniciar esta nueva actividad tuvo un gran inconveniente y era la falta de capital para iniciar su negocio, un problema muy común en este grupo de emprendedores de Colombia que tienen todas las ganas de trabajar y ser alguien en la vida pero la falta de dinero los retrasa, los desanima hasta tal punto de dejar sus sueños y solo ser un empleado, pero el capital no fue un impedimento para Bertha pues con la ayuda de un microcrédito pudo iniciar su negocio, a pesar de su edad ella sueña en grande quiere hacer crecer su negocio, darse una mejor calidad de vida, tener cosas que en anteriores años solo puedo soñar por su condición económica, esto llevo a Bertha a solicitar una oportunidad y es una ayuda financiera para comprar mercancía con el objetivo de aumentar sus ingresos y ampliar los clientes, para seguir soñando, seguir ilusionándose con que una mejor vida la espera que solo necesita un esfuerzo y apoyo para lograr sus metas
texts.en: Bertha is a friendly woman who is 52 years old. She has devoted herself to her work and to bringing up her three children.  Having been born into a humble family, Bertha, along with her husband, have managed to support their family.  They have had various different jobs, including selling goods, which is what they are doing currently thanks to the help and cooperation of a friend who showed them how she ran a shop of this kind. When she first started out in this business, Bertha faced the difficulty of shortage of capital to get the shop up and running.  This is a very common problem in this group of entrepreneurs in Colombia who are all very keen to work and make something of themselves. They are, however, held up by the lack of money and lose their motivation and end up giving up on their dreams and just work for someone else. But capital was not a problem for Bertha because she was granted a microloan which enabled her to start up her shop. In spite of her age, she has big ambitions - she wants to extend her business, have a better quality of life and have things which she could only dream of before when she was in dire straits. This led Bertha to and look for an opportunity in the form of financial help to buy merchandise to help her increase her income and clientele so she can continue hoping for and dreaming of a better life which just depends on her efforts and some support to help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase her income and clientele

loans.name: Luis Felipe
