texts.es: Luis es un joven, trabajador, humilde y honrado de 21 años de edad a quien le ha tocado vivir una vida dura pues desde su temprana edad le ha tocado dedicarse de lleno al trabajo olvidando sus metas y aspiraciones que tenía cuando cursaba sus años de bachillerato los cuales eran asistir a una universidad, terminar una carrera para poder ser alguien en la vida, pero Luis dejo momentáneamente estos sueños para ayudar en su familia pues no podía permitir que aguantaran hambre y es así como gracias a unos prestamos comenzó un negocio de comidas rápidas con el que se siente bendecido pues ha tenido éxito, sus comidas gustan por su precio, aseo, y sabor, este negocio le ha permitido a Luis volver a creer, en que puede retomar sus sueños por este motivo solicita un microcrédito para inventar en un carro de comidas rápidas y compra de mercancía con el que espera generar más ventas, aumentar sus ingresos y poder realizar su sueño que es mantener su hogar y poder asistir a una universidad
texts.en: Luis is young, hard working, humble, and 21 years old. Life has been hard on him, since he was young he had to dedicate himself to work and had to set aside his goals and aspirations when he was in high school, like his dream of going to university and getting a degree that would help him to be someone in this life. But Luis was unable to follow his dreams because his family needed his help; he could not let them go hungry. And so, thanks to a few loans, he was able to start his own fast food business and he feels blessed that he has had so much success.  People like his foods because they are cheap, clean and flavorful. This business has allowed Luis to believe, once again, that he could follow his dreams. And so, he is asking for a loan in order to invest in purchasing a fast food cart and to purchase merchandise with the hopes of generating more sales, increase his earnings and to be able to see his dream come true of being ale to maintain his home and to go back to school.

loans.use: purchase a fast food cart and merchandise.

loans.name: Bosco Monge Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socios trabajadores y coordinado por el señor de 53 años, soltero pero padre de dos hijos de las edades de 4 y 11 años, elabora alimentos a base de maíz como es el nacatamal y tortillas principalmente, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 20 años y cuenta con la ayuda de su mamá, por lo que el crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de maíz, carne de cerdo, arroz, cebolla, chiltoma, ajo, achote, etc. Los otros integrantes son las señoras Adriana de 43 años de edad propietaria de un auto lavado, e Ingrid comerciante de ropa de segunda y productos AVON
texts.en: The communal group is made of three workers and coordinated by Mr. Claudio, who is 53 years old, single, but who is the father of two children who are 4 and 11 years old. He makes a living by making food with a corn base like nacatamal and tortillas. He has had this business for 20 years and he counts on his mother's help. He is asking for a loan in order to purchase corn, pork, rice, onion, chilies, garlic and achiote (an adobo condiment). The other members of the group are Mrs. Adriana, who is 43 years old and owns a laundromat, and Ingrid who sells second hand clothing and Avon products.

loans.use: purchase corn, pork, rice, onion, chilies, garlic, achiote etc.

loans.name: Makongo Kk Group

texts.en: Hamisa is in her early forties, is married and has five children, two of whom are in school. Hamisa has two businesses: a charcoal store and she sells water. She has built a brick well, which helps her to store water after she purchases it from a big supplier. She resells the water in buckets to smaller customers. Hamisa has been in these businesses for five years and is able to make a good profit each month. This is Hamisa's sixth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy more water from suppliers and sacks of charcoal for her store. She used her previous loans to restock her store with more sacks of charcoal and to build her well for storing water. She is so happy with Kiva's loan support which makes her business grow. Hamisa has paid back her previous loans successfully. She dreams of expanding her business to generate high returns. She will share this loan with her loan group "MAKONGO KK" which has a total of eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more water from suppliers and sacks of charcoal for her store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 39 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. Rosemarie and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Rosemarie is taking out a housing loan of 6,575 PHP to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She plans to recover through her general store business. With your help, Rosemarie can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she plans to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is 48 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Merla has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. Merla requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like body lotion, shampoo, perfume, and other personal products.

Merla has been in this business for six years. In the future, Merla would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like body lotion, shampoo, perfume, and other personal products.

loans.name: Mercedith

texts.en:
Mercedith is 40 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mercedith has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Mercedith requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant.

Mercedith has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Mercedith would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Retchel

texts.en:
Retchel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Retchel is 32 years old and both of her children are in school.

Retchel sells personal products in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more items, like soap, shampoo, curtains, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Retchel has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items, like soap, shampoo, curtains, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Victor  O.

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Victor O. He is married and has two children, aged seven and five years old. One is a school-going child. 

In 2007, Victor O. established his phone accessories and top-up cards business. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,625,000 every month from this business. 

Victor O. would like a loan in the amount of SLL 6,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now he requires a new loan in order to purchase top-up units, e-voucher top-ups, and mobile phone batteries.  

In the future, Victor O. plans to develop a piece of land and expand the business. This loan will also help him solve some domestic issues. He bought a commercial motorbike and piece of land to build his house. He did not rent a shop because of inadequate capital. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase top-up units, e-voucher top-ups, and mobile phone batteries.

loans.name: Vidala

texts.en:
Vidala works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

Vidala has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family. With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life more quickly.

In the future, Vidala would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Naili

texts.en:
Naili, 54 years old, lives in Akhaltsikhe district with her husband and son, who is temporarily unemployed. Naili and her husband both work for private organizations, earning fixed monthly salaries. 

In order to increase their income and more effectively meet all daily costs, Naili has decided to start an agricultural business. She requested a loan that was approved under a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. Naili plans to purchase a plot of agricultural land upon which she will plant potatoes to sell at a good price seasonally. This additional income will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family. 

Naili will be grateful to lenders giving her a chance to increase their productivity. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural land and plant potatoes

loans.name: Over Manuel

texts.es:
Over es un hombre trabajador que le gusta la vida humilde del campo, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos que son el centro de su vida.
Over inicia su negocio al sentir la necesidad de proveer ingresos mas estables a su hogar y otorgarles una mejor educación a sus hijos, tiene un criadero de cerdos al lado de su casa donde su principal función es la producción y venta de estos animales; su esposa es un gran apoyo y motivación en el negocio.
el solicita un préstamo para comprar un lote de cerdos y de esta forma darle un impulso a su actividad, esto lo ayudara económicamente para el sustento de su familia.
su mayor sueño es poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Over is a working man who enjoys the taste of modest life in the country. He lives with his wife and two children who are the center of his world. Over started his business feeling the need to provide more stable income for his household and provide his children with better education.

He has an area for the pigs by his house. It's principal function is the production and sale of these animals. His wife is a great help and motivator for the business. Over is requesting a loan to buy a farrow of pigs and in this way expand his business. This will help the economic support of the family. His main dream is to see his children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy pigs wholesale.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей — пенсионер, ему 59 лет. На пенсии он уже более 5 лет. Все это время они с женой занимаются семейным бизнесом и Сергей трудится на своем дачном участке. 
Сумма в 5 000 гривен необходима Сергею для того, чтобы оплатить медицинские услуги. Дело в том, что у Сергея давно начались проблемы со зрением и оно стало падать. Полученные от КИВА средства он планирует вложить в операцию по коррекции зрения. Несмотря на существующие проблемы со здоровьем, Сергея не унывает и надеется, что все наладится и с его состоянием здоровья.
texts.en:
Sergei is 59 and has been retired for more than five years. During this time, he and his wife have been working in the family business and Sergei works in his garden plot.

Sergei needs this sum of 5,000 grivens in order to pay for medical services. For a long time, he has had vision problems and he is losing his ability to see. He plans to use the loan amount from Kiva to pay for an operation to correct his eyesight. Despite his health problems, Sergei stays positive and he hopes that everything will work out with the state of his health.

loans.use: to pay for his eye surgery

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en: Nigina is 29 years old. She is married and brings up two small children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Four years ago, Nigina began her own business selling clothes. She sells women's clothes. Nigina has her shop in a local market. She manages the business alone. She always tries to have variety in the assortment of her goods because the business struggles in the large local market. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy women's clothes for the new season. She hopes that in this way she will attract more clients. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Roziya

texts.en:
Roziya is 54 years old. She lives in a small village with her 3 children and grandchildren. She is widowed. 

Roziya has her own business deal. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 20 years. She has great experience in this field. Roziya works hard but she has low income and her family’s living conditions are poor. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

She wants to develop her business but she does not have enough money to buy more cattle. This loan will help her to increase the number of cattle and, from those profits, improve her family's living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling firewood. Alicia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Roquena

texts.en:
Roquena is 54 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Roquena's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Roquena has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Roquena has taken a PHP 9,975 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Roquena is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jinnie

texts.en:
Jinnie is 38 years old, widowed, and has four children who are in school. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Jinnie's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business buying and selling dried fish, and she is committed to regain what she lost. Jinnie is taking out a 10,000 PHP Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Jinnie has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Jinnie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Ma. Cecelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 47 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school. 

Mercedita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mercedita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mercedita has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, who is married, works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

Juliana has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She is requesting a loan of PHP 19000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

Juliana hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is thirty-eight years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marilou has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with a safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to buy building materials and pay for construction labor.

Marilou is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Analee

texts.en:
Analee works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Analee will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is fifty-nine years old and has ten children.  Norma is married and has one child who is in school.

Norma and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Norma is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Norma has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her buying and selling meat business.

With your help, Norma can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 44 years old and, with five children, three of whom are in school, Ester works very hard to provide for them.

Ester's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ester has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ester has taken a PHP 6,000 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ester is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 47 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn 's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her buying and selling fish business and is committed to regain what she lost. Jocelyn is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Jocelyn has been with NWTF since 2011 in her effort to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Flordelisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is forty years old and married with three children, two of whom are  in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lucita's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Lucita is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, a 61-year-old married mother of 10 children, one of whom is in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  For the past 35 years she has been operating a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. 

Rosita has requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Nilfa

texts.en:
Nilfa is forty one years old with seven children.  With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Nilfa's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Nilfa is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family, and to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Manuel Enrique

texts.es:
Manuel se ha dedicado toda la vida a las labores agropecuarias y del campo, todo esto lo aprendió al lado de su padre quien toda su vida fue campesino.
Él posee al rededor de 8 vacas y algunas hectáreas de tierra en las cuales tiene sus cultivos y alberga a sus animales.
El solicita un crédito para comprar insumos como abonos, fertilizantes y pesticidas, elementos necesarios para que la tierra sea fértil y produzca sus cultivos sanamente. al obtener estos elementos el podrá seguir ejerciendo su oficio de agricultor y podrá seguir llevando el sustento para su familia.
En estos momentos trabaja solo pero siempre ha querido generar empleo a otras personal de la región.
texts.en:
Manuel has done farm work all of his life.  He learned at his father's side, since he was farmer all of his life.  He has about eight cows and a few hectares of land where he has his crops and keeps his animals.  

Manuel is requesting this loan to purchase supplies, including compost, fertilizer, and pesticides so that the land is fertile and produce healthy crops.  Obtaining these items will allow him to continue working as a farmer and continue providing for his family.  He currently works alone but he has always wanted to generate employment for other people in the area.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to work the land, including fertilizer, pesticides, and irrigation.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Abu Bakarr.  He is married with two children ages three and seven. One of his children goes to school. In 2007, Abu Bakarr established his tailoring business. He began his business because he stopped at G.C.E. O’level and then joined his father in his tailoring business. Seven years later, after gaining some experience, Abu Bakarr opened his own tailoring shop.  He works seven days a week and 12 hours a day to earn about 4,614,000 SLL each month. Abu Bakarr’s major business challenge is time, as he sometimes is unable to meet customer demand. He is a hardworking and committed businessman.

Abu Bakarr is requesting a 3,000,000 SLL loan to purchase a cord-designing machine to design dresses for his customers. His loan will help him to buy the machine and generate more income. In the future, Abu Bakarr plans to build a house on his piece of land and provide an adequate education for his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cord-designing machine to design dresses for his customers

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is a 43-year-old married woman from village of Gumati, in the Tskhaltubo district. She lives with her husband who earns a fixed income working at a private company. His 385 GEL monthly salary is the only significant income for family. Madona takes care of their apple orchard but they use the produce for the family only. She has a great desire to start dairy farming. 

Madona is requesting a loan to purchase a milk cow to produce milk to sell locally. Her loan was approved through the framework of a joint Kiva and Credo start-up initiative that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Madona’s loan will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. She hopes that her loan with the start up program will help her to save money and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cow and start dairy farming

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 34 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Thelma has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition fee to study management.

loans.name: Ummu

texts.en:
Ummu runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Ummu lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Ummu is single and living with three people in the family home. 

Ummu began working with Ruma three months ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en:
Majdi is a 28-year-old single man, living with his family in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He is a University graduate, but, due to a high rates of unemployment in the country, Majdi couldn't find a job in order to improve the condition of his family. He is a talented and responsible professional young man. He has high determination. Majdi didn't receive the enough financial support from his family through his study in the university, as many students, because the family has a bad condition. He decided to work as a guard in the security company of the private sector in order to continue his studies in the college. In time, he could accumulate a good amount of money. After finishing his studies in the university, he continued as a guard. But, he sees this business is not comfortable for him. For this reason, Majdi is requested a loan of 500,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a taxi for transportation. He says this business is good for him. Through this business, Majdi can save a lot of money that will help him in provide his family with a lot of money. 

Majdi looks forward to opening a saving account in AMB. In the future, Majdi hopes to become a successful business man who can help in develop the country and bring to an end to the unemployment among the young people in Yemen.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi for transportation.

loans.name: Titi

texts.en:
Titi runs a small stall which sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Titi lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Titi is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Titi began working with Ruma two months ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Enkhbadral

texts.en:
Enkhbadral has been running his photo studio since 2011 when he graduated from university. His wife is an accountant who works for a private firm. The couple has a three-year-old daughter who stays at home with her grandmother. 

Enkhbadral is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy a computer for his studio. His previous computer is out of service. Enkhbadral’s new computer will increase his work efficiency and therefore improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Gombo-Erdene

texts.en: Two years ago, Mr. Gombo-Erdene bought a natural gas vehicle with loan funds raised on Kiva. This older man has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2004. His wife has retired from work and gets a state pension. They live in an old Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) which loses its heat very quickly due to its fragile and old felts. So Mr. Gombo-Erdene is requesting a loan of 575 USD to buy fiberglass, cotton and foam for ger insulation. After insulation he and his wife will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants will be released into the air.

loans.use: to insulate his home

loans.name: Atilano

texts.es:
Atilano es de la ciudad de Luque, es técnico de TV, y comenta que esta luchando por su familia, para poder darles todo lo que el no pudo tener, y comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en la compra de tornillos y un soldador.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de un nuevo soldador para poder seguir trabajando y luchando como lo viene haciendo. el agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo de poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Atilano is from the city of Luque. He is a television repair technician who is working hard for his family in order to give them everything that he could not have. He reports that his previous loan was used to buy screws and a welder. 
Today, he's seeking a new loan in order to invest in the purchase of a new welder to keep working hard as he always does. He is grateful for this new opportunity that he is getting to continue his work.

loans.use: to purchase a welder.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 42-year-old married mother of three children. She and her employed husband combine their incomes to provide their two children with a good education. 

Working from home, Salma designs all kinds of handicrafts; she has mastered this profession over time and has twenty years' experience. Her business development was smooth as she didn’t face any marked difficulties in establishing it.

An ambitious and talented woman, Salma believes that she is able to make promising progress and fulfill her dream of opening a shop and gaining more visibility through displaying her merchandise.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to renovate her house and pay the fees for the aluminum works in her kitchen.

loans.use: To renovate her house and pay the fees for the aluminum works in her kitchen.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es una persona que quedo huérfana de padre y madre vive sola en la ciudad de Luque. Actualmente trabaja en una farmacia.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad y dice que trabaja y estudia al mismo tiempo, pero que es la única forma que tiene para poder seguir con sus sueños.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Graciela was left an orphan, with no mother and father, and lives alone in the city of Luque. She is currently working in a pharmacy. She is studying for a career in accountancy and says that she is working and studying at the same time but this is the only way she can follow her dreams.

She is asking for this loan to pay for her fees, and with this she will be able to continue working and striving to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila was born in 1977. She is a responsible and careful mother of four children. 

Jamila is going to organize her own business because she needs money. Her husband is an entrepreneur, but he doesn’t take care of the family. Jamila is going to start a business with animal husbandry because she lives in a village and has a good opportunity to develop business with animal husbandry. Jamila will manage the business alone. 

She is asking for a loan of TJS 1,000 (somoni) to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for her new business.

loans.name: Esperanza En Cristo Group

texts.es: Este grupo está integrado por tres socios todos exitosos, coordinado por el señor Humberto de 57 años de edad y soltero, de dedica a la venta de eskimo por todas las calles de la ciudad, solicita el crédito para la compra de más productos eskimo como es cono, chocobanano, paleta de chocolate, de cocoa, sandwich, etc. Las otras socias son las señoras Blanca de 21 años de edad dedicada a la venta de ropa nueva en su comunidad y la Rosa de 35 años vendedor de pescado en el mercado de tipitapa.
texts.en: This group is made up of three successful members, coordinated by Humberto.  He is 57 years old and sells ice cream through all the streets in town.  He is asking for this loan to buy more ice cream items such as cones, chocobanana, chocolate pops, ice cream sandwiches, etc.  The other members are 21 year old Blanca who sells new clothing in her community, and 35 year old Rosa who sells fish in the Tipitapa market.

loans.use: to buy ice cream.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is 53 years old, married, and has five children. She owns a shoe store which is based in a local market. Here, she offers men’s shoes. She sells a variety of men’s shoes such as sport shoes or office shoes. She has been busy with this business for more than 15 years and has a great experience. Her husband helps her with managing the business.

To improve the business, she is borrowing the amount of 3,000 TJS from Imon International organization to buy shoes for the new season. She’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business before long.

loans.use: To buy shoes for the new season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and improve the land.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. She has repaid her previous loans.

Analyn is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell to customers. NWTF is re-listing her profile to support her efforts to further build her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruits to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for thirty years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. Daisy has since restarted her business.

Daisy is requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family. With your help, Daisy will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Virginia is 32 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

She  has a fishing business in the Philippines. Virginia has been in this business for seven years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like a fishing net, lamp, etc., for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like a fishing net, lamp, etc., for her fishing business

loans.name: Rodyna 22 Mayo Group

texts.en:
This group is called Rodyna 22 Mayo. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Taiz, Yemen. They know one another through friendship, business and neighborhood connections.

Siham is a 27-year-old married woman with three children. Her oldest child is 7 years old and the youngest one is 2 years old.  She is the leader of the group. Siham lives with her family in their own house. She is an uneducated woman, but she is very dynamic and vigorous. Her husband is an employee in the private sector, and he has a small shop in his area. He earns a good amount of money from this a small business, but the salary that he receives from the private sector is small. Unfortunately, the family's house is very old, and it threatens to fall down at any time. It needs a renovation. 

This thing needs a lot of money, but Siham and her husband don't have enough money to do that. As a result, Siham is requesting a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, wood, and planks in order to make a quick renovation for the house.

Siham's dream in the future is building one more floor and renovating it. She hopes to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials in order to  renovate the house.

loans.name: Ginelyn

texts.en:
Ginelyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 6,840 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana es una humilde mujer del campo y vive felizmente junto a su esposo y su hijo de 7 años.
Ella toda su vida fue ama de casa y muy dedicada a su hogar pero desde hace un tiempo decidió iniciar con su propio proyecto de vida.
Ella tiene un criadero de pollos y producción de huevos. Estos los vende en la plaza de mercado de su región, a sus vecinos y allegados.
ella solicita un apoyo económico para comprar pollos de engorde y gallinas de levante, ademas necesita adquirir concentrados para la crianza de sus animales.
Al obtener estos elementos impactara positivamente sus ingresos y podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
su mayor sueño es ver su negocio crecer y ser productivo, generando algún empleo para ayudar a alguien que lo necesite.
texts.en:
Adriana is a modest farmer who lives happily with her husband and their 7-year-old son. She was always a housewife, dedicated to her home, but a while ago she decided to start her own project. 
Adriana has a chicken and egg production farm. She sells her produce in the market square of her region, and also to neighbors and close ones. She is asking for financial support to buy chickens to fatten and hens to raise. She also needs to buy food concentrate to raise her animals.
Obtaining these elements will positively impact her income and will allow her to provide better quality of life for her family. Her biggest dream is to see her business grow and be productive, generating jobs for people who need them.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise and fatten and food concentrate to feed them.

loans.name: Tserendulam

texts.en: Mrs. Tserendulam has the profession of accountant and works at a private firm. Using her previous loan, she has completed her house-building work. Over the past two years, the house began to slowly lose its quality due to strong storms and heavy snowfalls. So she is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to buy vacuum-insulated windows, fiberglass and foam for house insulation. After insulation, no heat will be lost and then the family will burn less coal for heating and release fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to insulate her house

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 47 years old and married with four children. 

Beatriz is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Beatriz has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Beatriz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Estrella is 44 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Estrella has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle for her business.

Estrella has been in this business for 14 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 43 years old and married, with six children. With two children currently in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell, like rice, canned goods, noodles, coffee, and sugar.

Helen has been in this business for 15 years and she sells a variety of items, such as rice, canned goods, noodles, coffee, and sugar. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like rice, canned goods, noodles, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, irrigation equipment and fertilizers.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is a 56-year-old married woman who works as a salesperson in a shoe store. She and her husband, an employee at the same store, work together to cover their family expenses and improve their living situation. Paula has always hoped to employ her seven years of work experience to open her own store. However, limited finances have been a major setback for her dream.

Paula has already taken out and repaid three previous loans from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua. She has used these past loans to stabilize her financial situation. Today, she is requesting a new loan to cover the cost of needed dental treatment.

loans.use: to pay for dental work.

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Fotemogoban majoritairement  composé de femmes monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités, de chaussures plastiques, de céréales et de savons. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Malo (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes wax en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila  et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Malo espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Fotemogoban Group is largely made up of monogamous women.  They are, on average, 41 years old and have four children.  They all live in Kanadjiguila in the commune of Mandé/district of Kati.  The women know one another through family, neighbourhood and friendship.

The women are all retailers of high-quality wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), plastic shoes, cereals and soaps.  All the members of the group would like to improve their income from their businesses so, they have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first group loan.

Malo (sitting on the far right of the photo) has built up a strong reputation for the high quality of the clothing which she sells.  She will use her loan to buy ten wax pagnes from wholesalers at the main market.  She will then resell them in Kanadjiguila on foot, to a clientele made up mainly of women.  Malo hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and provide for some of the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Río Roma Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socios trabajadores  y coordinado por la señora Yolanda de 32 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres hijos, se dedica al destace de cerdo, por lo que el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cerdo en pies. Otro de los socios es el señor José de 21 años propietario de una pulpería en su domicilio y la señora Arlyn de 27 años quien elabora y vende nacatamales en su domicilio los fines de semana.
texts.en: The solidarity group is comprised of three partners, coordinated by Yolanda, one of these hardworkers. Yolanda, 32, is married and is the mother of three children. She earns her living butchering pork so she requests this loan to purchase pig trotters. Another partner is Jose, 21, who has a grocery store at home. Arlyn, 27, makes and sells tamales at home on the weekends.

loans.use: to purchase pig trotters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Shoumous

texts.en: Shoumous is a 27-year-old, Iraqi married woman. She has two children. She works to support her husband in order to help with the family and their living expenses. Shoumous is a seamstress and has her own modest workshop at home. She has practiced tailoring since she was a child by assisting her mother who was also a seamstress. In 2007, she started providing tailoring services from her house. She has gained great experience in this field and she provides good quality work at great prices. Shoumous is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD. She will use this loan to buy a specialized sewing machine. She believes that with this loan, she will be able to grow her business and increase her profits. The most important thing is that she will be able to provide her family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a specialized sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Ma. Nancy works hard to support her family. Ma. Nancy is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Nancy requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Ma. Nancy has been in this business for 16 years now.

Ma. Nancy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 57 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, coffee, sanitary napkins, cereals, etc.  Vicenta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dolphina

texts.en:
Dolphina, a mother of six, lives in Kitale, Kenya. She has been farming for nine years in the northern part of the Rift Valley. Her primary income source comes from selling milk. She also sells eggs and maize from her farm. To meet the high school fees and expenses at the beginning of school terms, she ventures into other small businesses.

There is nothing she enjoys more than a good harvest! However, poor weather has adversely affected the harvests of many farmers from this region. She ventured into dairy because milk production is not as affected with poor weather as maize farming. She named her dairy cow Chelel.

Dolphina is seeking a loan to purchase another dairy cow. She has seen the benefits of a dairy animal, and she wants to expand her asset base. With the additional cow, Dolphina will be able to repay the loan with ease and realize more income to pay her children’s school fees. At the moment, Dolphina is really focused on improved her farming activities.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Elvis Enrique

texts.es:
Elvis ha sido un honrado trabajador del campo, toda su vida se ha desenvuelto en las distintas circunstancias que este ofrece.
En estos momentos se dedica a la producción y venta de plátanos, alimento muy conocido en esta región del pacifico, estas labores las aprendió al lado de su padre quien ha sido un apoyo muy importante en su desarrollo empresarial.
Elvis solicita un crédito para comprar insumos agropecuarios que le permitan seguir desarrollando ésta actividad y tener unos ingresos mas estables. Entre estos insumos se destacan abonos y pesticidas ya que a estos productos los atacan muchas plagas.
esto le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y tener una mejor calidad y volumen de productos.
su desafío mas grande son las plagas que atacan sus cultivos y atrasan lo procesos de cosecha.
texts.en:
Elvis is an honest agricultural worker and he has spent all his life dealing with the circumstances of this trade. Right now he is growing and selling bananas, a very well known food in this region of the Pacific. He learned this work from his father, who has been an important support in his entrepreneurial development. 
Elvis is asking for a loan to purchase farm supplies to allow him to keep doing this activity and generate more stable income. Among the supplies are fertilizers and pesticides because these crops are attacked by many plagues. This will allow Elvis to increase his sales and improve the quality and volume of his product. His biggest challenges are the plagues that attack his crops and delay the harvesting process.

loans.use: tp purchase supplies to work the land such as fertilizer and pesticides to care for his crops.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
This is Mariam's second Kiva loan. With the first loan amount, she purchased calves and expanded her agribusiness. Mariam is still working hard on family owned agricultural land, harvesting products and using them for local trading. Her family has enlarged, so now Mariam has two grandsons and it is clear the family needs have increased. 

With the newly requested money she plans to start a trading business, particularly to open a toy shop in a rented place. Mariam will purchase products in the capital where a wider market is located and will then sell the products at increased prices in her region. She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure a better lifestyle for her family. This credit will be a great support for her. Mariam is very thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to develop her businesses.

loans.use: To open a toy shop

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya and borders Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

John is married and has four children. He is an ICT consultant while his wife is a community development officer. Both he and his wife are also farmers. They have been farming for fifteen years, and they are currently growing maize and sorghum on their farm. John is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some additional income and provide him with honey for food.

This is John's first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy more beehives and to support the needy. John's hope for the future is to gain more benefits from beekeeping and to address poverty in his area.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County in south-western Kenya, close both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Andrew is married and has eight children. He is a retired teacher and currently runs a local dairy cooperative. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for fifty years now and they are currently growing maize, millet, groundnuts and beans and they also rear livestock. Andrew is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income as well as provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Andrew's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Andrew's hope for the future is to have his children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gasoline and fashionable clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes pins, earrings, rain boots, etc., for her business

loans.name: Sabas

texts.es: Don Sabas, tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 8 hijos y reside en el municipio de Intibucá con su esposa, hijos y una nieta. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultiva papas desde hace 15 años. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar semilla de papa, insecticida, foliar para dar asistencia al cultivo existente y a futuros cultivos. El considera que va tener trabajo y que va superar su familia. En el futuro piensa generar empleo y dejarle a sus hijos una fuente de empleo.
texts.en:
Sabas is 48 years old. He is married, has 8 children and lives in the town of Intibucá with his wife, children and a granddaughter. 

He has always worked in agriculture and has been farming potatoes for 15 years. The crop is sold on the local market. He has requested a loan of 15,000 Lempiras ($800) with which he will buy seed potatoes, insecticide and foliar feed to help his existing and future crops. 

He believes that he will have work and that his family will come through. In future, he plans to create jobs and leave his children a source of employment.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes, insecticide and foliar feed to help in the cultivation of potatoes

loans.name: María Petronila

texts.es:
María de 54 años de edad,  estudio 4° año de educación básica,  en la actualidad está acompañada, su esposo se desempeña como jornalero, sus hijos los dos van a la escuela y dependen en su totalidad de ellos.

El negocio de María es una pequeña tienda que la inicio hace tres años y la ha mantenido por lo que sus clientes le solicitan un poco más de insumos para las actividades diarias de la cocina y ella tiene bien poco. Hoy en día le queda lugar de lavar ropa ajena, pero considera que si le aumenta a la tienda le dará más ingresos y no tendrá la obligación de salir hacer otras actividades. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar verduras como tomates, papas, cebollas, güisquiles, zanahorias, y otros para ofreces en la tienda a sus clientes.  


El sueño de ella,  es que los clientes encuentren lo que buscan en su tienda y que sus hijos conozcan el negocio para cuando estén grandes tengan una idea de lo que es el  negocio.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old and studied as far as the fourth year of basic education. Currently she has a partner and he works as a day labourer. Their children both go to school and are completely dependent on them.

María's business is a small shop which she set up three years ago and has kept going. Now her customers are asking her for a few more supplies for their everyday cooking needs, but she has very few. Nowadays she has space to take in laundry for washing, but she thinks that if she expands the shop it will give her more income and she won't have to go out to do other jobs.

She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes, onions, güisquiles [type of squash], carrots and others to sell in her shop.

Her dream is for her customers to find what they need in her shop and for her children to learn about the business so that when they are older they will have an idea about business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes, onions, güisquiles [type of squash], carrots and others to sell in her shop.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral y  es coordinado por la señora Martha de 37 años de edad, acompañada y madre dos hijos en las edades de 10, 5 años es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, el crédito lo solicita para surtir la pulpería y comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, caramelos, galletas, pan, pastillas varias, sopa maggy, etc. otra de las socias es la señora Martha de 33 años  dedicándose a vender leche en su domicilio, y la señora María se dedica a vender ropa nueva en el domicilio y ambulante a clientes ya establecidos.
texts.en: This solidarity group is composed of three members and is coordinated by Martha, who is 37 years old and lives with her common-law husband and her two children, aged 10 and 5. Martha owns a grocery store in her home and she is asking for a loan to stock her store and buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, candy, cookies, bread, instant soup, etc. The other group members are Martha, 33, who sells milk in her home and Maria, who sells clothing door to door and as a street vendor to already established customers.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, sugar, candy, cookies, bread, instant soup, etc.

loans.name: Gnongonlame Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Gnongonlamè est majoritairement composé des femmes monogames mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités, de friperies et de Yam. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kiatou (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes wax en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à de Kanadjiguila et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Kiatou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Gnongonlamè Group is mostly made up of monogamous, married women who live with their husbands and children in traditional families.  They are, on average, 33 years old and have four children.  The women all live in Kanadjiguila, in the commune of Mandé/district of Kati.  They know one another through family, neighbourhood and friendship.

The members of the group are all retailers of high-quality wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), second-hand clothing and yams.  In order to increase their business earnings, the women have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first group loan.

Kiatou (sitting on the far right of the photo) has built up a strong reputation for the quality of the wax pagnes that she sells.  She will use her loan to buy 20 wax pagnes from wholesalers at the main market.  She will then resell them in Kanadjiguila, on foot, mainly to women.  Kiatou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and provide for some of the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Kankeletigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kankeletigui est composé de huit femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames.  Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits cosmétiques (pommades, mèches, crèmes à lèvre, parfums,…), des poissons, de moutons, d’habits et de condiments. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djénèbou (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits de beauté de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40 cartons  de mèches en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail à Kanadjiguila  à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Djénèbou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Kankeletigui Group is made up of eight married women who mostly live in monogamous households.  They are, on average, 40 years old and have six children.  The women live in Kanadjiguila in the commune of Mandé/district of Kati.  They know one another through neighbourhood ties.

All the members of the group are retailers of cosmetic products (creams, hair extensions, lipsticks, perfumes, etc), fish, sheep, clothing and food ingredients.  They all want to improve their stock-keeping levels so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their third group loan.

Djénèbou (sitting on the far right of the photo) has built up a strong reputation for the quality of beauty products which she sells.  She will use her loan to buy 40 boxes of hair extensions from wholesalers in the main market.  She will then resell them in Kanadjiguila to women customers.  Djénèbou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA, which she will reinvest in her business.

In the future, she hopes to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso and be able to buy a plot of housing land.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions for resale.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanan is the 42-year-old married mother of five children. After working for six years as a sales agent, she decided to start her own home-based business. In the beginning, she faced a major challenge in gaining visibility among potential customers. However, with determination and long experience in the field, Hanan was able to overcome this difficulty. Currently, she sells Brazilian gold accessories from home and has a wide client base. 

With the money she makes, Hanan is able to help her husband, who is employed as a driver in a factory, to cover their household expenses. They are both devoted to improving their family’s living situation and providing their five children with good education. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy new accessories, thus increasing her sales, enhancing her revenues and eventually expanding her business.

In the future, Hanan seeks to enlarge her client outreach by establishing a small store.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying new accessories.

loans.name: Filipenses 4.13 Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socios trabajadores  y coordinado por la señora Rafaela, soltera y de 50 años de edad se dedica a la compra-venta de zapatos iniciando este negocio hace 20 años, siendo el hijo la principal ayuda para vender, el crédito lo invertirá en el negocio, comprando sandalias, zapatos para damas, zapatos de niñas, y zapatos para caballeros, con el fin de cubrir la demanda que tiene por parte de su clientela. Otra de la socia es la señora Heydi de 24 años de edad quien se dedica a vender frescos y helados en su domicilio; y el señor Martín de 56 años de edad quien comercializa ropa en Masaya y Diriamba de manera ambulante y alrededores de su comunidad.
texts.en:
This communal bank has 3 members. The coordinator is Rafaela who is 50 years old and single. She buys and sells footwear. She started this business 20 years ago. Her son helps her with her sales. The loan will be invested in her business buying sandals and shoes for women, children and men. She wants to be able cover the demand from her clients.

The other members of the group are Heydi, who is 24 years old and sells fruit drinks and ice cream at her house and Martín who is 56 years old and sells clothing in streets of Masaya and Diriamba and around his community.

loans.use: to buy footwear.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine is 30 years old and lives in Stepanavan city in Lori region. She has a higher pedagogical education. She is a Biologist-Chemist. Now she works at the school as a teacher and she also has nearly 20 pupils, to whom she gives private courses of biology and chemistry. These are mainly the pupils who want to pass an entrance examination for Medical Colleges or Medical State University. Narine likes her pupils very much and every lesson she makes different from the previous one, so that pupils learn quickly and with interest. Narine is not married and she lives with her parents. She asks for this loan since she needs to buy a computer, and also some professional literature, which she needs for the courses for entrance examinations.

loans.use: to buy a computer, and also some professional literature, which she needs for the courses for entrance examinations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cold water, soft drinks, rice, milk, candles, biscuits, soaps, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Dania Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dania Del Carmen es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Dania, tengo 20 años de edad. Soy oriunda de Moca, provincia Espaillat, pero he tenido que emigrar a Santo Domingo para poder realizar mis estudios Universitarios ya que mis padres no poseen los recursos suficientes para costeármelo. Mi padre se desenvuelve en la actualidad como chofer de carro público y mi madre trabaja como operaria en una tabacalera, ambos residen en moca su ciudad natal, tengo tres hermanos y yo soy la mayor.
Actualmente deseo estudiar la carrera de Medicina en la Universidad Pedro Henríquez Ureña (UNPHU), ya que desde pequeña he anhelado llegar hacer una gran doctora, he realizado cursos y pasantías relacionados al área de salud, con la realización de estos cursos he tenido grandes satisfacciones y me he dado cuenta de sin dudas mi vocación es ser médico.
Me dirijo a ustedes con la finalidad de hacer tal solicitud, en vista de que carezco de recursos económicos para realizar tal carrera y mis padres no perciben los ingresos suficientes para ayudarme. Con el otorgamiento de este préstamo podré realizar mis sueños y alcanzar mis metas, así como también desarrollar mis habilidades, destrezas y explotar mis conocimientos hasta llegar hacer una de las mejores en mi área. De esta forma podré ayudar a mis padres, a mis hermanos para que puedan salir hacia adelante y aportar ayudar con mis conocimientos y servicio a la comunidad. Luego de haber concluido mi carrera seguiré tomando experiencia, especializarme en determinada área de la salud, laborar y prestar mis servicios a los necesitados del país.
texts.en:
Dania del Carmen is a young medical student. She is requesting a loan to cover her educational expenses and this is her story: "My name is Dania. I'm 20 years old. I'm originally from Moca, Espaillat Province, but I have had to emigrate to Santo Domingo to undergo my university studies and my parents did not have enough resources to afford that. My father works as a taxi driver and my mother works in a tobacco factory and both reside in our hometown. I have three siblings and I am the oldest. 
Currently, I want to major in medicine at the University Pedro Henríquez Ureña ( UNPHU ) because, since childhood, I have longed to reach my goal to be a great doctor. I have taken courses and internships related to the area of health. With the completion of these courses, I have had great satisfaction and I have undoubtedly realized my calling as a doctor.
I am writing to you in order to make such a request, given that I have no financial resources to make such a career and my parents do not receive enough income to help. The granting of this loan will help me fulfill my dreams and achieve my goals, as well as develop my skills and abilities to use my knowledge until I am one of the best in my field. This way I can help my parents and my siblings so that they can move forward with my knowledge and service to the community. After concluding my studies, I will continue getting experience, specialize in a particular area of health, work, and provide my services to the needy in the country."

loans.use: to cover tuition costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour by bag, sugar, plantains, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Bello Atardecer Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral, coordinado por la señora carlota de 40 años de edad, casada, dependiendo de ella un hijo de 14 años se dedica a la fabricación de concreto como es pilas, cocinas, lavanderos, etc., cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y tambien tiene dos trabajadores asalariados, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de cemento, arena, alambre liso, alambre de amarrar, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar las ventas. Otra de las socias es la señora Thania de 34 años comerciante de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya, tambien vende nacatamales en su domicilio por lo que es otro ingreso, y la señora Maryina de 30 años se dedica a realizar costura en su domicilio
texts.en: The solidarity group consists of three members who are successful in their work and life. The group is coordinated by Carlota, 40, who is married with a 14-year-old son who still depends on her. For 14 years, she has been engaged in manufacturing in concrete, constructing kitchen and laundry basins and sinks. She has the support of her husband and also two employees. The loan will be used to purchase cement, sand, different types of wiring, etc. With her previous loans, she has managed to increase sales. Another partner in the group is the 34-year-old trader Thania, who sells fruit and vegetables in the market in Masaya. She also sells tamales at home for additional income. Maryina, 30, works sewing at home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and more to construct basins and sinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase organic manure.

loans.name: Kantitutas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTITAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Flora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: crianza de conejos, agricultura y ganado, venta y compra de ganado, venta de leche, venta de helados, crianza de gallinas, venta de queso.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Flora es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de helados; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprende hace varios años, con el apoyo de su esposo quien ya conocía la forma de venta.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de esencias y heladera) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "KANTUTITAS " are starting their third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Focal Centre. The association has 8 members and is run by a board of which Flora is the President. The businesses run by members of the community association are varied including: raising rabbits, agriculture and livestock, purchase and sale of cattle, selling milk, ice cream sales, raising chickens and selling cheese.
 
The loan which they will take out will benefit small microentrepreneurs where Flora is a member.She says that it is the first time that she has been a member of Pro Mujer , she joined after being invited by one of the institution's consultants who visited her at home. Today she has a business selling ice cream; she says that she started this business several years ago with the support of her husband, who already knew the trade.
 
The loan which she is now taking out is in order to increase her capital for the purchase of essences and a refrigerator - which she will buy in the shops of the city of El Alto - and then after making the ice-cream she will sell it in her retail space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has three children.

When I ask what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy essences and a fridge

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 51 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Teofila works very hard to provide for them.

Teofila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Teofila has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Teofila would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is thirty-one years old and has four children who are in school.
