She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Rodelyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 so she can purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Rodelyn has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Rodelyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en: Kristine and her nice family live in Vanadzor city in Lori region. She is 35 years old, married, and she has two children. Both her son and daughter are still school-aged, but her daughter is going to graduate her school this year. Kristine is a housewife, and the only breadwinner of their family is her husband, who has his small fruit and vegetable selling business. He works at the city wholesale market, and he brings products from Georgia to his stall once every two weeks.  The income from this business is just enough for their everyday needs and even then sometimes they are really short of money.  Kristine asks for this loan, since this year her daughter is graduating her school and asked Kristine to buy a pretty dress for her school graduation party. Kristine also wants to make a surprise for her children and buy a computer for them.

loans.use: to buy a pretty dress for her daughter for her school graduation party, an also to make a surprise for her children and buy a computer for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, soap, tissues, batteries, and toothpaste for her business.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Miguelina es una joven estudiante de Bioanálisis, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es miguelina vivo con mi madre en la ciudad de la vega, Republica Dominicana, tengo 21 año de edad, estudio bioanálisis  en la universidad UCATECI, mi madre trabaja como empleada doméstica y sus ingresos no le permiten cubrir mis gastos de la universidad, desde infante he soñado con esta carrera la cual me permitirá crecimiento personal, profesional y ayudar a los seres humanos. De no lograr el préstamo sería un estancamiento ya que tendría que buscar por otra vía de como continuar mis estudios.
Una de mis metas es lograr un alto índice académico y por ende un gran conocimiento el cual me permitirá después abrirme puertas en todo el mundo.
texts.en: Miguelina is a young student of Bioanalysis. She is requesting a loan to cover her educational expenses. This is her story: "My name is Miguelina. I live with my mother in the city of La Vega, in the Dominican Republic. I am 21 years old and am studying Bioanalysis at UCATECI University. My mother works as a domestic employee and her income does not cover the cost of my university. Since I was a child I have dreamed of this profession which would allow my personal and professional development and allow me to help other people. Not to get this loan would be an obstacle as I would have to look for other means to continue my studies. One of my goals is to achieve a high academic record and in the end the recognition that would allow me to open the door to the rest of the world".

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs.

loans.name: Adjorman Group

texts.en: Janet is the featured borrower of her group Adjorman. She is 51 years old, single and lives in the same neighborhood as her colleagues in the town of Accra-Teshie. She has been selling provisions, frozen food and cosmetics for the last ten years, and has requested a new loan to expand her business by buying more items to sell. The other two members of this group need loans for businesses such as selling fresh maize, fresh fish, towels, bed sheets and women's tops. Janet says that her main goal is to try to become the biggest dealer in the area because she wants to have a big business that will enable her to build a large house with help from ID-Ghana. They will need a total of GHS 3,800 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy and sell cosmetics, frozen food and provisions.

loans.name: Kobake Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Kobakè sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques ; Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de tubercules (igname, patates et pomme de terre), ustensiles et des habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Tatché (femme  assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de tubercules (igname, patates et  pomme de terre) dans le quartier. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 350 kg d’igname à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Tatché espère avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Kobakè are married for the most part in monogamous households; the women average 33 years of age and four children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, in Commune de Mandé / Cercle de Kati. And they know one another through ties of community and revenue-generating businesses at the Kanadjiguila market. The group members do commerce in tubers (yams, sweet potatoes, and potatoes), utensils, and clothing.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Tatché (the woman sitting at the far right in the photo) is a major vendor of tubers (yams, sweet potatoes, and potatoes) in the district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 350 kg of yams in Bamako. The sales are made at the retail level to a customer base composed mostly of women in Kanadjiguila.

With this loan, Ms. Tatché hopes to obtain an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in her business and to ensure her children’s care.

loans.use: to purchase tubers, such as yams or potatoes.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco moved to Miami, Florida in search of a better opportunity for himself and his family. Francisco founded Pilot’s Export Spain Corp., which imports various products, including wine, cheese, and olive oil, among other things, and proceeds to sell them to local distributors. 

His products range from very expensive bottles of wine and high-quality cheese to a new line of wine that will sell in gas stations. Francisco hopes to continue to expand his enterprise to eventually distribute his products throughout the state of Florida. In order to do so, he needs a loan to purchase additional inventory to sell.

Help Francisco fulfill his dream and provide for his family!

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Meet Eunice, a lady in Eldoret who has been practicing agriculture for the last four years. To make ends meet, she sells milk, eggs, fruits and vegetables from her farm. As a mother of three, she also holds a job to get extra income for her family. Of all her activities though, she is very passionate about horticulture. The only problem is that she does not have enough capital.

Eunice is seeking financial support through a loan to be fully dedicated to horticulture. She is very good at horticulture and she believes it is her way out. She learned about KIVA in a Juhudi Kilimo training and was impressed by the interest and repayment period terms. With your support, Eunice will be able to expand her operations and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to pay for  horticultural farm inputs .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Meet Evans. He is a husband, a father of eight, and a farmer not very far from Maasai Land with nine years’ experience. Evans gets by selling milk for the most part. Selling his farm products gives him a sense of self-gratification. He incurs high transport costs to get his produce to the market but he is hopeful things will get better.
 
Evans is seeking a dairy cow loan. He aspires to grow his herd of cattle and produce more milk. He is cut out for it. "I do not know any other life outside dairy. I am destined to be THE dairy farmer!" he claimed. With your loan, no matter how small, Evans will gain some yards to overcome his challenges and improve his family's livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
After moving to the United States in 1985, Sandra sought a career that would fit her compassionate nature. She earned her master’s degree in practical nursing in 1992 and thrived while working as a case manager for MetroHealth for twenty years. Using skills she learned along the way and with support from her friends and family, Sandra decided to start Sandy’s Group Daycare, a childcare service she now successfully runs from her home. 

Sandra currently takes care of ten children. However, she needs to create a safer, more child-friendly environment. She plans to use the loan to purchase new toys and equipment, as well as increase her marketing outreach to other local neighborhoods. 

Sandra is a single mother who acted on her dream. Help her to continue to build on her dream while enabling other parents to accomplish their own!

loans.use: to purchase toys and equipment.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a 41-year-old  married man with 3 children who are 18,14 and 8 years. He has 2 additional dependents living with him.  

In 2000, Musa established his used clothing business because he was trained as a business man. 

He works 7 days a week, 10 hours a day to earn 1,500,000 SLL each month. He wants 5,000,000 SLL to buy used clothing. In the future, Musa plans to expand his business. He works very hard and thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Christine. She is a mother of four who has been practicing agriculture in the Chuka area of Kenya for the last five years. She makes money selling milk, eggs and tea. She really enjoys tending to her farm and animals (which she names). Facing challenges such as low milk production, Christine attended Juhudi Kilimo training session and she learned about dairy farm management. She realized how key feeding a dairy cow with the right feeds can significantly increase milk production.

Christine resolved to acquire proper cow feeds and equipment to process cow feed. With your loan, Christine seeks to buy a chaff cutter and dairy feeds. She will increase her income through increased milk production. With more income, Christine aspires to expand her rural farming enterprise and improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: To acquire dairy feeds and a chaff cutter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional goods which she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish, plantains, and potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a huge quantity of locks, nails, hinges, etc. to attract more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blood syrup, malarial drugs, and pain tablets

loans.name: Tetio

texts.en:
Tetio lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people. A market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result, school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

Tetio is married and has one child. He is a teacher and his wife is a social worker. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for three years now and they are currently growing sunflowers, horticultural crops, maize and beans on their farm. Tetio is excited about beekeeping as it is an easy project to take up and it has a ready market.

This is Tetio's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Tetio's hope for the future is to be able to support his family and to use honey more as his bread spread.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil, biscuits, Maggi cubes, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Jeannie

texts.en:
Jeannie is a 31-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Jeannie has requested a loan to buy bush knives, a weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since March 2014. With her profits, Jeannie hopes to earn more money to support and help her family.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow, bush knives and chemicals

loans.name: Sari Makmur Group

texts.en:
The Sari Makmur group will be receiving their eighth loan through MUK, this one for 9,000,000 IDR, and will continue on raising pigs. This time they plan to grow pigs for pigroll (barbeque pig), which can be sold every two months.

Ni Ketut, this loan’s featured client, will be using her portion of the loan to buy four local piglets, as now the price for local piglets is more stable than that for superior piglets (good quality piglet). Her loan will also be used for more pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after two months and then buy more.

The Sari Makmur group can repay a loan even beyond its due date. This is because the price of pork is not stable. During the period of the loan, the pigs’ growth can be maximized from being fed good food and vitamins. During this time, however, many breeders also sell their pigs. Prices become unstable, affecting anticipated profits. Although the group may earn little in profits during a cycle, it keeps on with this venture and expects eventual progress for its members’ efforts.

Ni Ketut hopes her piglet plan runs smoothly, and she earns more in profits. She also hopes MUK and Kiva will continue to support the group until its members have enough money to support their businesses themselves.

loans.use: to purchase four local piglets and feed

loans.name: Vainqueur De Garde Saline 1 & 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mariejunie est la coordinatrice de son groupe Vainqueur de Garde Saline 1 & 2. Elle est mariée elle a 4 enfants. Elle habite dans la région nord`est Haïti ou l’électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limite. Mariejunie dirige son commerce de vente de produits cosmetiques pendants les 4 dernières années. Elle espère que ce emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce

Des autres membres de groupe ont besoin d'un emprunt pour les commerces tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses, chaussures, vetement, etc. Elle dit que son défi principal est de devenir une plus grande commerçante dans la zone. Son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerce qui lui facilitera à construire une plus grande maison avec prêt de Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Mariejunie is the coordinator of her group Vainqueur de Garde Saline 1 & 2. She is married and has four children. She lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Mariejunie has been running her business selling cosmetic products for the last four years. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her commerce. Other members of the group have need of a loan for businesses such as selling cosmetics, carbonated drinks, shoes, clothing, etc. 

She says that her main challenge is to become a greater merchant in the area. Her main goal is to have a bigger business facilitating the construction of a bigger house, with loans from Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 33 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она 10 лет назад начала свой бизнес. Махбуба продает фрукты, а также она выращивает саженцы помидоров, перец, разнообразных цветов и т.п. и продает на местном рынке. Она уже имеет большой опыт. Махбуба является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Махбуба имеет маленькую точку продажи на местном рынке. Теперь она хочет увеличить точку продажи. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки точки продажи на местном рынке. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahbuba is a hard-working woman. She is 33, married, and has two children. She started her business ten years ago selling fruit at the local market. She also grows and sells tomato plants, peppers, different kinds of flowers, and so forth. She has a lot of experience and earns the main income for her family, as her husband is working in Russia. Mahbuba has a small stall at the market and wants to buy a bigger one. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 somoni and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a stall in the local market

loans.name: Messan

texts.fr: Âgé de 36ans, mr Messan est marié et père de 05 enfants. Il est revendeur de pneus et des gentes de voitures au marché. Son premier crédit lui permettra d'acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Il souhaite passer plus de commande à l'avenir et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Mr. Messan, 36 years old, is a married father of five. He is a retailer of inner tubes and auto wheel rims at the market. His first loan will enable him to purchase some merchandise in order to respond to customer needs. He wishes put through more orders in the future and to meet the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase inner tubes and automobile rims

loans.name: 02 Thành Lập-Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Hà has been involved in this business for one year.

Hà is 28 years old, and she is married with two children. Hà is the group leader of the 02 Thành Lập-Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Hau Loc district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hà has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her are illnesses.

With her business profit, Hà hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Adamah

texts.fr: Âgée de 34ans, Adamah loue depuis 2007 des équipements pour funérailles(chaises, bâches...) à domicile. Il s'approvisionne chez les grossistes et est à son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des équipements pour funérailles afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. l’avenir, il espère créer d'autres projets et mieux prendre soin de sa famille. Marié à une couturière et père d'un enfant de 05ans scolarisé.
texts.en: Adamah, aged 34, has been renting out supplies and equipment for funerals (chairs, tarps, …) out of his home since 2007. He gets his supplies from wholesalers and is on his second WAGES loan for purchasing these supplies, so as to respond better to customer needs. For the future, he hopes to start other projects and to take better care of his family. Adamah is married to a seamstress and is the father of a 5-year-old child, who is in school.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and equipment for funerals (chairs, tarps, ...)

loans.name: Airath

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 32ans, Airath est esthéticienne de profession. En plus de son activité, elle revend des produits de beauté et approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé. Son troisième crédit lui servira d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire ses clients. Elle espère investir dans l'activité et assurer son auto- suffisance alimentaire.
texts.en: A young woman, 32 years old, Airath is a beautician by trade. In addition to this work, she resells beauty products and gets her supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé. Her third loan will be used to purchase more merchandise in order to satisfy her customers. She hopes to invest in her business and to ensure she is self-sufficiency in food.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Yahli Mokpokpo Kpeme Group

texts.fr: Madame Akouavi née en 1967 est nommée pour être la responsable du groupement YAHLI MOKPOKPO KPEME. Elle a 03 enfants dont 01 seul scolarisé.Akouavi exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des charbons et des fagots de bois à ANEHO (localité située à environ 47km de la ville de Lomé). Elle s'approvisionne à Lomé et exerce l'activité depuis 1999. Akouavi espère réinvestir dans l'activité en ouvrant d'autres points de vente et assurer l'éducation de son enfant. Les autres membres exercent comme activité la vente d'huile, de farine de blé et autres produits.... Ils souhaitent tous subvenir aux besoins de la famille et rendre pérenne leurs activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Akouavi, born in 1967, is known as the official of the group YAHLI MOKPOKPO KPEME. She has three children, of whom only one is in school. Akouavi has a revenue-generating business selling charcoal  and bundles of wood in ANEHO (a town located about 47 km from the city of Lomé). She gets her supplies in Lomé and has been in this business since 1999. Akouavi hopes to reinvest in her business by opening other sales outlets and to ensure her child’s education. 

The other members have businesses selling oil, wheat flour, and other products…. They all wish to meet family needs and to make their businesses sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and bundles of wood

loans.name: Như

texts.en:
Như, 60 years old, has worked in agriculture for 9 years, farming poultry and cattle. He is married and has 4 children. Như lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Như's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. He is requesting a loan to purchase a biogas system to install for cooking. The main hardship that Như faces in life is low profit margins. Như hopes to use his business profit to travel for a vacation within the country, for his business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a biogas system for cooking.

loans.name: Tuyết

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Tuyết is 54 years old and she is married with 3 children.
Tuyết supports no dependents with her business in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tuyết first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Tuyết has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her life is not having hygeinic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet and bath-room.

In the future, Tuyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet and bath-room.

loans.name: Luminada

texts.en:
Luminada is 55 years old and married with three children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Luminada is borrowing PHP 14,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from her store.
 
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en:
Zoila, age 71, is happy tending her little store. She is married with two kids, and her husband is a butcher. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, so she makes promising daily sales. Zoila keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores.  She believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain her business and beat the competition.  

Zoila has reached her 4th year being a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 PHP for the store to purchase basic commodities like rice, canned goods, and laundry soap to sell. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain her label of a member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and as a result, be able to afford a good education even for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities like rice, canned goods, and laundry soap to sell.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 38 years old, married, and lives at Molatohan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter, and the wage that he gets from carpentry work is not sufficient for their needs. From her desire to earn an income on her own, she takes in and raises pigs in their backyard. She's been doing this for five years already. In 2012, Nida became an active member of Paglaum MPC and enjoys the benefit given by the Coop. Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan to buy kilos of feeds for her hog raising. She really hopes & prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy kilos of feeds for her hog raising

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 57 years old, single, and a resident of Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor. She earns a living through raising pigs 

She has been a member of PMPC for almost one year and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now she is applying for a loan of Php 5,000 to purchase additional feeds and piglets.

Violeta deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds and piglets.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a 52-year-old, married woman with 2 school-age children. She lives in SWP, Calamba, Mis. Occ.

To earn a living, she is engaged in the flower planting business. She has been doing this type of work for two years. She has a monthly income of approximately 3,000 PHP from this work.

She explains that she joined Paglaum in 2012. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP through Paglaum to purchase commercial fertilizers so that she can better maintain her flowers. The income she earns from her flower business helps her to pay for her family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase commercial fertilizers

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya, age 53, is happy tending her little store. She is single. The store is her means of earning a living.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, so she makes promising daily sales. Ligaya keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Ligaya believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Ligaya has reached her 2nd year being a member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan to purchase additional canned goods, beverages, and soft drinks.. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of "member in good standing". She is a hardworking woman and wishes to sustain the store.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, beverages, and soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Emilita

texts.en:
Emilita is from Poblacion in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao in the Philippines. She is 48 years old and married. Emilita is engaged in a small business of buying and selling dry goods. 

Emilita became an active member with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member.

Emilita is asking for financial assistance of 7,000 PHP to buy additional varieties of dry goods to sell. She hopes to increase her income and to be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through PMPC, and she is very thankful with all her heart. Emilita deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is 43 years old, married, and lives with her family. She has a farm and she manages it while her husband works as security guard. Estrellita has eight years experience in this business. Estrellita works every day in order to provide income for her family and to show her responsibility and love to her family. 

Estrellita requested this loan to buy organic fertilizer to have a greener farm. She is aiming to develop her farm and increase her profits to continue assisting her family with the additional income. The couple wants to give their five children a better education.

The story of Estrellita and her business is just one of the many examples of GDMPC for economic development clients.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
This is Mercedes, 58, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines.  She is married to Roberto, her business partner and she is the mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercedes operates a welding shop.  Her husband handles the labor work like welding and maintenance repair of vehicles.  She handles finances, inventories and the promotion of their business.  They offer welding jobs, repair and check-up of some types of vehicles.  Aside from this she also sells herbal products for additional income.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in service fees every day. 

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy materials and supplies needed in her welding shop business.

Mercedes dreams to expand her business and hopes to send her child to a private school.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials and supplies needed in her welding shop business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 39 years of age and lives in Josefina Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married with three children. The husband of Lucy is a Barangay Kagawad of Gumahan Josefina Z.D.S.

Lucy has a Bakery and she earns approximately 20,000 PHP net income each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase sugar, soda, flour, peanut butter, and other items for the bakery.

Lucy has been a member of Paglaum MPC for one year and two months. In the future, she hopes to increase the income of her poultry and hopes to improve the living condition of the family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soda, flour, peanut butter, and other items for the bakery

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is widowed with four children. Rebecca is 64 years of age and lives in Poblacion Mahayag Z. D.S

To earn a living, Rebecca works hard for her children because she is a single mother. Rebecca has a bakery and had this business for 15 years with four workers. Each month, she earns approximately 18,000 PHP net income. Rebecca has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost six years.

In the future, Rebecca hopes to build her own building and double her income to improve her bakery.

loans.use: To buy new items/products for her bakery.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is 53 years old and has four children. Luna is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Luna is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Luna requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Luna has been raising livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Luna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Misha

texts.en: Misha is 52 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. He works at a private company as a driver, and makes cargo transfers from Vanadzor to Yerevan and back. His wife works at the bakery as a confectioner.  Misha has a son who is 27 years old, and after many years of working in the Russian Federation, finally he is back. His parents are very happy to see their son and they do not want him to go back for work abroad. Lately Misha’s son met girl in his city and he has fallen in love with her. Misha asks a loan of 500,000 AMD in order to get prepared for his son’s engagement party, and he also wants to buy some furniture for his son’s newly created family.

loans.use: to get prepared for his son’s engagement party and also to buy some furniture for his son’s newly created family.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is 22 years old. This young man, with his parents and school-aged brother, lives in Stepanavan city in the Lori region. Mher is an unbelievably diligent, inquisitive and intelligent person. Now he is studying at the paid division of Stepanavan State Agricultural College the faculty of Veterinary. Mher also works at a private company as a beekeeper. Since he is engaged in distance learning, it gives him an opportunity to have a lot of free time and realize his dream. He learns all the details and skills of beekeeping and he decided to get engaged in it. Mher’s parents run a farm in the nearby village of Hovnanadzor. Mher greatly helps his parents with the care of farm cattle and very often his knowledge of veterinary turns out to be very useful for their farm animals. His parents like very much their son’s idea of beekeeping and they are ready to help him with his plans and decisions.
 
So, Mher asks for this loan since he wants to buy bee hives for which he already separated a space on their farm. He is impatient to start his beekeeping activities.

loans.use: to buy bee hives.

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr is a farmer and he lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. He runs his farming activities in the nearby village of Norashenik. On his farm, he has a cow, a calf and 60 rabbits. He is engaged in rabbit breeding rather seriously and the care of it Norayr does with pleasure, despite that it demands much time, a lot of effort and great costs as well. Norayr sells his rabbits to farmers and he also sells their meat. Norayar also does private construction work in his city in order to have more income for his family.

Norayr is married and he has two school-aged sons. His wife is unemployed and she takes care of their children and house. 

Norayr asks for a loan of 200,000 AMD in order to buy a lot of fodder for his rabbits, since he has many rabbits and very often there is a lack of fodder for them.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his rabbits.

loans.name: Gere Ann

texts.en:
Gere Ann is 23 years old and has two children.  

Gere Ann and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Gere Ann has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Gere Ann can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. 

In future she would like to save enough money to build a business and to provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza is a farmer from Arevanuyr village which is located in the Ararat region. She cultivates potatoes and greens and sells the gathered harvest. The income from this agribusiness is very important for her family to sustain its living. Tereza lives with her husband and two sons who help their mother with gathering and selling the harvest.

The greenhouse where Tereza makes her cultivation is very old and needs to be repaired. The requested loan of USD 2,000 will greatly assist Tereza to purchase polyethylene cover for the greenhouse as well as potato and green seeds for cultivation.
 
Tereza hopes that lenders will support her to accomplish her goals and have a profitable farm.

loans.use: to pay for polyethylene cover for the greenhouse as well as potato and green seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony lives with his wife in Murang’a, Kenya, where they have been farming for the last 11 years. Murang’a region is a heavy pineapple-producing region.  To earn a decent living, Anthony sells pineapples from his farm, besides engaging in other small personal businesses. 

Anthony is quite satisfied with the returns farming generates. The only challenges are getting enough capital to diversify, and the marketing of produce.  

To access training, technical assistance and financial solutions, Anthony mobilized farmers to form a group and join Juhudi Kilimo. When asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo, he answered, ‘It assists small holder farmers.'  Through the training sessions, he learnt effective ways to use loans and how to shift from subsistence dairy farming to commercial dairy farming.

Anthony has two traditional cows, namely Wambui and Machaka, that do not produce much milk. Anthony is seeking a loan to purchase a grade dairy cow. This type of cow produces 15 to 20 litres of milk a day. The cows he has now produce 3 to 5 litres each. A grade cow will provide Anthony with enough income to repay the loan comfortably and save extra money. In the long run, Anthony will be able to improve his family’s livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a grade dairy cow

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is from Yerevan town. She studies at University and specializes in economics. Anna lives with her parents, grandmother, and 16-year-old sister.  Her father is a math teacher and her mother works at one of the local small companies. The requested loan will help Anna to cover her university tuition. The loan is very important for Anna to be able to cover educational costs and to continue her studies.  Please help Anna with her loan.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Meet Salome, a mother of 10 children, who has been farming for the last 40 years. She comes from Eldoret, home to many famous Kenyan marathon runners. She makes money selling milk, eggs and vegetables from her farm. Her real passion lies in horticulture despite the challenges she faces with the high inputs involved. Like typical smallholder farmers, Salome cannot access formal financial solutions from the bank. She has teamed up with a couple of local women to form and register a group that might be recognized by some microfinance institutions. With an untamed ambition and a clear path to success, Salome is seeking a loan to buy an irrigation kit to water her vegetables. The adoption of this kit will ensure a constant provision of water for her plants, even during the dry season. Crop yields are also expected to rise significantly, leading to more income for Salome to cater to her home expenses. With your support, Salome is going to grow into a formidable entrepreneur and raise the living standards of her children.

loans.use: to purchase an irrigation kit.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, a mother of two, is a farmer based in Kitale, Kenya. She has been involved in farming for the past 7 years. She makes ends meet by selling milk, eggs and maize. She enjoys feeding her cow and chicken. 

However, Jane faces a serious challenge. There is a great insecurity of animals in the area she comes from. Many farmers in the area have incurred losses in the past from cattle rustlers. Jane is resilient. She aims to grow bigger by attending several trainings to expand her knowledge on poultry farming. With your funding, Jane is going to expand her poultry section by purchasing more birds. The additional income will provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Meet Henry, a husband and a father of three children. He is also a farmer with seven years of experience in the field who lives in Eldoret, home to Kenya's finest marathon athletes. He makes a decent living selling milk, eggs, and maize that are produced from his farm. He also owns a motorcycle that he uses to get around the village, offering transportation services to the rest of the farmers. 

In agriculture, his heart is always in horticultural farming. For years, he has dreamed of owning a horticultural farm like his dad once owned. However, the biggest challenge would be fluctuating market prices.  

Besides horticulture, Henry is also passionate about dairy farming. He named his two cows Lekmet and Tuimet. When Henry learned about Kiva through Juhudi Kilimo, he said, "They do meet my needs. It is the company who elevates living standards of smallholder farmers."

Most of Henry's monthly income is spent on transportation costs. He loves riding on motorcycles and dreams of owning a Suzuki CRB 750 in this lifetime. But today, Henry is seeking a loan to start horticulture. He strongly believes it is the way he can pull himself out of poverty. He has attended numerous training sessions: He is confident he has the skills, knowledge and passion to succeed. 

With the loan, Henry's family will benefit from the prestige of having a better living standard, resulting in his three children looking up to him and seeing him as the provider of financial security they will enjoy in future.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for horticulture

loans.name: Concepter

texts.en:
Meet Concepter, 30, a dairy farmer in the Kisii area of Kenya. The mother of five has been practicing dairy farming for the last ten years. Besides milk, she also sells various crop varieties. Concepter spends her free time picking tea and tending to Maridadi (her dairy cow). She constantly worries about the ever-changing climate pattern. 

Concepter is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. With one cow, most of her meagre income is spent on school fees and expenses. To improve the living standard of her family, Concepter is seeking a loan to purchase an additional cow. She has a clear projected growth path to success that started with the first loan and continues with the loan she is now seeking. 

With your help, Concepter is going to go levels those before her never even thought of.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua, a father of three, lives in Eldoret, Kenya. For the past 15 years, Joshua has been selling milk, eggs, fruits and vegetables from his farm. To make an extra dollar, he engages in other small personal businesses. 
He enjoys dairy farming more than other activities. However, he cannot transport his produce to other markets for favorable prices. He has always resorted to selling produce in the local market, making losses or low profits margins in the process. To buy a motorbike that will be used to ferry produce to the market, Joshua is seeking a loan. The motorcycle will help Joshua transport his produce, and other farmers' produce, to farther markets with better prices. This asset will increase Joshua's, as well as other farmers', incomes significantly.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to transport produce.

loans.name: Sadik

texts.en:
Sadik is a 22-year-old married man with one child who is 6 months old. He lives in a simple family in Taiz, Yemen. Sadik studied until elementary school, but he couldn't complete his studies because he got married when he was very young. Sadik started his business 6 years ago. He started in a small shop in his area selling the necessary goods such as milk, drinks, cakes, flour, salt, and many kinds of food. Little by little, his business expanded more and more. Recently, he earns good profits from this business. Sadik thinks that his business goes very well because he is very kind and he loves what he does. He could expand his small shop to a grocery if he has a refrigerator. Unfortunately, this grocery lacks a refrigerator. For this reason, Sadik is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator for the grocery.

Sadik looks forward to becoming a wholesale dealer. He hopes to provide his family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for the grocery.

loans.name: Rugiatu                     K

texts.en:
Meet Rugiatu, she is a 45-year-old from Waterloo, the western rural area in Freetown. She is married with six children. In 2006, Rugiatu established her clothing material business. She was trained in this business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more clothing material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Rugiatu plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
Meet Kadie: she is in her late twenties and comes from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with one child. In the past ten years, Kadie has established a retail business. She began her business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income for her family. She works at the business from 8am until 5:30 pm, seven days a week. She says that the main challenges to her business are poor transportation with her operation area and having a proper business location.

Kadie requires a loan in order to purchase food containers, plates and cups to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and grow her business. In the future, Kadie plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase food containers, plates and cups to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vegetables, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is applying for a loan of GHS 3,000 to improve her drinking bar business (cartoned drinks, canned drinks and bottled drinks). 

She is married and runs the business in her house selling all types of drinks. She is making good income from this business and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. Matilda lives in a town nearby the main road so many people come to buy from her and she is busy selling every day. She opened her business 12 years ago with a small amount of working capital.

loans.use: to buy and sell cartoned drinks, canned drinks and bottled drinks to her customers.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en: Marta is  taking a loan of $ 800.00 to improve her business.She is married and  She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as noodles,fanta,coca cola,sprite,sagiko,cigarettes,coffee,sugar,salt,slippers,water and books.She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 600.00.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles,fanta,cocacola,sprite,sagiko,cigarettes,coffee,sugar,salt,slippers,water and books

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in Kakamega, Kakamega County  located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

George is married and has six children. He runs a motorbike transport business and he is also a footballer. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for four years now and they are currently growing vegetables, bananas and sugarcane as well as rearing poultry in their farm. George is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is George’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy more beehives. George’s hope for the future is to see his children finish school.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Moussa Moise

texts.fr:
Né à BAMAKO, MOUSSA MOISE vit avec  son époux  dans une  famille nucléaire à N’TENTOU,   dans la commune rurale de  OUELESSEBOUGOU, Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI). 
MOUSSA MOISE n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente de boissons : Fanta, Coca Cola, Jus d’ananas, Tonic , Sprite, et jus de pomme, etc.    
Moussa  MOISE est à son premier  prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  10 casiers de Fanta, 10 casiers de coca cola, 5 casiers de jus d’ananas et 3 casiers de jus de pomme. Il  s’approvisionne auprès des  grossistes à BAMAKO  et effectue ses ventes au petit revendeur, au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à OUELESSEBOUGOU et environnant, à une clientèle mixte. 
MOUSSA MOISE espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente de boissons.
texts.en:
Born in BAMAKO, MOUSSA MOISE lives with his wife in a nuclear family in N’TENTOU, in Commune Rurale de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro), Republic of MALI. Not having had the chance to progress in school, MOUSSA MOISE soon became interested in revenue-generating work, especially the buying and selling of beverages: Fanta, Coca Cola, pineapple juice, Tonic, Sprite, apple juice, etc. 

MOUSSA MOISE is on his first individual loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso that will be used to purchase 10 cases of Fanta, 10 cases of Coca Cola, 5 cases of pineapple juice, and 3 cases of apple juice. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in BAMAKO. And he makes his sales at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit, in and around OUELESSEBOUGOU.

MOUSSA MOISE hopes to make a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay back the loan and to reinvest the rest in the commerce of beverages.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Mirogi, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts, and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Mary is married and has five children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for seven years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, millet, and vegetables on their farm. Mary is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn her some income and provide her with honey for food and medicine.

This is Mary’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to start a small business. Mary’s hope for the future is to invest in her business and if it will be successful, start another business.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis Ángel tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hija en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de repuestos para motos y mototaxis, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de repuestos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luis Ángel is 23 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in the Cayaltí district, a community whose people work in farming, commerce, and livestock production. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which is part of the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast.

Luis Ángel works selling spare parts for motorcycles and mototaxis. His business is located in his residence. He has requested loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] in order to purchase a greater quantity of spare parts to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of spare parts for motorcycles and mototaxis to offer to his customers.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William lives in Kipasi, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts, and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

William is married and has nine children. He is a teacher, while his wife is a cook in a school. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 20 years now, and they are currently growing maize and vegetables, and rearing livestock as well. William is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income, provide him with honey for medicine, and help in pollinating his crops.

This is William’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay for his children’s school fees and provide for his family’s needs. William’s hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the roof of her house and erect a kitchen wall.

loans.name: Joe

texts.en:
Joe lives in Ojawa, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small, but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Joe is married and has six children. He is a teacher. His wife runs a domestic grain-grinding mill and she is a farmer as well. She has been farming for fifteen years now and she is currently growing maize and sorghum as well as rearing poultry and livestock in their farm. Joe is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income and provide him with honey for food and medicine.

This is Joe’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children, and to improve his standards of living. Joe’s hope for the future is to gain more knowledge in beekeeping.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou, une dame de la soixantaine, mariée et mère de famille, s’active dans le commerce de produits divers alimentaires. Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine. Elle vient solliciter un crédit auprès de l’IMCEC afin de pouvoir préparer les fêtes de Pâques  qui s’annoncent. Elle va pouvoir acheter du pain de singe, de la pâte d’arachide, de l’oseille et revendre.
A l’approche des fêtes Pascales la communauté chrétienne achète de la pâte d’arachide et du pain de singe pour préparer une bouillie qui annonce la fin du jeûne.
Fatou possède une clientèle fidèle qui fait la commande très tôt, pour lui permettre de livrer à temps.
Fatou a comme projet de vendre aussi des céréales et d’ouvrir un magasin de stockage.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou, a woman in her 60’s, is a married mother who is active in the commerce of various grocery items. She has acquired over ten years of experience in this domain. She is here to request a loan from IMCEC in order to be able to prepare for Easter, which is coming. She is going to be able to purchase monkey bread [the fruit of the baobab tree], peanut butter, and dried hibiscus flowers to resell. 

As the Easter holidays approach, the Christian community purchases peanut butter and ‘monkey bread’ to make a porridge marking the end of fasting. 

Fatou has loyal customers who are ordering right away enabling her to deliver on time. She also has plans to sell grains and to open a warehouse.

loans.use: to purchase various food supplies: dried hibiscus flowers, monkey bread, and peanut butter to resell

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector es estudiante, trabaja como técnico de campo, con buenos ingresos mensuales, vive con sus padres,  es un muchacho muy trabajador, responsable se dedica mucho a su estudio  desea salir adelante con sus esfuerzos para llegar a su meta. 
Su sueño es de tener un título Universitario y así ayudar a las personas a través de sus estudios. La carrera que escogió es la de Administración Agroindustrial.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en su gasto de titulación, ya que asi podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de cumplir con su meta.
texts.en:
Hector is a student who also works as a field technician and earns a good monthly income. He lives with his parents and is a very hard worker. Hector is very responsible in his studies because he wants to press forward in his efforts so that he can achieve his goal.

His dream is to obtain a university degree and help other people through his studies. The major that he chose is Agro-Industrial Management. Hector is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the expenses for his degree since he is already able to cover his other existing expenses. He appreciates this opportunity that he has received so that he can accomplish his goal.

loans.use: to pay for his degree expenses.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ousmane, âgé de 66 ans, est un éleveur bien connu dans sa localité. Il embouche des moutons, qu’il revend au bout de 7 à 8 mois. Ousmane en est à son 4ème crédit chez nous, il a programmé d’acheter au moins une vingtaine de moutons pour les emboucher et les mettre sur le marché et de l’aliment bétail pour complément de leur nourriture.
Ousmane est marié et père de famille. Il paie l’eau et l’électricité chez lui et se charge de la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
Ousmane a comme ambition, d’emboucher des bœufs et aussi des chèvres et avoir un grand troupeau.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousmane, aged 66, is a well-known livestock farmer in his town. He fattens sheep and resells them after 7 to 8 months. Ousmane is on his fourth loan with the [microfinance institution]. He has plans to purchase at least twenty sheep to be fattened and sold and some feed to round out their nourishment. 

Ousmane is a married father. He pays for the water and electricity at his home and is responsible for covering the family’s day-to-day expenses. His ambition is to fatten cattle and also goats and to have a large herd.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to fatten and resell

loans.name: Pacto De Gracia Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral, coordinado por la socia Xiomara de 50 años de edad, viuda y responsable de sus dos hijos menores, comercializa cosméticos AVON, por lo que el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pinturas labial, pinturas de unas, perfumes para damas, perfumes para caballeros, vanidad, delineador, etc., de esta manera aumentara la mercadería ofrecida y por ende los ingresos. Otra socia es la señora Irene de 27 años comerciante de ropa nueva en su comunidad, y la señora Idalia de 24 años de edad comercializa bisutería y zapatos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank is made up of three members who are successful in their work lives. It is coordinated by Xiomara, who is a 50-year-old widow responsible for her two dependent children. She sells Avon cosmetics, so she is requesting a loan for the purchase of lipsticks, nail polishes, women's perfumes, men's colognes, compacts, eyeliner, etc., in order to increase her inventory and thus her income. 

The other members are Señora Irene, who is 27 years old and sells new clothing in her community, and Señora Idalia, who is 24 years old and sells costume jewelry and shoes in her community.

loans.use: to purchase lipsticks, nail polishes, women's perfumes, men's colognes, compacts, eyeliner, etc.

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
Noé tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el Caserío Playa Azul, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de frutales, arroz, y café, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su vehículo, trasladando a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de útiles escolares para su hija y de esta manera brindarle las facilidades para su educación.
texts.en:
Noé is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and child in the Playa Azul community, a rural area of the Pucará district. It's a community with a hot climate and a population that works in agriculture (especially the cultivation of fruit trees, rice, and coffee), commerce, and livestock production. It is located in the Jaén province, which is part of the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern mountains.

Noé earns his living providing public transportation services in his vehicle, transporting his passengers to neighboring areas of his district. He has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles [PEN] for the purchase of school supplies for his daughter in order to equip her for her education.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for his daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cartons of tinned tomato paste, maggi, crates of eggs, cartons of salts, bags of onions and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is from Gndevaz village, which is located in Vayots Dzor Province. She lives there with her husband and 27-year-old son.

For the past 25 years Larisa and her husband have been operating their farm, so they are very experienced. Her son works at a local company, but his income doesn’t come near covering the household's daily costs. The farm, therefore, is very important to the family.

Larisa is applying for a 2400 USD loan through SEF International to help her buy a cow and renovate the barn where she keeps her livestock. Please help Larisa to develop her farm further.

loans.use: to buy a cow and renovate their barn

location.town: Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, onion, pepper, salt, coal, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase for her business, more rice, palm oil, pepper, fish, meat, etc.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en: Tasleem is 31 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She is quite a motivated and committed woman. She has been running a business selling animals with the help of her husband for many years. Presently she has two cows. She looks after the cattle and then her husband sells them out in different markets for a reasonable profit. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000.  With this loan amount she will be able to purchase more animals. She is expecting to boost her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Kathreen

texts.en:
Kathreen, 56, is married and has operated a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family.

To stock her store fully, Kareen is applying for a 40,000 PKR through Kashf to buy rice, sugar, cookies and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet her customers’ increasing demands consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, cookies and flour.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts, and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Paul is married and has four children. He is a carpenter while his wife sells shoes in the local market. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing maize and butternut on their farm. Paul is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income to supplement other projects. 

This is Paul's first loan with Honey Care Africa and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to start a poultry farm. Paul's hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Sadiqa

texts.en:
Sadiqa is a 44-year-old married woman who sells animals. She buys baby goats & calves at low prices, raises them for a year or two, then sells them to the people of her community at higher prices. She earns a good income which helps to meet her household expenditures.

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. This will help her purchase more animals. She will therefore be able to  increase her earnings through increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg Group

texts.en:
Ritanjali is a 27-year-old lady with two children. She lives in a small village called Sankari in Bargarh district of Odisha, India with her husband and her children. A few years back, she started growing vegetables and paddy rice. She grows different types of vegetables in her field, depending upon the demand of her customers and the season. 

The group is requesting a loan of 150,000 INR. Ritanjali will use her part to buy more supplies, such as fertilizers, seeds, manure, etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. 

She is part of a group of ten members, all of whom are women who live in the same community. They named their group “Maa Tarini Self Help Group”, and it is located in the Bargarh district of Odisha, India.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, manure, etc.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah lives in Kitale which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Peniniah is married and has five children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have farmed for twenty years and  are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, horticultural crops and raising livestock. Peninah is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help to pollinate her crops.

This is Peninah's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in her farm. Peninah's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Austine

texts.en:
Austine lives in Kipasi, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people. A market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania, and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

Austine is married and has 17 children. He runs a small business, while his wife is a Community Development Officer. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 30 years now and are currently growing maize, beans, millet, butternut, and cotton on their farm. Austine is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income. He also knows that the bees will provide him with honey for food and medicine.

This is Austine’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to start a poultry farm. Austine’s hope for the future is to help his community to learn about the benefits of beekeeping.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ron Group

texts.en:
Ron is 50 years old. She is a married woman with two children, and lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer, and her husband is a construction worker. Her two children are also construction workers. 

Ron is the leader of this group of borrowers. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family to live in better conditions. In the future, Ron hopes that she can buy a car to provide transportation services to clients.

loans.use: to buy the ground parts of a latrine.
